370100學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：環境科學與⼯程
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Environmental Science and Engineering
任課教師  Instructor ：吳劍侯
上課時間  Time ： R7R8R9 上課教室  Room ：醫環 501 ／ 45
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The objectives of this course are to introduce the application of certain
necessary principles of engineering and science that are required for any
quantitative treatment of environmental problems. The basic, traditional
materials on water supply, wastewater treatment, air pollution control, and solid
and hazardous waste management will be covered. Some of the major environmental
problems of the day will be presented as well.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Masten, S. J. and Davis, M. L. Principles of Environmental Engineering and
Science, 4th International Edition, McGraw-Hill Education, New York, NY, 2020.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Masters, G. M.; Ela, W. P. Introduction to Environmental Engineering and
Science, 3rd Ed., Prentice-Hall, Upper Saddle River, New Jersey, 2008.
2. Davis, M. L.; Cornwell, D. A. Introduction to Environmental Engineering, 5th
Ed., McGraw-Hill Companies, Inc., New York, NY, 2013.
3. Vesilind, P. A. Introduction to Environmental Engineering; PWS Publishing
Company: Boston, MA, 1997.
4. Ray, B. T. Environmental Engineering; PWS Publishing Company: Boston, MA,
1995.
5. Mihelcic, J. R.; Zimmerman, J. B. Environmental Engineering: Fundamentals,
Sustainability, Design, 2nd Ed., Wiley, Hoboken, New Jersey, 2014.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Teaching with power-point files
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Week Topic Reading
1 Introduction Chap. 1
2 Chemistry Chap. 2
3 Biology Chap. 3
4 Materials and Energy Balances Chap. 4
5 Ecosystems Chap. 5
6 1st Midterm Exam Up through Chap. 5
7 Risk Perception, Assessment, and Management Chap. 6
8 Water Quality Management Chap. 9
9-10 Water Treatment Chap. 10
11-12 Wastewater Treatment Chap. 11
13 2nd Midterm Exam Chap. 6, 9, 10, 11
14-17 Air Pollution Chap. 12
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
10% Homework, Report, and Attitude, 60% Midterm Exams (2 times), 30% Final Report

科號  Course Number ： 11120AES
520200學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：綠⾊科技
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Green technology
任課教師  Instructor ：周⼦勤
上課時間  Time ： R5R6R7 上課教室  Room ：醫環 717 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
I. Course descriptions
Green technology is a novel multidisciplinary science, including chemistry,
physics, biology as well as material sciences, to not only monitor, model and
conserve the natural environment and resources, but also curb the negative impacts
of human activities. In this course, basic concepts and applications of green
technology are discussed; furthermore, circular economy for sustainable
environment is also introduced to provide students a picture that how green
technology utilize to our daily life in the future.
II. Students learning outcomes
After studying green technology, students should have the abilities described as
following,
1. To realize the fundamentals and theories of green technology, including
renewable energy, environmental purification/remediation, green
catalysis/materials and circular economy.
2. To have the abilities to distinguish and describe the pros and cons of
different renewable energy.
3. To be familiar with different environmental remediation as well as purification
techniques.
4. To be able to illustrate the content and significance of circular economy.
III. Required texts/materials
Handout and journal articles
IV. Grading
Midterm exam= 30 %, Final exam= 30 ％ , Final report= 40%
V. Course outline
1. The developments of green technology
2. The principles and applications of green technology
3. Renewable energy
4. Green catalysis
5. Green materials
6. Air/water purification
7. Environmental remediation
8. Circular economy

科號  Course Number ： 11120AES
570300學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：汙染⽣態學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Pollution Ecology
任課教師  Instructor ：楊樹森
李清福
上課時間  Time ： T5T6T7 上課教室  Room ：醫環 717 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Pollution ecology course present the major implication between pollutants with
organism and ecosystem from five major prospects, the air pollution, water
pollution, solid waste, soil and sediment pollution. Through the biological
exposure
and bioavailability of pollutants to discuss the initial effects on organism in
different ecosystem. After first exposure, the pollutants from point source pick
up
by organism will disseminate to large area, the derivates of pollutants during
transduction will determine their final fate in environment. The effectiveness
of
pollutant to individual organism depend on the bioaccessibility and
bioavailability.
From individual to population, local community structure will fluctuate after
large
scale population dynamic, the ecosystem will unstable in the final. Without
serving
by stable ecosystem, the survival of human and biosphere will be in
unpredictable
risk. This course content include principle of pollution ecology and some real
pollution cases in different topics, their ecological consequence also discussed
in
class. Aside from lecture in class, attender should take the initiative to
search
different pollution cases to figure out probable ecological effects based on
classroom experience.
Reading material
Selected journal articles and scientific report.
Spellman, F.R. 2017. The Science of Environmental Pollution. 3rd ed., CRC
Press.
Hemond, H.F. & E. J. Fechner. 2015. Chemical fate and transport in the
environment .3rd ed., Amsterdam , Elsevier/Academic Press.
Molles, M.C. & A. Sher. 2018 Ecology: Concepts and Applications (English) 8th
ed., McGraw-Hill Education
Teaching Method
1. Class lecture
2. Autonomous study, special topic term paper writing
Syllabus
2/16： Introduction to pollution ecology: basic concept and current status of
pollution ecology development.
Part 1: Ecosystem and environment
2/23 : Aquatic ecosystem and environment
3/2 : Terrestrial ecosystem and environment
3/9 : Biogeochemical cycle
part 2 : Environmental pollution and their impact on ecosystem
3/16： Characteristics of air pollution and biological exposure
Case introduction: Coal-fired power plant and PM2.5
3/23： Characteristics of soil pollution and biological exposure
Case introduction 1 : Soil pollution monitoring in Taiwan
Case introduction: 2 : Dioxin pollution in soil at An-Shun Factory of Sinopec
(China Petroleum and Chemical Corporation) in Tainan city.
3/30： Characteristics of water pollution and biological exposure
Microorganism, algae, benthic fauna and fish
4/6： Solid and toxic waste, sediment pollution and biological exposure
Case introduction : Green oyster from west coast of Taiwan, the pollution spiral
between water, sediment and oyster
4/13： Vibration and noise, biological exposure and soundscape ecology
4/20 : Midterm test and discussion about term paper preparation
part 3 : The fate of pollutant and dissemination
4/27： Bioaccessibility and bioavailability of pollutants
5/4： Bioconcentration, Bioaccumulation, Biomagnification,
5/11 : Biodegradation and fate of pollutants
part 4 : Ecological consequences of pollution
5/18 : Ecotoxicity, biological tolerance, and alternation of community structure
by pollution effects
5/25 : Biological remediation and ecological succession of degraded habitat
6/1 : HIPPO, biodiversity decreasing from local to global scale
6/8 : Contemporary pollution ecology research prospect
6/15： Final term test
Evaluation standard
1. Midterm test 30%
2. Final term test : 30%
3. Term paper ： 30%
4. General concern ： 10%

中文名稱  Course Title ：環境奈米與⽔處理
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Environmental Nanotechnology for Water Treatment
任課教師  Instructor ：董瑞安
上課時間  Time ： M2M3M4 上課教室  Room ：醫環 501 ／ 45
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Goals:
This course tries to apply environmental nanotechnology to water and wastewater
treatment plants for enhancing the treatment efficiency of pollutants. The
fundamental concepts of nanotechnology and preparation of nanomaterials will be
introduced. In addition ， specific nanomaterials on pollutant removal will be
emphasized.
Time: M2M3M4
Course content:
Chapter 1. Introduction to environmental nanotechnology and water treatment
Chapter 2. Fundamentals ofEnvironmental Nanotechnology
Chapter 3. Fabrication ofNanomaterials
Chapter 4. Fabrication and Application of metal-based Nanomaterials
Chapter 5. Fabrication of Application of metal Oxide-based Photocatalysts
Chapter 6. Fabrication and Application of Porous Materials
Chapter 7. Fabrication and Application of Carbon-based Nanomaterials
Text and Reference Books: Handout and Joumal Papers.
Grading:
Homework assignment 40 %
Mid-term examination and presentation 30 %
Final-term presentation and term paper 30 %

科號  Course Number ：
11120ASTR550000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：恆星形成
英文名稱  Course English Title ： star formation
任課教師  Instructor ：何英宏
上課時間  Time ： R6R7R8 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 501 ／ 25
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This is a graduate level course on star and planet formation. Lectures will cover
a broad range of topics in star formation from clouds, dense cores, protoplanetary
disks, planet formation, Kuiper Belt, meteorites, and exoplanets. It will cover
both theory and observational aspects of star formation. Students should have
prerequisite skills in physics (E&M, quantum), computer programming (python or C),
writing (English), presentation (English), and mathematics.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Books)
Not required:
Accretion processes in Star formation by Hartmann
三、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
1. Lectures
2. Student presentations
四、教學進度  (Syllabus)
Translucent and dense molecular clouds
Physics and Chemistry of cloud collapse
Spectral Energy Distribution
Bipolar outflows and theory of outflows
Pre-main sequence stars
High-mass star formation
Disk evolution and formation
Grain growth and dust composition
Planet formation
Chemical evolution of protostellar matter
Kuiper belt objects and debris disks
Meteorites
Primitive solar system composition
Exoplanets
五、成績考核  (Evaluation)
Problem set, referee report, and presentation.
六、 Website
TBC

11120ASTR592000學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：專題演講⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Colloquium (II)
任課教師  Instructor ：何英宏
上課時間  Time ： F6F7 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 521 ／ 45
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
Giving and listening to presentations, doing literature search, asking
constructive questions, and interacting with colleagues who work on different
topics and in different institutes are all essential professional skills not
only for doing astronomical research but also for careers in many other
disciplines. The weekly colloquia are excellent opportunities for practicing
these skills. For example, thinking about how others give presentations will
help you improve your own. Previewing relevant publications, even just
briefly, will improve understanding of the presentation and inspire deeper
questions. Interacting with visiting speakers will help you learn not only
about science, but also about different perspectives on life and work in the
world of professional astronomy.
● 成績考核 (Evaluation)
Grades of this course will be evaluated based on:
1. Attendance (75%): Please sign in using the sign-up sheet provided by the TA
for each colloquium. Students who attend all regular colloquia on Fridays will
receive full credits in this category. Attendance of the special seminars will
not be counted.
2. Participation (25%): Students are encouraged to interact with the speakers
and reflect on the colloquium. To receive the participation points, please
submit a short report to the TA within one week after the colloquium. Reports
on special seminars will be counted too.
● 可連結之網⾴位址  相關網⾴ (Website)
1. The colloquium schedule can be found on the IoA website:
http://astr.web.nthu.edu.tw
2. Course-related materials (e.g., report template) can be found on the google
classroom that will be sent out.
科號  Course Number ：
11120ASTR600800學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：天文物理的前沿⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Frontier of Astrophysics Seminars II
任課教師  Instructor ：後藤友嗣
上課時間  Time ： TnWnRn 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 501 ／ 25
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
-課程說明  (Course Description)
It is an important task for all researches to keep up with the latest
publications in the field. However, just in astronomy, nearly 40 new
papers are published every day. It is significant amount of work to
keep up with a flood of papers. The purpose of this course is to train
students how to read and understand the essence of new research papers
in a limited amount of time. Students will take no more than one hour
to read a paper of their choice, and take turn to present a short
summary in 10min. A focus is to understand the essence, and not to
understand details. It is not required to read all the details of
paper. At the same time, other students in the class have a good
chance to learn about latest papers, while listening to the speaker.
The instructor will teach a relevant physics/concept to the reviewed
paper after the presentation.
The course is on every Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday from 12:20pm to 13:10pm.
In one session, two papers will be reviewed. Therefore, in one
semester, we will review almost 100 papers.
By the end of the semester, students will be familiar with the latest
progress in astronomy.
Previous knowledge is not required. We would rather learn key concepts
of astronomy, as we come across in research papers. This is a more
practical and realistic way happening in every day research life.
This course will be offered in English.
-參考書籍  (References)
Papers to be presented are selected from the following archive servers.
https://www.benty-fields.com/
https://arxiver.moonhats.com/
http://arxiv.org/list/astro-ph/new
-教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Presentations by students followed by a review by the instructor.
-成績考核 (Evaluation)
Attendance, questions, and presentations.

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Astrophysical Radiative Processes

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course, Astrophysical Radiative Processes (ASTR6200), is one of the core
courses
of the
master program at the Institute of Astronomy, NTHU.
It basically follows the chapters in the text book listed below.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
G. B. Rybicki & A. P. Lightman (1979, 1985)
"Radiative Processes in Astrophysics"
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. M. S. Longair (2011)
High Energy Astrophysics, 3rd edition
2. D. Mihalas (1978)
Stellar Atmospheres, 2nd edition
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
This course will go mainly with classroom lectures. Questions and discussions
in classroom are very much encouraged.
Students should work out all the assignments in the textbook for each chapter.
Students will be asked randomly to demonstrate the homework in classroom.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Ch 1. Fundamentals of Radiative Transfer
Ch 2. Polarization of Radiation Fields
Ch 3. Radiation from Non-relativistic Charges
Ch 4. Radiation from Relativistic Charges
Ch 5. Bremsstrahlung
Ch 6. Synchrotron Radiation and Curvature Radiation
Ch 7. Compton Scattering
Ch 8. Plasma Effects
The mid-term is scheduled on April 24, 2023, and the final exam
on June 12. Both are open-any-book.

科號  Course Number ：
11120ASTR630000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：電波天文學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Radio Astronomy
任課教師  Instructor ：陳惠茹
上課時間  Time ： T6T7T8 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 521 ／ 45
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This course is intended for graduate and senior undergraduate students whose major
is
Physics or Astrophysics. We will discuss various aspects of radio astronomy, such
topics
as the nature of radio signals, signal processing, designs of receiving systems,
atmospheric effects, and observing strategies with modern radio observatories,
including
single-aperture telescopes and interferometric arrays. The class is aimed at
building a
foundation for students to further pursue astrophysical research in the radio
waveband.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Books)
Handouts and lecture slides
三、參考書籍  (References)
1. Tools of Radio Astronomy (5ed) by T.L. Wilson, K. Rohlfs, and S. Huttemeister,
Springer 2009 (ISBN:
9783540851219; electronic version available on campus)
2. Galactic and Extragalactic Radio Astronomy (2ed) by G.L. Verschuur and K.I.
Kellermann (Editors),
Springer-Verlag 1988 (ISBN: 0387965750; out of print)
3. Synthesis Imaging in Radio Astronomy II edited by G. B. Taylor, C. L. Carilli,
and R. A. Perley 1999,
ASPC, 180; available on SAO/NASA ADS
4. Interferometry and Synthesis in Radio Astronomy (2nd ed.) by A. R. Thompson, J.
M. Moran, & G. W.
Swenson, Wiley 2001 (ISBN: 0471254924; electronic version available on campus)
5. Observational Astrophysics (2ed) by P. Lena, F. Lebrun, & F. Mignard, Springer
1998 (ISBN:
3540634827)
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Lectures and projects
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to radio astronomy
2. The nature of radio signals
3. Astrophysical phenomena in the radio waveband
4. Signal processing and receiving systems
5. Atmospheric effects
6. Observing strategies I: single-aperture telescopes
7. Observing strategies II: interferometers and aperture synthesis
六、成績考核  (Evaluation)
Problem sets, project reports, and a final examination
七、可連結之網⾴位址
http://orion.astr.nthu.edu.tw/ra/

科號  Course Number ： 11120BAI
700400學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
20
中文名稱  Course Title ：科學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Science
任課教師  Instructor ：楊立威
上課時間  Time ： T6T7T8 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 614 ／ 16
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Purpose of this class - Nourish the awareness of and habit of scientific thinking
and doing, motivated by why doing so and how to do it right.
Exemplified Material - https://www.khanacademy.org/science/high-school-biology/hs-
biology-foundations/hs-biology-and-the-scientific-method/v/the-scientific-method
Teaching Methods - Lecturing & Group Discussions
Syllabus -
Week 0 – Being a scientist and upholding research integrity (remote talk)
Week 1-3 – Definition of Science, scientific methods and thinking, types of
control and normalization https://youtu.be/VhZyXmgIFAo
Week 4-6 – Principle of Science – hypothesis, predictability, types of modeling,
reproducibility
Week 7,8 – Basic Statistics and how to read math;
definition, definition and definition
Week 9,10 – Communication empathy and presentation (Listening & Speaking &
Writing; understanding writing and verbal expression as a function of the depth
of
understanding)
Week 11,12 – Hands-on practice in scientific data handling and writing
Week 14 – the culture/good practice of science
Week 15 – The structure & function of and human relation within a laboratory,
peer review in journal publication and grant application
Week 16 to last – Group presentations & Evaluation
Evaluation -
Final Presentation (65%) -
Groups write research proposals (or tender/ 標案 ), present the proposals to a grant
review committee constituted by a selected member from each group in order to
compete a fixed amount of budget; the goal of grant review committee is to see the
highest possible economic gain and/or highest possible impact on scientific
research.
Rated by group presentations where individual score is also weighted by member-
rated contributions
Class Participation (10%)
Quizzes – statistics and probability (10%),
listening and presentation practices (7%)
Thoughts reflected on the Integrity Talk delivered by Dr Elisabeth Bik (8%)
Homework Bonus (10%) –
sleep >6 hrs per day;
make daily gratitude;
meditate for 10 mins per day;
exercise >20 mins per day;
Itemizing what we will be teaching; the content includes but limited to -
Structure of Science;
what is control? how many types of controls? why must we have comparisons and
controls? why normalization is needed?
how many ways are there to normalize your data? everyday statistics for life
science? p-value?
why must you have a hypothesis in research? why do they report so many data?
simply showing the efforts or ruling out the alternative hypotheses ？
Think counter examples for your hypothesis and proposed methodology to tackle a
problem.
Why are rules, principles and models seek in science? can science go without
these?
Let the claims be supported by the evidence.
Understand the difference between the goal and the data/results one get. Do the
results address the goal?
Communications; Communicate your research (what should be in abstract,
introduction, results, methods, discussions?)
Type of papers (research articles, reviews, comments/debate, Rxiv/bioRxiv)
Active reading, passive reading and google search (how to use, not to use certain
keywords).
How to listen? how to teach? why teaching is needed? why peer-review environment
is needed?
How is science reviewed? current system of peer review? what are citation and
impact factors?
what do reviewers and editors want in addition to that you want your papers to be
published?
what are the questions reviewers are asked in the evaluation of a manuscript?
Authorship & collaboration?
Credits?
Reproducibility;
how to cite my own or others' thesis and paper? Other research integrity issues.
how to write a grant proposal? how is it reviewed?
Lab structure - how does a lab run? why do you get stipend for your lab? why are
you called part-time RA?
Can I or when I can initiate a new research in the lab? Should I help others'
research in the lab? why?
Human relation in lab, each member's goal in the lab and sufficient communication
with your PI and school to solve interpersonal conflicts.
team work, not your work; what do they mean a good team player?
Common misbeliefs in graduate school.
how are we conditioned by trainings before graduate school which contradicts what
a good research needs.
Good scientific practice - forgetting about exams - doing it correctly weighs much
more than doing it fast; obedience or skeptical? no prejudice is difficult.
planning and milestones (practice),
There is no "good" but there is "better" in science; turning adjectives into
comparative terms.
intellectual properties; do you own what your lab owns or schools owns?
basic ideas of patent filing and tech transfer;

師
⽣四⾄七年的相處時間相當⻑，⼀兩⾯之緣決定未來數年的師⽣關係，或某個專業領域是否合適，能
有個
⼀個學期的緩衝與評估，對專業選擇及甚⾄畢業年線縮短都有幫助。曾⼀個實驗室以上待過的學⽣也
較能
分辨某個教導內容是多半的老師均會做的教導，還是該教授的特殊偏好與⾏為。

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course will discuss the design and synthesis methodologies of inorganic nanomaterials for biomedical
applications with focus on its use for imaging techniques, drug delivery, biosensors, and thermal therapy.

none

2005 Wiley-VCH.
2. T. K. Sau and A. L. Rogach (Eds.), Complex-shaped metal Nanoparticles, 2012 Wiley-VCH.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Powerpoint presentation
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to nanotechnology
2. Gold and Silver-synthesis methods, biofunctionalization, assembly, optical property, and applications
3. Iron-synthesis methods and applications
4. Carbon-synthesis methods and applications
5. Semiconductor-synthesis methods and applications

科號  Course Number ： 11120BME
501500學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
24
中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣物醫學技術
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Techniques in Biology and Medicine
任課教師  Instructor ：陳韻晶
上課時間  Time ： M5M6M7 上課教室  Room ：清實 826 ／ 24
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is an introduction of techniques in Biology and Medicine including the
methods
and tools
applied in research in the area, and cutting edge technologies, which impacts the
basic
research and clinic
application in Biology and Medicine. Lecture discussions focus on the following
topics:
‧ Review of molecular biology
‧ Nucleic acid technology
‧ Protein technology
‧ Molecular diagnosis, monoclonal antibodies, microarray, library screening.
‧ Drug delivery and vaccine design.
‧ Human molecular genetics, gene therapy and genome editing
‧ Experimental animal model, Transgenic and knockout mice
‧ Stem cell technology
⼆、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Exam 50%
Class Discussions and presentation 40%
Attendance 10%
List of Lecture
1. Introduction of the course
2. Introduction of Biotechnology
3. Nucleic Acid technology I
4. Nucleic Acid technology II
5. Gene Therapy and genome editing technology
6. Protein technology I
7. Protein technology II
8. Vaccine technology
9. Molecular Diagnosis and drug discovery – Arrays and Libraries.
10. Animal Biotechnology – transgenic and knockout animals, Disease models,
Imagine
Technology.
11. Micro and Nanotechnology
12. biotechnology in tissue engineering and stem cell biology
課程簡介  :
本堂課將深入淺出的介紹⽣物醫學技術 , 課程內容涵蓋基本細胞分⼦⽣物學背景 ; 進⾏⽣醫基礎研究
時在實驗室應⽤的
各種實驗技術 ; 臨床藥物或檢測技術的開發 ; 先進醫學技術例如基因治療 , 基因編輯等技術的探討 ; 奈
米化學材料於⽣
醫技術和醫療上的應⽤ … 等 .
授課⽅式：
本課程為研究所課程 , 上課⽅式合併⼀般講課  (75%) 和課堂⼩組討論  (25%),
每⼀單元皆設計 3~4 個開放性討論問題 ,
培養同學獨立思考和研究能⼒ , 教師亦參與討論並給予回饋 .
評分⽅式：
包含⼀次課堂⼝頭報告（英文）以及兩次筆試 .
筆試內容 80% 來⾃ “ 學⽣出題 ”, 訓練同學 “ 問好問題 ”
(公開題⽬並於課堂上討論 ).

502000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：無機材料與⼯程
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Inorganic Materials and Engineering
任課教師  Instructor ：萬德輝
上課時間  Time ： T6T7T8 上課教室  Room ：清實 826 ／ 24
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course introduces fundamental optics of plasmonic materials with an emphasis on the underlying
mechanisms and their applications. Topics include Surface plasmon polaritons at metal/insulator interfaces,
localized surface plasmons, plasmon waveguides and sensors.
本⾨課將分為上下學期教授，涵蓋無機材料的基礎光學性質 ( 上學期 ) 以及表⾯電漿 ( 下學期 ) ，並著重介
紹無機材料在⽣醫⼯程及奈米光電之應⽤。在下學期的課程中，將以良好光學基礎為主軸，引導學⽣
從邏輯思考進⽽瞭解⾦屬材料的表⾯電漿原理，同時增強學⽣應有的實驗理論，包含基礎電磁波理
論、⾦屬 / 介電材料界⾯電漿現象、定域表⾯電漿共振，並進⾏其在國際間尖端應⽤之介紹。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Lecture notes
三、參考書籍 (References)
D. J. Simmons and K. Potter, "Optical materials", 2000, Elesvier.
S. A. Maier, "Plasmonics: Fundamental and Applications", 2007, Springer.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Powerpoint presentation
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1.Electromagnetics of metals
2.Surface plasmon polaritons at metal/insulator interfaces
3.Localized surface plasmons
4.Plasmon waveguides
5.Sensors

introduction to molecular imaging, (2) fluorescence & near infrared (NIR)
molecular imaging & therapy, (3) X-ray molecular imaging & therapy, (4)
radioactive molecular imaging & therapy, (5) magnetic resonance imaging

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course will consist of lecture topics, concept of laboratory technique and
periodic examinations. The overall emphasis will be made on basic biology and
medicine. The students are expected to develop a comprehensive understanding of
fundamental and modern development in biology. This course is designed for the
undergraduate students interested in life science and biomedicine even though
without biology background.

Physiology. 6th Ed.

8 DNA Technology: Genetic Engineering

中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣物與材料實驗
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Biology and Biomedical Materials Laboratory
任課教師  Instructor ：莊淳宇  CHUANG CHUN YU
上課時間  Time ： M5M6M7M8 上課教室  Room ：醫環 101 ／ 56
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程⼤綱：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This is an experimental course for students interested in the application of
biology and biomedical materials in biomedical engineering related sciences. It
will teach the basic technique for conducting research in the fields of
biomedical
engineering sciences.
課程設計涵蓋兩個⾯向：
I ⽣醫材料：
(a)⽣化⼩分⼦與蛋⽩質⼤分⼦材料之製備與性質分析
(b)⽣物⾼分⼦與奈米粒⼦之製備與性質分析
II ⽣醫分析：
(a)材料與蛋⽩質之耦合分析
(b)材料與細胞之耦合分析
(c)細胞分析
課程精神為⽣醫分析可經由⽣醫材料的製備以進⾏⽣物系統的探索。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Handouts will be provided in the class.
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Laboratory
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
採分組上課，詳細分組時段於第⼀周上課宣布。
課程內容包含：
Exp1/討論 1 ： Preparation of the substrate for beta-galactosidase ( 半乳糖⽔解脢受體之
製備 ) (俞鐘⼭教授 )
Exp2/討論 2 ： Preparation and swelling characterization of pH-sensitive hydrogels
(酸鹼應答型⽔膠製備與膨潤性質分析 ) ( 邱信程教授 )
Exp3/討論 3 ： Synthesis of Ferrofluid and the Properties under External Magnet ( 磁
流體的製備與在磁場下的作⽤ ) ( 胡尚秀教授 )
Exp4/討論 4 ： Gold nanoparticles: Synthesis, characterization and determination of
BSA adsorption. ( 黃郁棻教授 )
Exp5/討論 5 ： Polymer/protein microparticles preparation and gel electrophoresis
(⾼分⼦ /
蛋⽩質 ?993; ⼦製備與膠體電泳 ) ( 張建文教授 )
Exp6/討論 6 ： Extraction and gene determination of nucleic acid from cell line:
Polymerase chain reaction ( ⽣物細胞核酸萃取和基因偵測：聚合 %238; 鏈鎖反應 ) ( 莊淳宇教授 )
Exp7/討論 7 ： Cell Phenotyping by Immunofluorescence ( 應⽤免疫螢光染⾊法分析細胞死活與
細胞表⾯抗原 ) ( 李亦淇教授 )
Exp8/討論 8 ： Preparation of Plasmonic Substrates for Label-Free Optical Biosensing
(表⾯電漿共振材料製備於無標記光學感測之應⽤ ) ( 劉耕⾕教授 )

11120BMES325300學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：光學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Optics
任課教師  Instructor ：陳之碩
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F3 上課教室  Room ：醫環 101 ／ 56
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
1.Course Description:
This course aims to provide students an overview of fundamental optics and
related optical
applications in biomedical field.
It is a one-semester based introduction to optics.
In this class, we will essentially introduce geometrical optics and wave
optics.
In geometrical optics, ray-tracing, lens design, basic optical instruments
will be covered.
In wave optic, wave equations, interference, diffraction, image formation,
coherence, polarization will be discussed.
This course aims to provide students an overview of fundamental optics and to
introduce related optical applications in biomedical field.
2.Text Book: Introduction to Optics, Frank L. Pedrotti
3.Teaching Methods: 2 sections per week; one 2-hr section , and one 1-hr
section
4.Syllabus:
R26;Nature of Light
R26;Geometrical Optics
R26;Optical Instrumentation
R26;Wave Equations
R26;Superposition of Waves
R26;Interference of Light
R26;Optical Interferometry
R26;Coherence
R26;Fraunhofer Diffraction
R26;Fresnel Diffraction
R26;Light Polarization
5.Evaluation: Mid term I (30%), Mid term I (30%), Final Exam (30%),
Homework/quiz (10%)

科號  Course Number ：
11120BMES424400學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
30
中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣醫⾼分⼦導論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction of Biomedical Polymer
任課教師  Instructor ：胡尚秀
上課時間  Time ： W7W8W9 上課教室  Room ：醫環 717 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This course is designed to provide background in basic polymer chemistry,
biomedical
polymer and recent advances in smart polymers for applications in
pharmaceutics,
biomaterials, tissue engineering and biotechnology.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Books)
1. Charles E. Carraher, Jr., Polymer Chemistry 7/e.
2. J. S. Temenoff and A. G. Mikos, Biomaterials: The Intersection of Biology
and
Materials Science, Pearson, International Edition, 2008.
三、參考書籍  (References)
1. B. D. Ratner, Biomaterials Science, 3rd Ed., 2013.
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Lectures
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to Polymers
2. Polymer Structures: Introduction to polymers, Synthetic polymers, Natural
polymers
3. Polymer Syntheses: Addition (chain-growth) polymerization, Step-growth
polymerization, Ring-opening polymerization
4. Polymer Solution Properties: Dimension of an ideal polymer chain,
Statistical
thermodynamics of polymer solution, Dilute polymer solution, Frictional
property
5. Polymer Bulk Properties: Transition behaviors, Viscoelsticity and
mechanical
behavior, Rubber elasticity, Swelling theory of network polymer, Diffusion in
polymers
and hydrogels
6. Smart Polymers: Stimuli-sensitive polymers, Biodegradable polymers,
7. Polymers in Tissue Engineering and Cell Delivery
8. Soluble Drug Carriers/Polymeric Micelles: Polymeric soluble drug carrier,
Polymeric
micelles and nanoparticles
9. Polyelectrolytes
10. Polymers in Pharmaceutics: Polymers & macromolecules in controlled drug
delivery
11. Polymers in Biotechnology: Polymers in separation, Self-organizing
polymers
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
30% The 1st Midterm Exam, 30% The 2nd Midterm Exam, 30% Final Exam, 10% On-
class
discussion, 100% Total

落實
《巴黎協定》 (Paris Agreement) 減碳救地球免於暖化威脅，唯減碳⾏動有共識卻毫無執⾏能⼒，僅期
望於
本世紀內的全球均溫較⼯業⾰命前增加幅度不得超過 1.5°C 。扣除⽬前因⼯業化排碳造成的全球暖化，
較⼯業
⾰命前的年均溫早已超過攝⽒ 1.2°C ，到天花板只剩  0.3°C 可揮霍。當下⼈類要達成完全沒約束⼒與制
裁⼒的
《巴黎協定》預想⽬標，除了德國與紐⻄蘭率先立法將於 2050 年達致⼯業淨零排碳外，對其它各國
⾔，執政
者僅議⽽不決、決⽽不⾏，⼯業碳中和幾乎是「不可能的任務」，⼈類只能⾯對排碳帶來⾃食惡果的
全球暖化
浩劫！

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Fundamentals of Biophotonics
任課教師  Instructor ：陳之碩
上課時間  Time ： M2M3M4 上課教室  Room ：醫環 105 ／ 15
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
1.Course Description:
The course aims to provide a multidisciplinary scope of biophotonics for
health
care. Basic knowledge is provided for students can rapidly acquire the minimal
necessary background for fundamental research, and a broad range of biomedical
applications will be discussed to strengthen the capacity of bioinstrument
development.
Couse starts from fundamental optics, including geometrical optics and wave
propagations. Basic cell biology is introduced from biophysical perspective.
Various microscopies (FREP, LSCM, optical tweezers), optical biosensors (SPR,
Fiber, fluorescence sensing), and photodynamic therapy in clinics will be
covered.
2.Reference Books:
R26;Introduction to Biophotonics, Paras N.Prasad
R26;Introduction to Optics, Frank L. Pedrotti
R26;Physical biology of the cell, Rob Phillips, Jane Kondev, Julie Theriot
3.Teaching Methods:
Lectures and discussions.
Student presentations are required
4.Syllabus:
1.Fundamentals of Light
2.Geometrical optics
3.Interference of Light
4.Basics of Biology
5.Equilibrium in the living cell
6.Random walks of Macromolecules
7.Mathematics of Water
8.Principle of Laser and laser technology
9.Bioimaging: Principle and Technology
10.Bioimaging : Applications
11.Optical biosensors
12.Biomedical instruments
13.Tissue engineering with light
5.Evaluation:
Mid term I (30%), Mid term II (30%),
Final Project (40%),

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
課程⼤綱：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This course is to provide the students an introduction to the fundamental
concepts of controlled drug delivery systems, types of drug carriers that have
been and/or are being developed and, particularly, detail descriptions in
both
the preparation approaches and mechanisms of their actions to achieve drug
controlled delivery. For comprehensively understanding the rationales of drug
delivery design with desired biodistribution profiles, pharmacokinetics and
biopharmaceutics are partially introduced in this course.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Books)
No textbooks
三、參考書籍  (References)
1. R. Duncan, L. W. Seymour, Controlled Release Technology, Elsevier, 1989.
2. R. Baker, Controlled Release of Biologically Active Agents, Wiley, 1987.
3. L. Shargel, A. B. C. Yu, Applied Biopharmaceutics and Pharmacokinetics, 2nd
Ed., ACC, 1985.
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Lectures
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
Contents
1. Concepts of drug controlled release
2. Nanomedicines for cancer treatments
3. Liposomes
4. Hydrogels
5. Other devices
6. Pharmacokinetics

科號  Course Number ：
11120BMES526600學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
30
中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣醫⾼分⼦應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Polymer for Bio-Applications
任課教師  Instructor ：胡尚秀
上課時間  Time ： F2F3F4 上課教室  Room ：醫環 717 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
The aim of the course is to provide detailed knowledge of the structure,
function, properties and applications of biopolymers. Polymer Physics and
chemistry for some biological structures such as collagen, soft tissue, silk,
and artificial polymer is emphasized. The concept of nature as a model for
polymeric materials is discussed. Survey and introduction to biomedical
polymer including drug delivery, regenerative medicine, biosensor and other
bio-applications are conducted.
Maker Project!
Thinking design of a project: the students have to figure out the problems in
real life or situation, and design a simple "device or software or idea" to prove
the proto-type materials.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Books)
1. B. D. Ratner, Biomaterials Science, 3rd Ed., 2013.
2. J. S. Temenoff and A. G. Mikos, Biomaterials: The Intersection of Biology
and Materials Science, Pearson, International Edition, 2008.
三、參考書籍  (References)
1. Charles E. Carraher, Jr., Polymer Chemistry 7/e.
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Lectures
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to Polymers
2. Polymer properties: transition behaviors, viscoelsticity and mechanical
behavior, rubber elasticity, swelling theory of network polymer, diffusion in
polymers and hydrogels
(~11 weeks)Maker Project!
3. Thinking design of a project: the students have to figure out the problems in
real life or situation, and design a simple "device or software or idea" to prove
the proto-type materials.

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Biomedical Epidemiology and Environmental Toxicology
任課教師  Instructor ：莊淳宇  CHUANG CHUN YU
上課時間  Time ： W2W3W4 上課教室  Room ：醫環 419 ／ 20
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is designed for graduate students. The completion of a Human Genome
Project has significant implications for molecular biology, medical epidemiology
and environmental toxicology. New molecular techniques are based on a better
understanding of genes and their actions rapidly proliferate into laboratories;
thus, the students need to have a broad knowledge of metabolism, mechanisms and
effects of toxicants and epidemiology in human population. This course spans
from basics of biochemical processes that are affected by toxicants to molecular
mechanisms of action, and to current experimental approaches in epidemiology and
toxicology.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
1. Curtis D. Klaassen and John B. Watkins III. Casarett & Doull's Essentials of
Toxicology.
2. Leon Gordis. Epidemiology: with STUDENT CONSULT Online Access.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. John Timbrell. The poison paradox – Chemicals as friends and foes. Oxford
University Press.
2. Chris Kent. Basics of toxicology. Wiley-Liss, A John Wiley & Sons, Inc.,
Publication.
3. Gary D. Friedman. Primer of Epidemiology. McGraw-Hill.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture
Presentation
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction
2. Epidemiology and Toxicology
3. metabolism: absorption, distribution and excretion of Toxicants
4. Biotransformation of xenobiotics
5. Modification factors of toxic effect
6. Molecular biology of toxicity: reactive oxygen species, heavy metals,
pesticides, radiation, pathogens, carcinogen, etc.
7. Toxicology techniques
8. Description epidemiology
9. Analytic epidemiology
10. Molecular epidemiology
11. Experimental study design in practice (Statistics): Excel, SPSS, SigmaPlot
12. Toxicogenomics: DNA damage and repair, genetic polymorphisms (ecotoxicology)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Midterm (open book): 60%
Presentation & Discussion: 40%

67
中文名稱  Course Title ：資訊系統應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Computer Systems & Applications
任課教師  Instructor ：林昆翰
上課時間  Time ： T7T8T9 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  B18 ／ 160
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Python是⼀種簡單易學，功能強⼤的編程語⾔，它有⾼效率的⾼層數據結構，簡單⽽有效地實現
⾯向對象編程。  Python 簡潔的語法和對動態輸入的⽀持，再加上解釋性語⾔的本質，使得它在⼤
多數平台上的許多領域都是⼀個理想的腳本語⾔，特別適⽤於快速的應⽤程式開發。 MATLAB ⼀種
⽤於演算法開發、資料視覺化、資料分析以及數值計算的進階技術計算語⾔和互動式環境，被廣泛
運⽤於⼯程計算與模擬。本課程將以 Python 為主軸，使學⽣具有編程並解決⼯程和數學問題，若
時間允許將會簡介⼀些 MATLAB 的功能。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
無
三、參考書籍 (References)
無
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
原則上每周三堂課會有兩堂課的 PPT 講解以及⼀堂課的實作，實作課學⽣必須⾃⾏攜帶筆電進⾏
Python/MATLAB 的實際操作，課程的習題及舉例會以化⼯⼤⼆學⽣學習過（或未來會學到的）
必修課程為主。為了讓學⽣能夠盡量熟悉 Python 這⾨語⾔，除了課堂上的實作之外，每週也都
有作業讓學⽣能夠更熟悉這⾨語⾔。最後，期末學⽣會結合課堂上所學過的⼯具，以⼩組⽅式
做⼀個⼩ project ，以達學以致⽤的⽬的。
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
本課程嘗試以解決實際科學問題所需要的⽅法和⼯具作為切入點，使學⽣有明確的學習⽬標。⽬前
規劃的教學進度如下（視教學情況可能予以調整）：
。PYTHON 的的安裝與基本介紹 (Anaconda, JupyterNotebook, Google colab)
。資料型態、操作與運算
。基本數值計算與線性代數 (Numpy)
。科學繪圖 (Matplotlib)
。曲線擬合 (Scipy)
。微分⽅程 ( 數值解 Scipy 與解析解 Sympy)
。資料處理與爬蟲 (Pandas, requests)
。建構分⼦模型與視覺化 (RDKit)
。分⼦與材料模擬簡介 (ASE)
。MATLAB 基本功能簡介 (optional)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
作業每週⼀次 ( 共 13 次 ) ，⼀次 5% ，共 65%
期末分組報告  35%

中文名稱  Course Title ：化⼯單操
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Chemical Engineering Unit Operations
任課教師  Instructor ：汪上曉  David Shan Hill Wong
上課時間  Time ： T1T2F2 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  211 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程將介紹如何應⽤化學⼯程科學之原理（如質能結算、熱⼒學及輸送現象）分析及設計實際
化⼯製程單元操作。內容包括：
[1] 動量傳送操作如：泵、壓縮機、管件、管路、攪拌槽，
[2] 多階平衡及質傳操作如：蒸餾、吸收、萃取、吸附、層析，
[3] 熱傳及熱質傳操作如：熱交換器、蒸發、乾燥。
能⼒訓練重點為：
[1] 尺度分析及放⼤設計能⼒、
[2] 蒐集數據能⼒、
[3] 使⽤電腦輔助設計軟體如 ASPEN Plus, DYNOCHEM 能⼒、
[4] 納入安全係數能⼒、遵守⼯程標準能⼒、
[5] 計劃管理，團隊協作能⼒
[6] 報告，溝通及英語能⼒
This course shall introduce the application of fundamental principles of
chemical engineering such as material and energy balance, thermodynamics,
transport phenomena to design chemical process unit operation equipment.
Actual operations that will be covered include
[1] momentum transfer operations such as pump, compressors, piping, piping
network, agitation tank;
[2] multistage equilibrium and mass transfer operations such as:
distillation,absorption, extraction, adsorption and chromatography,
[3] heat and heat transfer operations such as heat exchangers, evaportaion and
drying.
Training focuses will be on students' abilities:
[1] to do dimensional analysis and scaleup,
[2] to collect necessary information and data,
[3] to use computer aided design software such as ASPEN Plus,
[4] to include reasonable safety margins and conform to engineering standards,
[5] to work as a team and present results effectively,
[6] to present results, communicate with peers and superiors , and speak
English.

後。

homework problems and other reference materials are made available on elearn
system. Common reference books are listed below.
"Unit Operations of Chemical Engineering", 6th edition, W.L. McCabe, J.C.
Smith
and P. Harriot, 2001 (McGraw-Hill International Edition)
"Chemical Engineering", vol. 2, 4th ed., Coulson and Richardson, Pergamon,
Oxford,
(1991).
"Transport Processes and Unit Operations", Geankoplis, Prentice-Hall, (1993).

353001學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
35
中文名稱  Course Title ：輸送現象及單元操作⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Transport Phenomena and Unit Operations(II)
任課教師  Instructor ：黃振煌
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W1W2 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  210 ／ 67
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The course content focuses on the theory and related operations of heat transport and mass transport. Heat
transport part, including: conduction, convection and radiation. The unit operations related to heat transfer are
then introduced, including: boiling and condensation, evaporation, and heat transfer equipment. The mass
transport part includes: diffusive mass transport and convective mass transport. Next, the unit operations of
mass transport are described, including absorption and air stripping, humidity conditioning and cooling water,
distillation, extraction, drying, crystallization, and membrane separation.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Bird, R.B., W.E. Stewart, and E.N. Lightfoot, "Transport Phenomena," Revised 2nd ed., Wiley (2007)
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. 王茂齡 , “ 輸送現象 ” ⾼立圖書  (1993)
2. Stanley & Middleman, “An Introduction to Fluid Dynamics,” Wiley (1998).
3. R.B. Bird, W.E. Stewart, E.N. Lightfoot, and D.J. Klingenberg, “Introductory Transport Phenomena”, 1st
ed., Wiley (2015)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
投影片講解
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
ENERGY TRANSPORT (Chapter 9-16)
- Thermal Conductivity and the Mechanisms of Energy Transport.
- Shell Energy Balances and Temperature Distributions in Solids and Laminar Flow.
- The Equations of Change for Nonisothermal Systems.
- Temperature Distributions with More than One Independent Variable.
- Temperature Distributions in Turbulent Flow.
- Interphase Transport in Nonisothermal Systems.
- Macroscopic Balances for Nonisothermal Systems.
- Energy Transport by Radiation.
MASS TRANSPORT (Chapter 17-24)
- Diffusivity and the Mechanisms of Mass Transport.
- Concentration Distributions in Solids and Laminar Flow.
- Equations of Change for Multicomponent Systems.
- Concentration Distributions with More than One Independent Variable.
- Concentration Distributions in Turbulent Flow.
- Interphase Transport in Nonisothermal Mixtures.
- Macroscopic Balances for Multicomponent Systems.
- Other Mechanisms for Mass Transport.

Final Presentation 20%

中文名稱  Course Title ：電⼦構裝技術與材料
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Electronic Packaging technology and materials
任課教師  Instructor ：陳信文
上課時間  Time ： F5F6F7 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  210 ／ 67
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Electronic packaging is to connect integrated circuits and other electronic
components together in a system so that the designed functions of the system can
be performed. The electronic packaging industry belongs to the latter part of
the electronic industry, and is interdependent with the integrated circuit
manufacturing industry. This course introduces the manufacturing processes and
materials used in electronic packaging, so that students have an understanding
of the field of electronic packaging. In the future, students can use this
foundation, plus their own original expertise, as the starting point for entry
and contribution to the field of electronic industry.

8. Transfer molding and molding compounds (II)

(光電材料與元件基礎  2 學分 )

教育化⼯系的同學，使認識光電材料與光電元件的基礎及其製程，俾便未來運⽤化學⼯程技術在這

of optoelectronic materials and optoelectronic components and the processing,
enabling the future use of chemical engineering related industries.

中文名稱  Course Title ：分⼦⼯程⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Molecular Engineering (II)
任課教師  Instructor ：周鶴修
上課時間  Time ： T6T7T8 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  221 ／ 25
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
CHE 500200 分⼦⼯程⼆ (Molecular Engineering (II))
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程與《分⼦⼯程 ( ⼀ ) 》為⼯學院分⼦⼯程學程碩⼠班必修課 , 將本學程四⼤重點 ( 超分⼦結構
調控、分⼦光電、分⼦流變與精密加⼯、分⼦模擬 ) 做綜合性的介紹，使同學們對分⼦⼯程有全
⾯性的暸解，作為培養跨學⾨性質的⾼階研發⼈才的基礎；其中《分⼦⼯程 ( ⼀ ) 》涵括量⼦原
理與光電性質，《分⼦⼯程 ( ⼆ ) 》則著重於分⼦設計、奈米材料與結構製程、能源轉換技術、元件製
作(bottom-up
and top-down) 。
Molecular Engineering (I) and (II) are the required courses for the master program of
Molecular Engineering Program in the College of Engineering. The comprehensive
contents of this course are to introduce the four points, control structure for super
molecular, photoconductive molecular, molecular rheology with precision machining and
molecular simulation. The course aims to integrate talents of students from various,
particularly the molecular engineering science then develop the basis of the
interdisciplinary or R & D talent. Molecular Engineering (I) includes Quantum principle and
photoconductive properties. Molecular Engineering (II) is major Molecular design, nanometer material,
nanometer structure process, energy conversion technology, and device fabrication from bottom-up and top-
down.

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is aimed for advanced aspects of heat/mass transfer and relevant
engineering applications.
指定⽤書 (Text Books)
None
參考書籍 (References)
R.B. Bird, W.E. Steward & E.N. Lightfoot, "Transport Phenomena," Wiley: New
York,
2002.
教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures and discussion sessions when necessary.
教學進度 (Syllabus)
Energy Transport
1. Thermal Conductivity and the Mechanisms of Energy Transport
2. Shell Energy Balances and Temperature Distributions in Solids and Laminar
Flow
3. The Equations of Change for Nonisothermal Systems
4. Temperature Distributions with More than One Independent Variable
5. Temperature Distributions in Turbulent Flow
6. Interphase Transport in Nonisothermal Systems
7. Macroscopic Balances for Nonisothermal Systems
Mass Transport
8. Diffusivity and the Mechanisms of Mass Transport
9. Concentration Distributions in Solids and Laminar Flow
10. Equations of Change for Multicomponent Systems
11. Concentration Distributions with More than One Independent Variable
12. Concentration Distributions in Turbulent Flow
13. Interphase Transport in Nonisothermal Mixtures
14. Macroscopic Balances for Multicomponent Systems
15. Other Mechanisms for Mass Transport
Special Topics
15. Transport in Fuel Cells
16. Transport phenomena in microchannels/microfluidics
成績考核 (Evaluation)
1. Homework assignments & in-class performance: 40%
2. Two midterm exams: 20% x 2 = 40%
2. Final exam: 20%

中文名稱  Course Title ：⾼分⼦⽣物材料
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Macromolecules as Biomaterials
任課教師  Instructor ：王潔
上課時間  Time ： T2T3T4 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  621 ／ 30
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、  課程說明 (Course Description)
This course covers the application of synthetic and natural macromolecules as biomaterial. Topics include
molecular structure, polymer synthesis reactions, proteins, DNA and enzymes as functional materials,
molecular surface engineering, multifunctional organic materials, including polymeric nanoreactors,
conducting polymers and virus-mediated biomineralization. Students are expected to develop basic
understanding of the role macromolecules as biomaterials.
⼆、  指定⽤書 (Text Books)
N/A
三、  參考書籍 (References)
Recent Articles
The Nanobiotechnology Handbook
Nanotechnology and Tissue Engineering

2 T 2 Bonding and Isomers/Chirality
3 T 3 Step-growth Polymerization
4 T 4 Polyesters, Polyamides, and Poly(ester amide)s
5 T 5 Polypeptides and Proteins
6 T 6 Proteins
7 T 7 Polymers in Medicine
8 T 8 Exam I
9 T 9 Enzyme
10 T 10 DNA
11 T 11 DNA as Building Blocks for Medicine
12 T 12 Self-assembling Monolayer
13 T 13 Lipids as Self-organizing Materials
14 T 14 Biomineralization
15 T 15 Viruses as Biomaterial
16 T 16 Surface Functionalization
17 T 17 Exam II
18 T 18 Final Presentation

科號  Course Number ： 11120CHE
546500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：⾼等⾼分⼦物理
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Special Topics in Condensed Polymer Physics
任課教師  Instructor ：陳信龍
上課時間  Time ： R2R3R4 上課教室  Room ：化⼯ 220 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程主要講解⾼分⼦的基本物理特性，內容包括： (1) ⾼分⼦鏈構形統計⼒學、 (2) ⾼分⼦溶液熱⼒
學、 (3)⾼分⼦玻璃轉化現象、 (4) ⾼分⼦結晶形態學、 (5) ⾼分⼦結晶熱⼒學與動⼒學、 (6) ⾼分⼦黏
彈性。
This course will cover the essential concepts for understanding the physical
properties of polymers. Specific topics to be covered include (1) conformational
statistics of single chain, (2) polymer solution thermodynamics, (3) glass
transition, (4) polymer crystallization, and (5) viscoelasticity.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
1.⾼分⼦物理講義  (Lecture notes)
2.M. Rubintein Grand R. H. Colby, Polymer Physics, Oxford.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. G Strobl, The Physics of Polymer
2. Sperling, Introduction to Physical Polymer Science
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture 3/4; Discussion secession 1/4
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
(1)⾼分⼦鏈構形統計⼒學  conformational statistics of single chain
(2)⾼分⼦溶液熱⼒學  polymer solution thermodynamics
(3)⾼分⼦玻璃轉化現象  glass transition
(1)⾼分⼦結晶形態學  morphology of crystallie polymers
(2)⾼分⼦結晶熱⼒學與動⼒學  crystallization thermodynamics and kinetics of polymers
(3)⾼分⼦黏彈性  viscoelasticity
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Mid term exam: 50%
Final exam: 50%

科號  Course Number ： 11120CHE
549000學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
30
中文名稱  Course Title ：⾼分⼦加⼯
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Polymer Processing
任課教師  Instructor ：張榮語  Rong-Yeu Chang
上課時間  Time ： R6R7R8 上課教室  Room ：化⼯ 220 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
介紹⾼分⼦加⼯所需知識及 CAE 模擬分析軟體實務應⽤，包含：
1. ⾼分⼦加⼯特性：流變學、 PVT 狀態、熱性質、反應動⼒性質、機械性質等
2. ⾼分⼦加⼯製程及原理：射出成型、押出成形、吹塑成型、熱塑成型、壓縮成型、轉注成型、 IC
封裝
3. CAE模擬分析軟體：軟體操作及案例應⽤
通過本課程可習得⾼分⼦加⼯的基礎原理、了解常⾒的成形（型）問題及成因，並能應⽤ CAE ⼯具解
決問題，學習降低產品開發及⽣產成本的⽅法。本課程以 CAE 報告及成型知識測驗考核學習成效。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
1. 模流分析理論與實務，王茂齡、張榮語、許嘉翔，科盛科技股份有限公司出版 (2018) ， ISBN
9789571197395
2. Understanding Polymer Processing 2E Processes and Governing Equations, Tim A.
Osswald, Hanser published (2017), ISBN 9781569906477

科號  Course Number ： 11120CHE
555000學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
20
中文名稱  Course Title ：膠體界⾯科學與科技特論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Colloid and Interface Science & Technology
任課教師  Instructor ：蔡德豪
上課時間  Time ： R6R7R8 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  211 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、  課程說明 (Course Description)
The course is designed to provide basic understanding of colloid and interface
science for students with interests of nanomaterial-manufactured products and
their applications in the fields of chemical engineering. The objective is
to
understand the physical and chemical properties of nanomaterial dispersions,
and then to bridge the knowledge of their synthesis and surface chemistry to
the recent developments of nanotechnology and bionantechnology.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
R26; John C. Berg, “An Introduction to Interfaces & Colloids: The Bridge to
Nanoscience”, World Scientific, 2010
三、參考書籍 (References)
R26; W. B. Russel, D. A. Saville, W. R. Schowalter, “Colloidal
Dispersions”, Cambridge University Press, Mar 26, 1992
R26; Martin J. Rhodes, “Introduction to Particle Technology”, 2nd Edition,
Wiley 2008
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
During the semester, we will be going through the following topics in order:
1. Introduction of colloid and interface science
2: Phenomenology of colloidal systems
3. Synthesis and characterization of colloidal systems
4. Interactions between colloid particles
5. Emulsion and foaming
6. Overview: the applications to nanotechnology and bionanotechnology
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Will be announced in the first class
科號  Course Number ： 11120CHE
575000學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：材料相平衡
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Phase Equilibria of Materials
任課教師  Instructor ：陳信文
上課時間  Time ： M1M2 上課教室  Room ：化⼯ 220 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The objective of this course is understanding the principles and
applications of
multi-component phase equilibria of materials. The topics include phase
diagrams
of one, two and three component systems, thermodynamic principles governing
phase
equilibria, liquidus projection and applications of phase equilibria.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
F. N. Rhines, “Phase diagrams in metallurgy: their development and
application”,
McGraw-Hill, 1956.
三、參考書籍 (References)
D. R. Gaskell, “Introduction to metallurgical Thermodynamics”, 2nd edition,
McGraw-Hill, 1981.
N. Saunders, A. P. Miodownik, “Calphad, Calculation of Phase Diagrams a
Comprehensive Guide”, Elsevier Science 1998
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Week 1 Introduction, Unary systems, Binary isomorphous systems
Week 2 Eutectic, Eutectoid
Week 3 Monotectic, metatectic, Peritectic
Week 4 Intermediate phases, Congruent, Peritectoid, Syntectic
Week 5 Complex binary systems, Schreinemakers Rule
Week 6 Determination of phase diagrams
Week 7 Gibbs-Duhem equation, Tangent rule
Week 8 Phase diagram calculation (Binary)
Week 9 Mid-term exam
Week 10 Ternary isomorphous systems, isothermal section, isopleths
Week 11 Ternary three-phase equilibrium
Week 12 Class I reaction
Week 13 Class II reaction
Week 14 Class III reaction
Week 15 Liquidus projection
Week 16 Congruent transformation in ternary systems
Week 17 Phase diagram calculation (multi-component)
Week 18 Final exam
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Quiz, Homework (15%)
Mid-term exam (40%)
Final exam (45%)

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Industrial Microbiology
任課教師  Instructor ：朱⼀⺠
上課時間  Time ： R2R3R4 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  621 ／ 30
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
介紹關於微⽣物及⽣化學之基礎知識以利不熟悉⽣物科技領域的⼯程研究者可以深入淺出了解
⽣物化學⼯程體系和應⽤，內容包括微⽣物之基本特性包括分類，細菌、酵⺟及黴菌之簡介，
發酵⽣理及代謝、突變及育種。另外，簡介⽣物技術的傳統⼯業利⽤以及最新的發展概況。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
無
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. "Foundations in Microbiology", 7th ed., Talaro, McGraw Hill, 2009
2. ⽣物技術產業概論，吳文騰編，清⼤出版社

3 Eukaryotes

14 Term paper report (1)

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
此課程將會介紹基本⽣物學 , 分⼦⽣物學 , 基因⼯程 , 、蛋⽩質表現系統、轉植基因動物、疫苗⼯程、
基因治療及免疫療法等⽅⾯之應⽤
This course covers fundamental cell biology, molecular biology, genetic
engineering as well as applications in protein expression, vaccine engineering,
gene therapy and immunotherapy, etc.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Glick BR, Pasternak JJ and Patten, C.L. (2010) Molecular Biotechnology: Principles
and Applications of Recombinant DNA. 4th ed. ASM Press, Washington, D.C.

Hall International, London.
2.Watson, JD, Gilman, M, Witkowski, J, Zoller, M. (1992) Recombinant DNA. 2nd Ed.
W.H. Freeman and Co., New York.
3.Freshney, RI (2000) Culture of animal cells, a manual of basic technique. 4th
Ed. Wiley-Liss, New York.
4.Ausubel et al (1999) Short protocols in molecular biology. 4th Ed. John Wiley
and Sons, New York.

Chap 6 Manipulation of Gene expression in Eucaryotes (13)
Applications:
Chap 7 Vaccines (18)
Chap 8 Human Gene Therapy (26)
Chap 9 Immunotherapy (7)
Chap 10 Genome Editing and Manipulation (10)

⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This course describes the basic concepts of chemistry and includes molecules,
chemical bonds, chemical kinetics, liquids and solids, properties of solutions,
transition metals and coordination chemistry, nuclear chemistry, and organic
and biochemical molecules.
英語授課普通化學
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
S. S. Zumdahl, D. J. DeCoste, Chemical Principles,8th edition, 2017.
三、參考書籍 (References)
Other textbooks of general chemistry, physical chemistry, and inorganic
chemistry.

100
中文名稱  Course Title ：有機化學⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Organic Chemistry (II)
任課教師  Instructor ：陳建添
上課時間  Time ： T1T2F1F2 上課教室  Room ：化⼆  223 ／ 109
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Textbook:
Organic Chemistry Seventh Edition by Paula Yurkanis Bruice (8th Ed) and/or the
same textbook as the Organic Chemistry-I
Topics:
1. Radicals. Reactions of Alkanes
2. MS, IR, UV-Vis
3. NMR
4. Reactions of Carboxylic Acids and Derivatives
5. Reactions of Aldehydes and Ketones
6. Reactions at the alpha-Carbon of Carbonyl Compounds
7. Reactions of Benzenes
8. More about amines
Score policy:
1st term exam: March 24 (Friday): 25%
2nd term exam: April 25 (Tue): 25%
3rd term exam: May 23 (Tue): 25%
Final exam: June 16 (Friday): 25%
The contents in handouts, exercises, and problems account for about 85% of the
questions in the exams.

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
基礎有機化學，增進同學在有機化學的認識。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Bruice, P. Y.; "Organic Chemistry" 8th Ed., Pearson, 2017. ( 偉明圖書代理 )
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
PowerPoint
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Radicals
2. Mass Spectrometry and IR, UV/Vis spectroscopy
3. Nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
4. Carboxylic acids and derivatives
5. Aldehydes and ketones
6. Carbonyl compounds
7. Benzene and derivatives
8. Amines
9. Extra materials
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
⼆次期中考及期末考各佔  1/3.

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Contents (by topic):
1. Introduction
2. Electronic components and circuits
3. Signal processing
4. Atomic absorption spectroscopy
5. Atomic emission spectroscopy
6. * Mid-term exam I
7. Molecular absorption spectroscopy
8. Molecular emission spectroscopy
9. Infrared spectroscopy
10. Atomic mass spectrometry
11. Molecular mass spectrometry
12. * Mid-term exam II
13. Gas chromatography
14. Liquid chromatography
15. Electrophoresis
16. Radiochemical methods
17. Automated methods of analysis
18. * Final exam
Evaluation:
* The final score will be based on the scores obtained from quizzes (20%),
midterm exams (40%), and final exam (40%).
Requirements:
Students who have completed Analytical Chemistry I can attend this course.
Study material:
Handouts will be provided for selected topics.
Main textbook:
D.A. Skoog, F.J. Holler, S.R. Crouch, Principles of Instrumental Analysis, 7th
Edition, 2017, Cengage.
Other references will be cited in the handouts and/or slides displayed on the
screen.

Time: Friday, 11:00-12:00.
Place: room 308

11120CHEM329001學分  Credit ： 2⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
33
中文名稱  Course Title ：光譜分析實驗
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Spectroscopic Analysis Laboratory
任課教師  Instructor ：陳建添
上課時間  Time ： T5
T6T7T8上課教室  Room ：化  326 ／ 65
化 324／ 36
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
A total of 4-5 experiments will be carried out, which include the followings:
(1) Methyl 3-hydroxythiophene-2-carboxylate: synthesis and spectroscopic
assignment
(2) 3-Phenyl-2-thioxo-2,3-dihydroquinazolin-4(1H)-one: synthesis and spectroscopic
assignment
(3) Ethyl 2-(triphenyl-l5-phosphaneylidene)acetate: synthesis and spectroscopic
assignment
(4) Ethyl phenylphosphinate: synthesis and spectroscopic assignment
(5)2-Allylisoindoline-1,3-dione: synthesis and spectroscopic assignment
Nucleophilic addition, acyl substitution, nucleophilic substitution, Michael type
conjugate addition, and intramolecular Claisen condensation reactions will be
covered.
Their synthetic steps are attached in a separate pdf file.
Experimental skills: 60%
Product yield: 40%
Assignment: 100%.
Total 200 points for each experiments.

11120CHEM463000學分  Credit ： 1⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
35
中文名稱  Course Title ：書報討論⼆ ( 有機無機組 )
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Seminar-Organic and Inorganic Divisions (II)
任課教師  Instructor ：劉瑞雄
上課時間  Time ： R5R6 上課教室  Room ：化  125 ／ 73
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
培養學⽣研究興趣，熟悉最新文獻及研究⽅向，並訓練學⽣表達化學知識的能⼒
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
無
三、參考書籍 (References)
無
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
由學⽣上台報告最近的文獻，報告的要求如下：
⼀、每次三到四名，每⼈演講時間約⼆⼗五分鐘，並預留五⾄⼗分鐘供學術討論。
演講需有專任主持⼈。主持⼈的報告應簡潔，其表現亦列入評分。
⼆、演講完畢後，有⾄少五分鐘的學術討論時間，由演講⼈回答聽眾的提問，學術討論的效果由演講
⼈負最終責任。
三、演講之前，需準備摘要⼀份，⼤⼩為  A4 紙⼀張，發給出席老師、同學。摘要應包括：題⽬、主
要參考文獻所有作者的姓名、服務機關、原著出處、摘要內容、與次要文獻的列表。
四、摘要內容必須簡潔，並且不得全文翻譯所選定的文獻摘要。
五、主要論文出處需為  SCI impact factor 4.0 以上的專業學術期刊。
六、使⽤著作不得為回顧論文。
七、演講主題內容：無機化學為主等相關的主題。
八、投影片：以清晰、簡潔為最低要求，圖形、文字的字體⼤⼩需適中，加彩⾊圖片、特效可加分。
投影片應以淺⾊系圖案為底，演講同學應於⽩天時段先⾏測試檔案效果，責任⾃理。
五、成績考核 (Evaluation)
依內容的清晰，完整，表達能⼒及回答問題能⼒為準

科號  Course Number ：
11120CHEM501500學分  Credit ： 2⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
50
中文名稱  Course Title ：同步輻射應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Applications of Synchrotron Radiation
任課教師  Instructor ：李耀昌
上課時間  Time ： R7R8 上課教室  Room ：化  326 ／ 65
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 :
同步輻射光源是廿⼀世紀尖端科學研究的實驗利器之⼀，在化學、物理、半導體材料、⽣醫與醫學
檢測、綠⾊能源材料、古⽣物、地質與環保、微機械等基礎及應⽤科學研究，世界各國也因⽽紛紛
完成或興建不同電⼦能量的同步加速器產⽣更寬廣、強度更強及同調性更佳的同步輻射光源，⽬前
已有利⽤同步輻射光源建構⽽成的 X 光⾃由電⼦雷射（ X-ray Free Electron Laser, XFEL ）進
⾏更尖端的科學研究。在亞太洲地區台灣、⽇本（有 11 座同步輻射設施，其中以⼤型同步輻射
設施 Spring 8 及⾃由電⼦雷射設施，另外即將於北海道⼤學校園興建⼀座新的同步輻射加速器
光源）、韓國（浦項加速器實驗室及⾃由電⼦雷射設施 PAL-XFEL ）、中國⼤陸（北京、上海及
合肥）、泰國、新加坡、澳洲、約旦及印度均有⼤型同步輻射加速器光源的研究設施進⾏尖端的
研究。
本課程的主要⽬標在於帶領年輕學⼦認識在全球科技的競爭中，同步輻射光源的尖端科學研究及
應⽤扮演著非常重要的⾓⾊，藉由本課程的教學希望年輕學⼦能認識同步輻射光源為科學研究的
重要⼯具之⼀，希望未來能利⽤同步輻射光源做出影響深遠的重⼤科學發現。
● 參考書籍 (References)
1. A Guide to Synchrotron Radiation Science, Ed. by: M. Watanabe, S.
Sato, I. Munro, and G. S. Lodha, Narosa Publishing House (2016).
2. Synchrotron Radiation: Basics, Methods and Applications, S. Mobilio,
F. Boscherini, C. Meneghini (Eds.), Springer (2015).
3. Chemical Applications of Synchrotron Radiation (Part I: Dynamics and
VUV Spectroscopy; Part II: X-Ray Applications), edited by T.-K. Sham, World
Scientific (2002).

每個主題教學會邀請同步輻射研究中⼼在不同領域專⻑的研究⼈員以簡報及互動的⽅式進⾏講
授。

中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣物無機化學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Bioinorganic Chemistry
任課教師  Instructor ：廖文峯
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W2 上課教室  Room ：化  121 ／ 60
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Textbook: Principles of Bioinorganic Chemitry (Stephen J. Lippard and Jeremy M.
Berg)
References: Bioinorganic Chemistry (Bertini, Gray, Lippard, Valentine)
Lecture in English.
Evaluation: 1/3 test I + 1/3 test II + 1/3 test III
This course covers properties of biological molecules, physical methods in
bioinorganic chemistry, choice/uptake/assembly of metal containing units in
biology, control and utilization of metal-ion concentration in cells, binding of
metal ions and complexes to biomolecule-active centers, electron-transfer
proteins, substrate binding and activation of nonredox mechanism.

科號  Course Number ：
11120CHEM538000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：統計熱⼒學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Statistical Thermodynamics
任課教師  Instructor ：周佳駿
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W3W4 上課教室  Room ：化  B07 ／ 105
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
References:
1. Peter Atkins and Julio de Paula, Physical Chemistry, 8th edition, (2006).
2. Thomas Engel and Philip Reid, Physical Chemistry, 3rd edition, (2012).
3. Terrell L. Hill, An Introduction to Statistical Thermodynamics, 1st edition, (1987).
4. Donald A. McQuarrie, Statistical Mechanics, 1st edition, (2000).
Course prerequisites:
Physical Chemistry I, Physical Chemistry II, and Applied Mathematics.
Course objectives:
The goal of this course is to introduce students to the principles and methods of statistical thermodynamics and
the related applications in chemistry.
Course Outline:
1. Molecular thermodynamics
‧ Probability and Stirling's approximation
‧ Energy levels; populations; configurations; microstates; statistical weight
‧ Lagrange optimization method; Derivation of Boltzmann distribution
‧ Boltzmann factors; the molecular partition function
‧ Internal energy; heat capacity; entropy
‧ Helmholtz free energy, pressure, enthalpy, and Gibbs free energy
‧ Two-state system and negative absolute temperatures
2. Canonical ensemble
‧ Equilibrium distribution and properties
‧ Fluctuations in the canonical ensemble
‧ Relating the canonical partition function to the molecular partition function
3. Ideal gas
‧ Monatomic gas; translational partition function
‧ Diatomic gas; vibrational partition function; rotational partition function
‧ Polyatomic gas
4. Statistical interpretation of three laws of thermodynamics
5. Statistical calculation of equilibrium constants for chemical reactions
6. Classical partition function; Heat capacity of crystals
7. Molecular level chemical kinetics: theory of the rate constant
‧ Temperature dependence of rate constants
‧ Description of potential energy surfaces; the reaction coordinate
‧ Statistical theory of the rate constant: Transition state theory
8. Physical kinetics: Kinetic theory of gases
‧ Maxwell-Boltzmann velocity and speed distribution
‧ Average velocity and speed
‧ Collision rates and cross sections
‧ Simple collision theory of bimolecular reactions
Course Grades:
Homework (10%)
3 Exams: Exam 1 (30%); Exam 2 (30%); Exam 3 (30%)

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
1. Laser Fundamentals
Brief Reviews
Basic principles
A simple model for Lasers
How do we achieve population inversion?
Kinetic model for a simple 4-level system
Laser Gain Profile
Time dependence and pulse pumping
Q-switching and Cavity dumping
Laser Amplifier
Laser modes
Laser Resonator
Properties of Laser Radiation
2. Types of Lasers
3. High resolution tunable lasers + instrumentation for frequency-resolved laser
spectroscopy
4. Nonlinear Optics
harmonic generation, optical parametric oscillation/amplification,
Stimulated Raman Scattering
5. Introduction to ultrafast lasers + instrumentation for time-resolved laser
spectroscopy
A.mode locking and ultrafast laser pulse generation
B.types of ultrafast lasers
C.ultrafast laser pulse measurements
D.time-domain spectroscopy and its application
6. Laser spectroscopy
A. Laser Absorption spectroscopy
B. Laser-induced fluorescence
C. Laser ionization spectroscopy
D. Laser Raman spctroscopy
E. Nonlinear spectroscopy
7. Chemical Application of lasers
Case studies

中文名稱  Course Title ：奈米材料化學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Nanomaterials Chemistry
任課教師  Instructor ：黃暄益
上課時間  Time ： T3T4W2 上課教室  Room ：化  125 ／ 73
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Required reading: journal articles and papers presented in class
Course Outline
I. Characterization Techniques (XRD, SEM, TEM, EDS, etc.)
II. Synthesis and Characterization of Nanoparticles
III. Patterning of Nanoparticles
IV. Facet-Dependent Properties (Electrical, Photocatalytic, Optical, and
Heterogenerous Catalysis)
IV. Synthesis and Structural Characterization of Nanowires
V. Property Characterization of Nanowires
VI. Carbon Nanotubes
VII. Mesostructured Silica Materials
VIII. Recent and Interesting Journal Articles on Nanomaterials
This course gives a broad overview of various classes of nanomaterials. You will
learn the latest development in the demonstrations of facet-dependent properties
in semiconductor nanocrystals.
There will be one exam in the second half of the semester. You also need to
submit a midterm report and a final report. Detail will be given to enrolled
students before the semester begins.

中文名稱  Course Title ：書報討論 ( 有機組 )
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Seminar - Organic Division
任課教師  Instructor ：胡紀如
上課時間  Time ： M7M8 上課教室  Room ：化  326 ／ 65
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明 (Course Description)
⼝頭報導及討論有機化學領域之重要近期文獻。
1. 原則上每⽇ 3 ⼈，每⼈  1 + 20 + 4 min ( 視實際情形更動）；  1 分鐘介紹， 20 分鐘報告，
4分鐘問答及講評，時間嚴格控制。
2. 每⽇第 n 位演講， n + 3 位擔任主持⼈，並負責點名、收集題⽬卷及控制時間。
3. 第⼀次不出席不扣分，以後每次扣 5 分。
4. 演講者著正式服裝：
男同學打領帶、穿⽪鞋、襯衫。
女同學不可穿著⽜仔褲、短褲、涼鞋。
5. 正常情況下，分數約在 60–95 分間。
6. 題⽬、內容、 Reference 依所附範例製備，演講當⽇  交于第  n + 3 位同學。
型式依 ACS style Guide 。
7. 每位每學期⾄少提出問題三次，並交回問卷，缺⼀次扣五分。
8. 全勤加 3 分，最⾼不超過 98 分。
9. 如遇延期狀況，依序順延。
10. 主要之 paper 需為最近 2 年內發表，但不可是回顧性文章。
11. 題⽬⾃訂，但非發表文章之題⽬，且不可抄襲。
以上各點會依據實際上課狀況修改。

Ph.D. program students 使⽤著作得為回顧論文。

bioinorganic chemistry,...... 等有關無機化學的主題。

片
應以淺⾊系圖案為底，演講同學應於⽩天時段先⾏測試檔案效果。

任課教師  Instructor ：劉瑞雄
上課時間  Time ： W3W4 上課教室  Room ：化  125 ／ 73
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
同相催化  Homogeneous Catalysis
(1) 基本反應機構 / fundamental mechanism
(2) 計量型⾦屬有機反應 / stoichiometric organometallic reaction
(3) 偶合催化反應 / catalytic coupling reaction
(4) 鈀⾦屬的催化反應 / Pd-catalysis on alkene/ allylic/ acetates
(5) C-H鍵活化的催化反應 / C-H activation in catalysis
(6) ⾦⾦屬催化反應轉化炔類 / gold catalysis on alkynes

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Chemical Biology Ⅱ

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is designed for students understand the contemporary chemical
strategies to study biological issues. The course covers the introduction to
protein functions, signal transduction and glycoscience with emphasis on chemical
approaches to understand and solve biological problems.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Introduction to Bioorganic Chemistry and Chemical Biology
by D.A. Vranken and G. Weiss
三、參考書籍 (References)
Essentials of Glycobiology 2nd Ed
by A. Varki, R.D. Cummings, J.D. Esko, H.H. Freeze, P. Stanley, C.R. Bertozzi,
G.W. Hart and M.E. Etzler
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Powerpoint lectures
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Part I: Chemical biology of protein function and signal transduction
Part II: Chemical approached in glycobiology
Part III: Synthesis of oligosaccharides
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
One oral presentation and two paper tests
七、可連結之網⾴位址
eeClass

中文名稱  Course Title ：有機合成⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Organic Synthesis (II)
任課教師  Instructor ：黃郁文
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F2 上課教室  Room ：化  121 ／ 60
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Textbook:
Advanced Organic Chemistry Part B, fifth Edition, by Carey and Sunderg
Reference book: Organic Synthesis, 2nd Ed.; by Michael B. Smith
Teaching Method:
The course will be delivered in English.
1. Carbon-Carbon Bond-Forming Reactions of Compounds of Boron, Silicon, and Tin (Chapter 9)
2. Organometallic Compounds (Chapters 7 and 8)
3. Pericyclic Reactions-electrocyclizations (continuation from organic synthesis I)
4. Aromatic Substitution Reactions (Chapter 8 and 11)
5. Reactions Invovling Carbocations, Carbenes, and Radicals as Reactive Intermediates (Chapter 10)
6. Multistep Syntheses (Chapter 13)
Two three-hour exams for mid-term (time TBA).
final exam will be a team challenge! each designated team will proposed a retro as well as a forward synthetic
route for a natural product and eventually present in front of the whole class.
Evaluation: 30% for each mid-term exams and 40% for the final exam; extra 10% bonus for in class
attendance.

科號  Course Number ：
11120CHEM662000學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：書報討論 ( 有機組 )
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Seminar - Organic Division
任課教師  Instructor ：胡紀如
上課時間  Time ： M9Ma 上課教室  Room ：化  326 ／ 65
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明 (Course Description)
⼝頭報導及討論有機化學領域之重要近期文獻。
1. 原則上每⽇ 3 ⼈，每⼈  1 + 20 + 4 min ( 視實際情形更動）；  1 分鐘介紹， 20 分鐘報告，
4分鐘問答及講評，時間嚴格控制。
2. 每⽇第 n 位演講， n + 3 位擔任主持⼈，並負責點名、收集題⽬卷及控制時間。
3. 第⼀次不出席不扣分，以後每次扣 5 分。
4. 演講者著正式服裝：
男同學打領帶、穿⽪鞋、襯衫。
女同學不可穿著⽜仔褲、短褲、涼鞋。
5. 正常情況下，分數約在 60–95 分間。
6. 題⽬、內容、 Reference 依所附範例製備，演講當⽇  交于第  n + 3 位同學。
型式依 ACS style Guide 。
7. 每位每學期⾄少提出問題三次，並交回問卷，缺⼀次扣五分。
8. 全勤加 3 分，最⾼不超過 98 分。
9. 如遇延期狀況，依序順延。
10. 主要之 paper 需為最近 2 年內發表，但不可是回顧性文章。
11. 題⽬⾃訂，但非發表文章之題⽬，且不可抄襲。
以上各點會依據實際上課狀況修改。

中文名稱  Course Title ：書報討論 ( 無機組 )
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Seminar - Inorganic
任課教師  Instructor ：廖文峯
上課時間  Time ： T9Ta 上課教室  Room ：化  125 ／ 73
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
每次⼆到三名，每⼈演講時間 30 or 40 分鐘，並預留⾄少五分鐘供學術討論。
演講⼈的報告應簡潔，其表現亦列入評分。
演講完畢後，有⾄少 10 分鐘的學術討論時間，由演講⼈回答聽眾的提問，同學提問時先報學號，學術
討
論的效果由演講⼈負最終責任。
演講之前 one week ，需準備摘要⼀份，⼤⼩為  A4 紙內容 5 張 (at least) ，給出席老師。
摘要應包括：題⽬、該著作研究群的姓名、原著服務機關、原著出處、摘要內容、與次要文獻的列
表。
摘要內容必須以中文書寫，並且不得全文翻譯所選定的文獻摘要。
主要論文出處需為  SCI impact factor 4 以上的專業學術期刊。
Ph.D. program students 使⽤著作得為回顧論文。
演講主題內容：奈米科學 (nano sciences) ，包括：奈米粒⼦、柱的合成、鑑定與應⽤，多孔洞物質
(mesoporous materials) ，化學感測 (chemical sensing) ，⾃組裝 (self assembly) ，同相催化
(homogeneous catalysis), heterogeneous catalysis, organometallic chemistry,
bioinorganic chemistry,...... 等有關無機化學的主題。
投影片：以清晰、簡潔為最低要求，圖形、文字的字體⼤⼩需適中，加彩⾊圖片、特效可加分。投影
片
應以淺⾊系圖案為底，演講同學應於⽩天時段先⾏測試檔案效果。

科號  Course Number ： 11120CL
102002學分  Credit ： 2⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
25
中文名稱  Course Title ：⼤學中文
英文名稱  Course English Title ： College Chinese
任課教師  Instructor ：劉盈成
上課時間  Time ： M5M6 上課教室  Room ：綠能 201 ／ 35
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
本課程開設⽬的是確保⼤學部學⽣具備「學院知識表述能⼒」。教師透過選文的精讀指導，帶引學⽣
體察語⾔形式與表達內容的關係；透過寫作指導，從「問題意識的形成」到「資料的蒐集運⽤」到
「知識論述」再到「完成報告」。本課程教導學⽣如何遵循學院寫作模式，如何尊重他⼈智慧財產
權，確保學⽣充分知悉相關的學院規範。
⼆、指定教材
1. 劉承慧、王萬儀（主編），《⼤學中文教程 —— 學院報告寫作》，清華⼤學出版社。
2. 各班授課教師指定之精讀文本。
三、參考書籍
1. 清華⼤學寫作中⼼（編著），《⼤學中文寫作》，清華⼤學出版社。
2. 競寫歷屆題⽬與得獎作品（請於寫作中⼼網⾴最新消息之「競寫資訊」查詢）。
四、教學⽅式
由教師講解閱讀與寫作知識，並主導課堂討論。
五、教學進度
第⼀階段：學習、辨識四種基本寫作類型。
第⼆階段：收集並閱讀資料、建立問題意識、篩選資料、確定報告⽅向，初擬報告⼤綱。
第三階段：練習資料改寫、強化⽰例與推論、撰寫初稿、製作簡報（建議第 12 到 14 週之間進⾏）。
第四階段：確認無抄襲、確認文獻註記、調整組織架構、完成初稿。
第五階段：調整組織架構、檢查格式與註記、修訂文稿、完成報告。
六、成績考核
課堂表現 30% 、學期報告 70% 。
附註：
1. 學期報告包含完成學期報告所指定的階段性作業。
2. 學期報告的評分原則請參考「評分標準表」。

中文名稱  Course Title ：⼤學中文
英文名稱  Course English Title ： College Chinese
任課教師  Instructor ：王秋今
上課時間  Time ： R5R6 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 103 ／ 47
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼤學中文課程⼤綱
⼀、課程說明
本課程開設⽬的是確保⼤學部學⽣具備「學院知識表述能⼒」。教師透過選文的精讀指導，帶
引學⽣體察語⾔形式與表達內容的關係；透過寫作指導，從「問題意識的形成」到「資料的蒐集運
⽤」到「知識論述」再到「完成報告」。本課程教導學⽣如何遵循學院寫作模式，如何尊重他⼈智慧
財產權，確保學⽣充分知悉相關的學院規範。
⼆、指定教材
1.劉承慧、王萬儀（主編），《⼤學中文教程 —— 學院報告寫作》（新⽵：清華⼤學， 2010 ）。
2.指定之精讀文本。
三、參考書籍
1.⾥慕伊．阿紀《⼭櫻花的故鄉》（台北：麥⽥， 2010 ）。
2.夏曼．藍波安，《老海⼈》（新北：印刻文學， 2009 ）。
3.拓拔斯．塔瑪匹瑪，《蘭嶼⾏醫記》（台中：晨星， 1998 ）。
4.亞榮隆．撒可努，《⼭豬．⾶鼠．撒可努》（新北市：耶魯， 2011 ）。
5.⽡歷斯．諾幹，《戴墨鏡的⾶鼠》（台中：晨星， 2017 ）。
6.劉克襄，《風⿃⽪諾查》（台北：遠流， 2007 ）。
7.吳明益，《家離⽔邊那麼近》（台北：⼆⿂文化， 2007 ）。
8.廖鴻基，《鯨⽣鯨世》（台中：晨星， 2012 ）。
四、教學⽅式
1.教學⽅式為文本閱讀、講解、提問與討論、活動、⼝頭報告、書⾯報告。
2.本課程注重課堂討論與發⾔，上課前必須先閱讀指定文本與相關材料。

中文名稱  Course Title ：詩選
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Selected Readings from Chinese Poetry
任課教師  Instructor ：許銘全
上課時間  Time ： T7T8T9 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C509 ／ 80
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程為中文系基本知識架構之⼀。古典詩歌為中國古典文學發展過程中，最重要的體類，乃理解中
國古典文學史、批評史，甚⾄是文化史的關鑰。本課程範圍主要為⾃漢魏以迄唐代的詩歌名作，側重
詩作的體會與詮解，體察詩⼈的情志才學；同時藉著歷時性的作品閱讀，引領同學認識歷代詩歌發
展、重要詩學觀念及詩體演變。修習本課程學⽣需進⾏古典詩（主要是近體）的創作練習，透過⾃⼰
的創作經驗和評賞，進⼀步的掌握古典詩歌之形式、內容、創作技巧及詩⼈之⽤⼼，深入體驗中國古
典詩歌之美。
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
戴君仁，《詩選》，臺北：文化⼤學出版部
《袖珍詩韻》

科號  Course Number ： 11120CL
111003學分  Credit ： 2⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
20
中文名稱  Course Title ：基礎寫作
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Basic Writing
任課教師  Instructor ：羅漪文
上課時間  Time ： R3R4 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C522 ／ 35
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
◎課程說明（ Course Description）
語⾔文字是⼈際溝通的基礎、信念傳播與情感表達的媒介，其性質、結構、⽅法與效能，亦是文學相
關
科系訓練的核⼼之⼀。「基礎寫作」課程⽤意並非訓練文學創作能⼒，⽽是希望能聚焦在切題、造
句、
謀篇，訓練學⽣整合表達知識與意⾒的基礎文字能⼒。
◎教學⽅式（ Teaching Method ）
1. 由教師解說寫作之基本理念與⽅法，並分析能展⽰相關寫作⽅法與成效的範文，再請學⽣以
作業演練所學。
2. 教師將仔細批改學⽣作業，指出可修訂之處，以利學⽣精進寫作技巧。在多次作業演練與批
改下，教師也更能掌握學⽣程度與進境，給予切實建議。
◎教學進度 (Syllabus)
週次  ⽇期  主題  作業
⼀ 2/16 課程介紹與寫作概論
⼆ 2/23 開頭怎麼寫  ⼩作業⼀
三 3/2 題⽬怎麼取
四 3/9 句式與標點  ⼩作業⼆
五 3/16 架構與分段
六 3/23 縮寫與擴寫  ⼩作業三
七 3/30 改寫  繳交⼤作業提案
八 4/6 校際活動週停課⼀⽇
九 4/13 描寫（⼀）  ⼩作業四
⼗ 4/20 描寫（⼆）
⼗⼀  4/27 敘述（⼀）  ⼩作業五
⼗⼆  5/4 敘述（⼆）

⼗六  6/1 議論（⼆）
成績考核（ Evaluation ）
1. 七次⼩作業，共佔 70% 。依據各次要求寫作，⼀律在隔週週⼀午夜前上傳教學網站。
2. ⼤作業提案 + 成果，共佔 30% 。提案以 500 字為限，成果字數請把握在 4000 字（ ±100 ），並請
最晚在第⼗八週的周四（ 6/15 ）當天中午前上傳。
3. 出席情況將作為學期總分數增減之參考。
4. 願意針對⼩作業⼀到六所獲之教師建議進⾏修訂者，最晚於第⼗五週週四午夜之前統整上
傳，若修訂可⾒明顯進步者，予以加分。（此項非強制）

中文名稱  Course Title ：漢魏六朝文
英文名稱  Course English Title ： The Selected Reading of articles in Six Dynasties
任課教師  Instructor ：簡良如
上課時間  Time ： F6F7F8 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C405 ／ 69
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
本課程就漢魏六朝文名篇進⾏選讀，藉此簡介該時期文學制作歷程與意義（文學史暨文獻情況）、思
想意識和學術變
化，以期協助修課同學對此時期⼈文發展狀況有初步⽽具體的認識。
⼆、授課教材
教師⾃編講義。
三、教學內容
根據主題加以選篇，選讀詳略依需要⽽有不同，實際講授進度及補充篇章按具體教學情況隨時調整。
以下為預擬授課計畫：
⼀）文明史觀及其視⾓
選篇：司⾺遷  《史記 ‧ 五帝本紀》
補充：《尚書 ‧ 堯典》、《⼤戴禮記 ‧ 五帝德》
⼆）情性與存在意識
選篇：〈⽑詩⼤序〉
補充：《禮記 ‧ 樂記》、賈誼〈鵩⿃賦〉
三）個體與物之⼤
選篇：班固〈兩都賦〉
四）個體獨立
選篇：張衡〈歸⽥賦〉、陶潛〈歸去來辭〉
五）物世界
選篇：謝靈運〈⼭居賦〉、《文⼼雕龍 ‧ 物⾊》
六）文
選篇：陸機〈文賦〉、鍾嶸《詩品 ‧ 序》、《昭明文選 ‧ 序》、《文⼼雕龍 ‧ 原道》
四、成績考核
期中作業、期中考，合併  30 ％
期末作業、期末考，合併  70%
科號  Course Number ： 11120CL
151100學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：越南文學導讀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Vietnamese Literature
任課教師  Instructor ：羅漪文
上課時間  Time ： R7R8R9 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C402 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
（⼀）課程說明
本課程初步介紹越南文學，期能為同學們打開⼀扇窗去認識越南文化的豐富性與複雜性。課程
⼤致按照時代順序導讀越南文學史上的重要經典，並指出作品背後的社會文化發展軌跡。⾸先簡要
介紹越南從古典時期到近現代的歷史過程，隨後透過閱讀具體文本去進⾏印證與反思。在古典文學
部份，我們挑選深刻地影響越南文學傳統的作品，如⺠間傳說與六八體歌謠、阮攸的⻑篇敘事詩
《⾦雲翹傳》、阮廷炤之《蓼雲仙傳》等，在現代部分，我們挑選充分紀錄了越南社會變遷的南
⾼、阮輝涉、⼭南、阮⽟四等不同世代作家的作品。此外，由於上世紀的越南戰爭所造成的深遠影
響，我們特別選擇呈現參戰雙⽅觀點的⼩說與詩歌，如保寧、阮清越等創作，另補充越南海外移⺠
的回憶書寫。
為了協助不懂越南語但對世界文學感興趣的同學選修，本課程挑選漢字、中文譯本或英文譯本
的文獻，由老師帶領細讀。同時，會安插分析幾部越南電影、提供⼀次越南流⾏⾳樂的演講，以開
拓文字閱讀之外的感知空間。希望在本課程結束以後，同學們能夠對越南文學有初步的認識，對越
南乃⾄東南亞的多樣性更加敏感，在現今複雜的地緣政治情勢底下，能對於⼈類文化發展願景進⾏
判斷與抉擇。
本課程進⾏期間要求專注參與，請同學們暫停查看任何電話、電⼦郵件、社交媒體或聊天通
訊。更⿎勵修讀這⾨課的同學，在開學第三週以前，⾄少閱畢指定⽤書所列舉的作品當中的⼀種。

科號  Course Number ： 11120CL
210801學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：聲韻學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Chinese Phonology
任課教師  Instructor ：邴尚⽩
上課時間  Time ： R3R4Rn 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C509 ／ 80
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
　　「聲韻學」是研究漢語⾳韻的結構及其演化過程的科學，⽬的在於了解漢語語⾳逐步演化的軌
跡，並掌握其演變規律。
語⾳學的⼯具及⽅法是學習聲韻學的重要⾨徑，因此，本課程將先概述語⾳學的相關知識。然
後將由學⽣最熟悉的現代漢語（國語）入⼿，作為了解漢語語⾳演變的起點，學⽣將學習以國際⾳
標
標注國語⾳讀，以便與之後古代漢語的擬⾳溝通比對，理解其演變狀況。
　　接著依次講授中古漢語（魏晉隋唐）、近古漢語（兩宋）、近代漢語（元明清）、上古漢語
（周
秦兩漢）的語⾳。探究中古漢語的基礎材料之⼀為《切韻》系的韻書，其系統兼賅古今南北，故可
以
此為基點，上推古⾳，下接今⾳。
經由各時期⾳韻系統的分析，希望達到的教學⽬標主要有三⽅⾯：
⼀是使學⽣了解漢語語⾳在各時期的不同⾯貌及其發展規律。
⼆是使學⽣認識漢語聲韻學的研究材料、研究⽅法、基礎知識及術語，並奠定聲韻學研討的根
柢。
三是使學⽣能運⽤聲韻學的知識到相關的學科及⽇常⽣活上，如：解讀古書及出⼟文獻、欣賞
與校勘歷代韻文、深入理解漢字、從事詩文創作、明瞭現代⽅⾔的關係和來源、了解⽇常字⾳的問
題
等。
　　配合彈性學期週數試⾏計畫，將 18 週課程內容融入 16 週，由中⾼密度學習變成⾼密度學習，提
升學⽣⾃主性學習，課程內容不打折，具體配套措施如下：
　　 1.依據過去教學經驗，各階段古⾳的擬⾳推論過程，因較為繁冗瑣碎，學⽣的注意⼒不易全程
集中。相關單元將不再逐⼀解說，⽽改採舉例說明的⽅式，之後便呈現學界的擬⾳研究成果，並提
供
相關論著，供有興趣的同學延伸閱讀。如此可縮減課堂講解時間共約 240 分鐘。
　　 2.相關單元的⼩考合併舉⾏，如此可減少 3 次⼩考，縮減課堂⼩考時間共約 60 分鐘。
⼆、指定⽤書
　　教師⾃編講義。

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程以研討⽅式，深入探究中國詩歌傳統中的重要詩⼈杜甫及其作品，從詩⼈與時代社會以⾄
詩學傳統的互動出發，結合文本的細讀，分析杜甫在中國詩史上的地位，以⾄對後世的影響。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
楊倫《杜詩鏡銓》（上海：上海古籍出版社， 1980 ）

中文名稱  Course Title ：基礎影像敘事
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Fundamental Storytelling Strategies
任課教師  Instructor ：游惠貞
上課時間  Time ： W7W8 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C405 ／ 69
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程名稱：基礎影像敘事
授課教師：游惠貞老師
課程主旨：
影像、聲⾳⼀如文字，都是表達意念的⼯具，善⽤⼯具，就能說出好故事。
透過觀察與想像，運⽤富於影像感的文字描繪⼈物，敘說故事，不僅是編劇乃⾄於各項影視相關⼯作
的基礎，也是從事企劃與⾏銷相關⼯作的必備能⼒。這⾨課意在訓練學⽣運⽤具影像感的文字說故
事。
穿過文字障 —— 說⼀個具影像感的故事
1.從新聞中找故事
2.從文學作品中找故事
3.⼈物塑造觀摩與練習
4.時間與空間的想像
5.說故事練習
學期成績計分⽅式：
本課程包含 3 份習作，各佔學期成績的 30% ，平時分數 10% 。
修課準備 :
*為便於上課時直接進入⾓⾊設定細節討論，請同學在上課前先觀賞以下影片：
1. 李安電影 : 喜宴 , 飲食男女 , 推⼿ ...
2. 楊德昌電影 : ⼀⼀ , 恐怖份⼦ , 牯嶺街少年殺⼈事件 ...
3.是枝裕和電影 : 橫⼭家之味 , 我的意外爸爸 ...
4.侯孝賢電影 : 戀戀風塵 , 悲情城市 ...
5. 李滄東電影 : 綠洲 , 薄荷糖 ...
6. 鍾孟宏電影 : 瀑布 , 陽光普照 .

中文名稱  Course Title ：楚辭
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Chu Ci
任課教師  Instructor ：邴尚⽩
上課時間  Time ： M7M8M9 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C403 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
《楚辭》是中國抒情文學的源頭，也是傳統文學的瑰寶。本課程以選讀《楚辭》中的屈原作品為主，
包括〈離騷〉、〈九歌〉、〈天問〉、〈九章〉、〈招魂〉等篇章。
在歷代註家及研究者的基礎上，期望能盡可能地適切掌握文義，⽽藉由講授、閱讀及討論，引導同學
鑑賞品讀《楚辭》，掌握其藝術特質，分析其運⽤隱喻、象徵及神話的表現⽅式，以對此⼀中國文學
鉅著能有深刻的認識，並在此過程中，提⾼同學的語文程度和思辨能⼒。
此外，還希望引領同學進入⼀個偉⼤⼼靈的精神世界，探討屈原不朽的原因，對於屈原的⼈格、情感
深度、及其代表的文⼈精神有所理解，並能⾃我反思，進⽽思考屈原、《楚辭》與⼀⼰⽣命、所處時
代間的觸發與對應。
本課程期初時將請同學們分組，期中以後（約第九週開始），以⼀週⼀組約半⼩時的時間，作專題報
告，與課程進度穿插進⾏。（暫擬主題如：楚辭中的神話、楚辭中的傳說、楚辭中的歷史⼈物、楚辭
中的飲食、楚辭中的服飾、楚辭中的建築、楚辭中的歌舞⾳樂、楚辭中的娛樂、楚辭中的巫術、楚辭
中的神祇、楚辭中的怪物、楚辭中的動物、楚辭中的植物、楚辭故事新編、楚辭相關文創設計、楚辭
桌遊設計等）希望經由⼩組合作、查找資料、整理構思、上臺發表、師⽣回饋評論等過程，讓同學們
更加認識《楚辭》，並了解《楚辭》及楚文化內涵的豐富多元。
出⼟文獻中，有許多與《楚辭》相關的材料，如：包⼭楚簡、望⼭楚簡、天星觀楚簡、秦家嘴楚簡、
葛陵楚簡、九店楚簡、上博楚簡、清華楚簡、睡虎地秦簡、鄂君啟節等。這些新材料有助於我們探討
像屈原⽣年⽉⽇、〈離騷〉的藝術構思、〈九歌〉的性質與諸神名義、〈九章〉地理等諸多問題，對
於釋讀、校勘《楚辭》文本中許多疑難字句，也有極⼤的助益。本課程亦將介紹、討論這⽅⾯的相關
資料及問題。
配合彈性學期週數試⾏計畫，將 18 週課程內容融入 16 週，由中⾼密度學習變成⾼密度學習，提升學
⽣⾃主性學習，課程內容不打折，具體配套措施如下：
1.依據過去教學經驗，「屈原的歷史評價與現代詮釋」單元的內容可再精簡，並與「屈原⽣平探
析」單元合併，如此可縮減課堂講解時間共約 150 分鐘。
2.「〈九歌〉導讀」共計四週，課時稍⻑，可將第⼀部分「〈九歌〉的名義、性質」適度精簡，後
⾯篇章的解說亦斟酌調整，如此可縮減課堂講解時間共約 150 分鐘。
