● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
（⼀）本課程以教師講授為主，與同學互動討論為輔。
（⼆）期中專題報告形式為學⽣分組報告相關議題，再由教師講評。
（三）本課程將安排⼀次期末考，內容以對本學期課程內容之理解與省思為主。
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
第1週　課程內容講解及評量⽅式說明
　　　
第2週　屈原⽣平探析與歷史評價
由《史記 ‧ 屈原賈⽣列傳》等傳世史料、屈原作品以及相關出⼟文獻，介紹屈原的⽣平，並探討稟賦
與家世，對其性格及⼈⽣的影響。⽽由歷史上對屈原的評論，觀察後代讀者們如何看屈原？⼜折射出
何種意義？並探討⼀個在政治上不得志、不合時宜的邊緣⼈，為何能不朽於後世？
第3週  經典的形成：《楚辭》概述
由《史記》、《漢書》等傳世史料以及相關出⼟文獻，探討《楚辭》的名義、特⾊、成書過程、流
傳、影響及其在中國文學史上的地位。
第4週　內美志節與現實挫折：〈離騷〉導讀（⼀）
由古今對〈離騷〉題意的不同理解開端，接著講解、討論〈離騷〉第⼀⼤段中，有關屈原的⾝世、修
養、理想、志節及其所遭遇的挫折。
第5週　⾶天求索的神話：〈離騷〉導讀（⼆）
講解、討論〈離騷〉第⼆⼤段中，歷史上的賢佞系譜，以及屈原⾶天求女、上下求索的神話書寫。
第6週　想像中的遠遊與輟⽌：〈離騷〉導讀（三）
講解、討論〈離騷〉第三⼤段中，屈原藉由巫術及神話所表達其反覆猶疑的⼼境轉折及去留抉擇。
第7週　舊瓶裝新酒與性格迥異的諸神：〈九歌〉導讀（⼀） ── 〈九歌〉的名義、性質、〈東皇太
⼀〉、〈雲中君〉、〈⼤司命〉、〈東君〉
由〈九歌〉的名義、性質，探討屈原如何借舊有的題⽬以託諷寄意。另外，〈九歌〉的四週課程中，
還將欣賞歷代九歌圖，並觀看林懷⺠所編的〈九歌〉現代舞及蔣勳相關演講影片的片段，思考文學、
文化、文創等相關問題。以〈東皇太⼀〉等篇為例，看屈原如何以⽣花妙筆，塑造出性格鮮明且迥異
的諸神，並思考其中可能的寓意與寄託。
第8週　愛情⾯⾯觀：〈九歌〉導讀（⼆） ── 〈湘君〉、〈湘夫⼈〉、〈少司命〉、〈河伯〉（穿插
分組報告）
從〈湘君〉、〈湘夫⼈〉這⼀組作品，看屈原如何將原始神話及宗教祭儀，轉化為個⼈抒情⾔志的文
學創作，並由⼆湘錯過的愛情，少司命的邂逅與單戀、河伯與巫女的黃河之遊等，思考在愛情關係中
可能遇到的問題及應有的⼼態。
第9週　精怪與⿁魂：〈九歌〉導讀（三） ── 〈⼭⿁〉、〈國殤〉、〈禮魂〉（穿插分組報告）
〈九歌〉中除天神、地祇外，還有精怪與⿁魂，其中，〈⼭⿁〉亦有男女情愛的書寫，〈國殤〉是⼀
⾸悼念陣亡將⼠的祭歌，〈禮魂〉則應為對無主⿁魂普渡，三篇各有特⾊，也反映了楚國祭祀習俗的
⼀⾯。
第10週　宇宙開闢與天地神話：〈天問〉導讀（⼀）（穿插分組報告）
由相關傳世及出⼟文獻，思考〈天問〉的性質及創作緣由。〈天問〉第⼀⼤段從宇宙開闢問⾄⼤地四
⽅，所問的是⾃然之天，內容為與天地有關的古代神話。
第11週　歷史傳說與男女關係：〈天問〉導讀（⼆）（穿插分組報告）
講解、討論〈天問〉中的古史傳說，屈原所探問的主要核⼼是：興亡有無天意？古史傳說的前半為夏
朝歷史，其中特別著眼於統治者的男女關係。
第12週　國家興亡與君⾂關係：〈天問〉導讀（三）（穿插分組報告）
繼續講解、討論〈天問〉中古史傳說，古史傳說的後半為商周歷史，特別著眼於君⾂遇合，並由歷史
⼈物的遭遇及其出處進退，看清⾃⼰的處境。
第13週  魂兮歸來：〈招魂〉選讀（穿插分組報告）
〈招魂〉應是屈原招楚懷王之魂，結尾的亂辭為對早年與王畋獵事的追憶及感傷。由當年君⾂相得，
到後來屈原遭到疏遠、流放，最後懷王客死異鄉，令⼈唏噓。⼈⽣的窮達，該如何⾯對？值得深思。
第14週　⽣命的⾜跡：〈九章〉選讀（穿插分組報告）
〈九章〉九篇非⼀時所作，從早期詠物寫志的〈橘頌〉，⼀直到⾃沉汨羅前的絕筆辭〈懷沙〉、〈惜
往⽇〉，構成了屈原⽣命的⾜跡。
第15週　期末考
第16週　檢討考卷及課程總結

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Poetry of Tao Y. M.

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程內容請依下列項⽬輸入：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
　　陶淵明歷來被視為隱逸詩⼈之宗並開創了⽥園詩歌⼀派，其⼈、其作均受後世⾼度尊崇。本課程
嘗試藉由淵明詩文的解讀，以其⼈其文為閱讀核⼼，體會其情其志及其詩藝。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
　　龔斌：《陶淵明集校箋》（臺北：⾥仁書局， 2007 年）
三、參考書籍 (References)
　　王叔岷《陶淵明詩箋證稿》，台北，藝文， 1999 （ 1974 ）
　　逯欽立《陶淵明集》，北京：中華書局， 2008 （ 1979 ）
　　楊  勇：《陶淵明集校箋》，臺北：正文書局， 1997
　　袁⾏霈：《陶淵明集箋注》，北京，中華書局， 2003 （《修訂本》 2022 ）
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
　　講授為主，討論為輔
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
　　 1. 序論暨課程說明
　　 2. 理想⾃我的設定
　　 3. 出發與追尋
　　 4. 回歸
　　 5. 「群」與「我」（⼀）：老農與失群⿃
　　 6. 不覺知有我
　　 7. 無成之悲
　　 8. 「群」與「我」（⼆）：賴古多此賢
　　 9. 「物」與「我」
　　 10. ⾃我對話形影神
　　 11. ⼈⽣實難與縱浪⼤化
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
　　
　　期中考： 40 ％
　　期末考： 40 ％
　　平時成績（出缺席、課堂表現、 eeclass 討論）： 20 ％

四、作業
【體例】
⼀、詞之原文，以⽯唐本為主。
⼆、要比對以下六本之校勘（異文）、編年、注釋：
曹本：曹樹銘《東坡詞》
⽯唐本：⽯聲淮、唐玲玲《東坡樂府編年箋注》
鄒王本：鄒同慶、王宗堂《蘇軾詞編年校注》
薛本：薛瑞⽣《東坡詞編年箋證》
張本：張志烈《蘇軾詞集校注》
譚本：譚新紅《蘇軾詞全集》
如不會改寫，⾄少可以先臚列六家說法再⾏定奪。
三、思考：各書校勘差異？你認為何書編年所⾔較合理？就讀者⽽⾔，哪些字詞需要注釋？

科號  Course Number ： 11120CL
350500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：中國文學批評
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Chinese Literary Criticism
任課教師  Instructor ：陳國球
上課時間  Time ： RnR5R6 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C403 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程內容
本科旨在讓學⽣認識中國文學批評的發展概況，研習經典文論以及重要文學思潮，以理解文學在文化
傳統中如何傳承、如何發揮影響，從⽽建立文學評論的歷史視野。
導論：文學批評與文學史
⼀、文學在追憶中：詩樂的欣賞與應⽤
⼆、儒⾨詩教：興、觀、群、怨
三、由閱讀到創作：騷與賦
四、文的體認：文氣與文⼼
五、文之⽤：時世與道德
六、從詩讀出：詩史、才情與韻味
七、⼠⼈眼界：清峭、富貴、平淡、忘情
八、杜甫議題：江⻄、盛唐、格⾼、悲慨
九、個⼈與傳統：摹仿、格調、才思
⼗、情遇與神韻：興觀群怨、蘊藉含蓄、清新雅正
⼗⼀、才⼦性靈：⼩說、戲曲，與詩
⼗⼆、結論：比較文學批評學
⼆、教學⽅式
以教師講授為主，輔以課堂討論
三、成績考核 (Evaluation)
1． 期中考  30%
2． 期末考  40%
3． 課堂表現（包括到課次數、學習表現） 30%

⽅孝岳：《中國文學批評》，北京：⽣活 ‧ 讀書 ‧ 新知三聯書店， 1986 年。

35
中文名稱  Course Title ：儒林外史
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Rulin Waishi and Literati Culture in Late Imperial China
任課教師  Instructor ：張閏熙
上課時間  Time ： MnM5M6 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C405 ／ 69
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
《儒林外史》為清代文⼈⼩說中的經典鉅作，這部⼩說觸及了儒家菁英社會的核⼼問題與深刻
困境，反映了文⼈們⾃我認同的危機，吳敬梓藉由⼩說敘述，展現出⼀個⾃我否定與反思的動態過
程。課程內容主要以⼈物為主軸，扣合全書情節發展，參照歷史敘事、相關評點，對文本作深入的詮
釋。透過本課程，期能讓同學們了解《儒林外史》的成書背景、版本流傳、敘事美學等⼩說史相關知
識，以及這部⼩說蘊藏的思想與文化內涵、讀者接受史、其他文藝形式的再呈現等等。
⼆、指定⽤書
清‧吳敬梓著，徐少知校注：《儒林外史新注》 ( 臺北：⾥仁書局， 2010 年 ) 。
清‧吳敬梓著，李漢秋輯校：《儒林外史彙校彙評本》 ( 上海：上海古籍出版社， 1999 年 ) 。

3.外文著作
［⽇］⼩川環樹：〈儒林外史 の 形式 と 內容〉，《中國⼩說史 の 研究》 ( 東京：岩波書店， 1968
年)。
［⽇］須藤洋⼀：《儒林外史論  : 権⼒ の 肖像、 または ⼗八世紀中国 のパロディ》 ( 東京都：汲古
書院， 1999 年 ) 。
四、教學⽅式
本課程的上課⽅式為講授和討論並重，以⼀學期的時間帶領同學們讀完整部⼩說，希望經由共同精
讀、研討，深入體會  《儒林外史》的經典內涵。

六、成績考核
1.課堂參與：分組⼝頭導讀 30%
每週分配組別擔任導讀，整理⼈物、情節、主題 …… 等等，文本分析、發表感想或提出在閱讀過程中
發現的任何問題。導讀後由老師整合問題並深化議題，帶領同學們共同討論。
2.期中考 30%
3.期末個⼈讀書報告與⼝頭發表 40%
請擇取《儒林外史》中的數回情節或重要主題，撰寫⼀篇讀書報告。可統整全書綜合詮釋、提挈主題
抉發奧義、研探⾓⾊形塑，或剖析敘事特質等，抒發⼰⾒。

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
國立清華⼤學中國文學系課程⼤綱
科號  ＣＬ  學分  3 學分  ⼈數限制  35 ⼈
任課教師  黃忠天  時間  3 ⼩時  教  室
科⽬中文名稱  易經
科⽬英文名稱
Yi Jing（ The Book of Change ）
⼀、課程說明
易經為中國哲學之活⽔源頭，亦為群經之⾸。歷代重要思潮如兩漢經學、魏晉⽞學、宋明理學等等均
無
不與易學息息相關，其於吾國思想文化影響，可謂重⼤深遠。希望藉本課之教學，導引正確之學習⽅
向，以窺易學之堂奧，進⽽瞭解中國文化，增進個⼈智慧。
⼆、指定⽤書  周易程傳註評  黃忠天  ⾼雄：復文圖書出版社
（或不限版本之程頤《易傳》、《易程傳》、《伊川易傳》）
三、參考書籍
1.周易正義　　　　　  孔穎達　　　臺北：藝文印書館
2.易經來註圖解　　　　  來知德　　　⾼雄：復文出版社　　　　　　　　　
3.易本義　　　　　　  　朱　熹　　　臺北：老古出版社　
4.辛齋易學　　　　　  　杭辛齋　　　臺北：夏學社
5.談易　　　　　　　　  戴君仁　　　臺北：台灣開明書店　
6.周易經傳溯源　　　　  李學勤　　　⾼雄：麗文文化公司
7.易學哲學史　　　　　  朱伯崑　　　臺北：藍燈出版社
8.先秦漢魏易例述評　　  屈萬⾥　　　臺北：學⽣書局
9.易學漫步　　　　　  　朱伯崑　　　臺北：學⽣書局
10.易傳之形成及其思想　戴璉璋　　　臺北：文津出版社　　　　　　　　　　　　　　
11.周易漫談　  張善文　　　臺北：頂淵出版社
12.周易譯注　　　　　　黃壽祺　  上海：古籍出版社
四、教學⽅式  經典講授、期刊論文選讀、指定閱讀等等
　
五、教學進度
1.周易導論：包括周易經傳起源、作者、傳授、流派、義例、占筮、出⼟文獻基本問題。
2.周易思想簡介（如循環思想、憂患意識、循環史觀、⽣⽣哲學、天⼈合⼀等）　
3.周易經傳講授（以六⼗四卦及易傳重要內容為主）。
4.現當代重要易學期刊專著研讀。

科號  Course Number ： 11120CL
441800學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：文學與圖繪
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Literature and Pictorial Work
任課教師  Instructor ：楊晉綺
上課時間  Time ： TnT5T6 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C405 ／ 69
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程⼤綱  ( ⼤學部 )
課程名稱：文學與圖繪  Literature and Pictorial Work
授課教師：楊晉綺
授課時間：星期⼆ 12:10 – 15:10
課程⼤綱與課程⽬標
布拉格市郊⼀家考究的中式餐館內，粉⽩⾊的後廳牆壁上懸掛著⼀幅以當代⽔彩顏料圖繪的「洛神賦
圖」，圖中
鮮明的東⽅意象每每引起布拉格當地居⺠和⻄⽅外來遊客的好奇與詢問。他們既想知道畫中⼈物是
誰，也渴望知
道背後的歷史故事和相關的文學記述，「這後⾯⼀定有故事」，他們堅稱。這個旅⾏經驗說明了圖像
的視覺吸引
經常觸發觀看者想要進⼀步探詢、深究的興趣，⽽在他們稍微理解與圖像相關的歷史背景和文學內容
之後，圖繪
之所依倚、從出的文學故事，其所具有的⾶躍想像⼒和抒情特質轉⽽⼜影響、改變了觀看者原來的觀
畫感受，視
覺官能快感遂伴隨著文學想像⼀起進入⼀個有著渺遠時間縱深的奇幻國度。
基於此種認知，本課程的授課⽬的在於試圖引導修課同學深入地理解 : 文學抒情想像和視覺感知能⼒
之間究竟經由
何種⽅式相互誘引、彼此滲透 ? ⼜是何種視覺要素、記憶連結與⼼理狀態吸引觀者進入圖像的觀看活
動？文學插圖
如何刺激讀者持續不懈地完成⻑篇文學作品的閱讀活動 ? ⽽觀者在觀畫與閱讀交替進⾏的過程之中⼜
將獲致什麼樣
的審美快感 ?
課程內容除了導論之外，主要區分為「文學主題圖繪」和「⻑篇文學作品插圖」兩⼤部分，前者以
《女史箴
圖》、《洛神賦圖》、《虢國夫⼈游春圖》、《九歌圖》、《⾚壁賦圖》以及與之相關的文學作品作
為討論重
點；後者則挑選了《⻄遊記》、《⽔滸傳》、《⻄廂記》、《紅樓夢》和⾦庸武俠⼩說中的插圖及其
對應的⼩說
情節進⾏說明與討論。選課學⽣從第⼗五堂課開始，或是分組，或者逐⼀依據各⾃選擇的文學作品與
圖畫進⾏課
堂報告；期末則繳交⼀篇⼤約 3000 字的書⾯報告。
課程進度
⼀、導論：約翰 · 伯格 (John Berger) ，《觀看的⽅式》
⼆、文學主題圖繪
1、 文與圖的媒介轉化與相互競爭：從⼤英博物館館藏《女史箴圖》談起
2、 屈原《楚辭．九歌》與《九歌》圖繪
3、 曹植〈洛神賦〉與《洛神賦》圖繪
4、 杜甫〈麗⼈⾏〉與張萱《虢國夫⼈游春圖》
5、 蘇軾〈⾚壁賦〉、〈後⾚壁賦〉與《⾚壁賦》、《後⾚壁賦》圖繪
三、⻑篇文學作品插圖
1、明．世德堂本《⻄遊記》
2、明．容與堂本《⽔滸傳》
3、明．陳洪綬繪《⻄廂記》
4、清．改琦《紅樓夢圖咏》
5、⾦庸武俠⼩說原版與續版挿畫

⼆、課程說明
本課程名為「旅⾏與文學」，有別於「旅⾏文學」，主要強調作品閱讀外，亦注重旅⾏技術⾯。作品
閱讀包括各種穿越邊境、沙漠、城鎮、河川的旅遊書寫與文學書寫中的⾏旅；技術⾯包括各種關於旅
⾏的配備裝置、路線規劃、住宿選擇、省錢旅⾏法、旅遊資源利⽤等。希望透過⼀學期的材料閱讀與
技術指導，⿎舞修課同學繪製出屬於⾃⼰的地圖，背起背包，展開青春的冒險與壯遊。

中文名稱  Course Title ：魏晉文學批評史料研究
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Readings on Literature Criticism of Wei-chin Period
任課教師  Instructor ：朱曉海
上課時間  Time ： W7W8W9 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C501 ／ 30
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
魏、晉⼀向被視為文學⾃覺、文學批評萌芽的重要階段，但歷史事實與流俗說法頗有距離。⾄少當時
對於何謂美、文學⼀詞外延的寬窄、文學作品的位階，其複雜程度不是⼀兩篇熟爛文字可概括，⽽書
⾯所表述的與具體作品透露的底蘊之間更有背反現象。因此，個⼈以為有待實事求是，⽅能在這領域
的研究上⾃益益⼈。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
沒有現成可⽤的課本。每⼀次，告知下週要閱讀、討論的材料，這些材料全出⾃原典，包括《三國
志》及裴注、《中論》、《陸⼠龍集》、《抱朴⼦》、《文選》、《藝文類聚》、《群書治要》等，
希望藉機讓同學接觸古籍，以便將來研究時，知道有哪些可搜尋的⽅向。
三、參考書籍 (References)
如上所列
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
單⽅⾯講授，但希望同學能每次預習，藉此比較你們與我對同⼀段文本的理解與關注點有何異同，是
否能從中學習到以往疏忽的地⽅。
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
每講完⼀單元，公佈下⼀次要尋找與講授的材料。
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
期末繳⼀篇報告。報告題⽬必須是狹窄、具體的；篇幅不超過四、五千字。範圍限於魏、晉時期的
文、史、哲學。
切記：不得有任何⼀⼩節或⼀段抄襲，或採取洗文⽅式（將某論著拆散⽽後重組，或以⾃⼰的話將原
論著重述），否則，學期成績將以零分計。換⾔之，必須是原創的。
科號  Course Number ： 11120CL
525100學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：敘述理論專題
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Topics in the Theory of Narrative
任課教師  Instructor ：蔡英俊
上課時間  Time ： F6F7F8 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C501 ／ 30
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
敘述乃是指稱⼀種講述故事（ story-telling ）的能⼒與活動。如果依據這個簡單的定義來看，那
麼，有關敘述的討論與研究，其實可以涵蓋文化現象光譜中的諸多⾯向。本課程試圖從⻄⽅敘述文
類與敘述傳統的歷史發展此⼀脈絡出發，檢視⼆⼗世紀以來在敘述理論與敘述學⽅⾯的相關論題與
論述；⾄於授課內容，⾸先將研讀、討論的重點集中在當代哲學、歷史學、⼼理（分析）學以及政
治哲學的範疇中有關敘述、⾃我與認同的論題。
⼀、⾸先是理解相關術語與概念的歷史語境，討論的材料是柏拉圖與亞⾥⼠多德著述中的相關篇
章；其次則是理解當代論述脈絡中有關歷史、敘述與認同的相關論題。（注意：「敘述」與「模
擬」或「再現」概念本⾝的發展。）【選讀篇章： ※ 柏拉圖著，郭斌和、張⽵明譯：《理想國》
（北京：商務印書館， 1986; 1997 ），第三卷，⾴ 94-102 。 ※ 亞⾥⼠多德著，陳中梅譯注：《詩
學》（北京：商務印書館， 1996 ），第⼀章，⾴ 27-28 ；第三章，⾴ 42-43 ；第五章，⾴ 58-59 ；第
六章，⾴ 63-65 。 ※ 漢娜 ‧ 阿倫特（漢娜 ‧ 鄂蘭）著，竺乾威等譯：《⼈的條件》（ 1957 ；上海：上海
⼈⺠出版社， 1999 ），第五章：⾏動，⾴ 178-189 。 ※ 蔡英文：〈歷史叙事與⼈的⾃我認同〉，
《政治實踐與公共空間：漢娜 ‧ 鄂蘭的政治思想》（臺北：聯經出版公司， 2002 ），第五章，⾴ 123-
37。】
⼆、⼩說做為敘述文類所展開的相關的敘述理論，在此， E. M. Forster’s Aspects of the
Novel (1927), Rene Wellek and Austin Warren’s Theory of Literature (1949), Wayne
Booth’s The Rhetoric of Fiction (1961) 以及 Robert Scholes and Robert Kellogg’s
The Nature of Narrative (1966) 即是我們討論的起點；我們思考的問題即在於這些具有歷史
性前導意義的論著到底提供哪些後續相關的論題。（注意：《⼩說修辭學》⼀書中所論及的「修辭
學」的可能義涵。）【選讀篇章： ※ 佛斯特著，李文彬譯：《⼩說⾯⾯觀》（臺北：志文出版社，
1974）。 ※Austin Warren, “The Nature and Modes of Narrative Fiction.” In Rene
Wellek and Austin Warren’s Theory of Literature, pp. 212-225. ※ 布斯著，華明等
譯：《⼩說修辭學》（北京：北京⼤學出版社， 1987 ）。】
三、結構主義興起以後，關於敘述文類的分析⽅法與分析模式，在此，最早由俄國學者 Vladimir
Propp針對童話與⺠間故事所提出的⾓⾊功能論  (1928;1968) 、法國學者 Roland Barthes’s
“Introduction to the Structural Analysis of Narrative” (1966; 1977) 所提出的概念
與分析， Barthes 在  S/Z (1970; 1974) ⼀書中倡議的五種閱讀符碼，以及  A.-J. Greimas 在
《結構語義學》⼀書中所提出的「⾏動元模式」（ actantial model ）的觀點  (1966; 1983) ，則
是我們討論的重點；另外，我們也將研讀 Paul Ricoeur 對於 Propp 與 Greimas 兩⼈論點所做的評
論，並且藉此理解 Ricoeur 試圖展⽰的論述重點。（注意：《結構語義學》⼀書中所論及的「結構」
與「語義學」的可能義涵。）【選讀篇章： ※ ⾼辛勇：《形名學與敘述理論》，臺北：聯經出版公
司， 1985 。 ※Propp 、 Barthes 以及 Greimas 部分論文篇章中譯。】
四、敘述學本⾝所提⽰的相關論題及其解說，在此， Gerard Genette 的兩本著作， Narrative
Discourse: An Essay in Method （ 1972; 1980 ）以及 Narrative Discourse Revisited
（1983; 1988 ）將是我們研讀的主要材料；⾄於聚焦討論的論題則是在「透視點」
（perspective ）、「焦點」（ focalization ）與「隱含的作者」（ implied author ）這些概念
的複雜度。
五、最後，在當代哲學、歷史學、⼼理（分析）學以及政治哲學的範疇中，有關敘述、⾃我與認同
的論題也⾃有其重要性，我們將選讀部份材料，以此做為敘述理論領域中⼀種開放性的結尾。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
1. Richard Kearney, On Stories. London and New York: Routledge, 2002.
2. Jerome Bruner, Making Stories: Law, Literature, Life. New York: Farrar,
Straus and Giroux, 2002.
三、參考書籍 (References)

中文名稱  Course Title ：古典⼩說的邊陲視域與異境書寫
英文名稱  Course English Title ： The Frontier in Traditional Chinese Fiction

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
展讀中國古典⼩說，可發現許多文⼈書寫邊陲異境，不論文⼈是主動抑或被動地前往邊緣異
地，皆留下不少敘事文獻。例如宋代《太平廣記》、《夷堅志》記載了許多漂流海外的筆記，牽涉到
當時的海外想像與海上經濟活動。⽽在明清兩代，文⼈們的⾜跡遍及⻄南、新疆、嶺南或東北，他們
留下的敘事文本皆開拓了古典⼩說的研究視域及範疇，例如《野叟曝⾔》中的⻄南敘事，以及筆記⼩
說如《廣東新語》、《觚剩》，可讓我們了解清初文⼈如何觀看邊陲地區，亦可挖掘位處邊陲的文⼈
如何審視⾃⾝與中原地區之關係。透過釐清與探討歷代文⼈書寫邊陲所呈現的世界觀，可進⽽銜接晚
清文⼈對於⻄⽅國家的書寫，完整呈現中國文⼈世界觀之流變。
本研究所課程所探討的⼩說文本，不侷限於文學性的解讀，亦將視⾓延伸⾄歷史學、文化地理
學、⼈類學、社會學、宗教學等不同學科，期能帶領學⽣在閱讀古典文獻時，開拓跨領域的研究向
度，厚植⼈文關懷。

四、教學⽅式
前⼆⾄三週以教師講授為主，之後每週設計問題，帶領學⽣分組討論，在討論過程中引導學⽣抉發問
題意識，激盪多元觀點切磋交流，從各種⾓度來理解與詮釋文本，與⾃⾝⽣命情感相互聯結。
五、教學進度
第1週  緒論
授課內容：
說明課程內容與配分⽅式、學術倫理與寫作規範。
本課程擬從文學、史學、文化地理學、⼈類學、社會學、宗教學等跨領域的視野，探討古典⼩說中的
邊陲視域與異境書寫。
閱讀文獻：

中文名稱  Course Title ：近現代⼩說專題
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Topics on Modern Chinese Novels
任課教師  Instructor ：顏健富
上課時間  Time ： T6T7T8 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C501 ／ 30
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
近現代中國文學出現紛雜多姿的⾯貌，從文藝思想、文學⼿法、文體變⾰、翻譯創作乃⾄文本之流
動，都有許多變動。本課程將以議題切入，透過主題的⽅式，將近現代⼩說材料推到⼀具有世界文
藝流通的框架，突顯相關作品的潛能，進⽽重構可能的闡釋架構，賦予相關材料更⼤的能動性與多向
性。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
⾃編講義
三、參考書籍 (References)
陳平原、夏曉虹編，《⼆⼗世紀中國⼩說理論資料》
祝均宙，《圖鑑百年文獻：晚清⺠國年間期刊源流特點探究》
楊聯芬，《晚清⾄五四：中國文學現代性的發⽣》
夏志清，《中國現代⼩說史》
錢理群、吳福輝等，《中國現代文學三⼗年》
王德威，《茅盾、老舍、沈從文：寫實主義與現代中國⼩說》
楊義，《⼆⼗世紀中國⼩說與文化》

科號  Course Number ： 11120CL
535600學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：文⼼雕龍研究
英文名稱  Course English Title ： The Literary Mind and the Carving of Dragons （ Wen xin
diao lung）
任課教師  Instructor ：簡良如
上課時間  Time ： MnM5M6 上課教室  Room ：⼈Ｂ 302A ／ 15
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
本課程將《文⼼雕龍》定位為思想性論著。理由除了篇⽬明顯可⾒的體系特徵，該書窮盡全部⼈文成
果及其歷史為討
論對象的做法，亦顯⽰⾝為思想理論應有的整全性。作為最先、也是唯⼀以「文」為思想主題的著
作，《文⼼雕龍》
之意義應予關切。不僅因為它代表著「文」已取代「德」、「政」、「禮」、「物」、「名」、
「法」等現實主題，
躍升為概括時代整體及其理想本質者；也由於「文」在六朝已由共體禮樂轉為個體智術創為，反映出
⼈類存在意識與
精神活動領域的極⼤變化。換⾔之，《文⼼雕龍》所處理的是「對反現實之精神活動」及「個體」如
何可能正確締造
⼈類價值與存在願景這⼀困難問題。「文體論」對經學的重新分析，「文術論」對個體元素其組合與
運⽤情況的探
討，正分別對應「對反現實之精神活動」與「個體」⽽有，前者⾯向「常道」，後者即「⼼」之構
成。此立⾜於中國
特有經學傳統下之「文」之思想，其對⼈類問題本質與終極之詮釋，由於相對任何思想體系來說皆屬
獨特，它的出現
與成果實令⼈驚異。
⼆、教材與基本書⽬
下列書⽬，以協助讀者進⾏對《文⼼雕龍》之文本閱讀與分析為主：
1.教師⾃備講義。
2.范文瀾：《文⼼雕龍注》，台北：台灣開明書局， 1985 年。
3.譚家哲：《詩文學思想 · 卷⼀》，台北：漫遊者出版社， 2016 年。
4.簡良如：《文⼼雕龍之作為思想體系》，北京：中國社會科學出版社， 2011 年。
5.楊明照：《文⼼雕龍校注拾遺》，台北：崧⾼書社， 1985 年。
6.朱迎平：《文⼼雕龍索引》，上海：上海古籍出版社， 1987 年。
7.王利器：《文⼼雕龍校證》，上海：上海古籍出版社， 1980 年。
8.李⽈剛：《文⼼雕龍斠詮》，台北：國立編譯館中華叢書編審委員會， 1982 年。
9.王禮卿：《文⼼雕龍通解》，台北：黎明文化事業公司， 1986 年。
10.詹 [⾦英 ]; ：《文⼼雕龍義證》，上海：上海古籍出版社， 1989 年。
三、教學⽅式
教師講授為主。唯因《文⼼》篇章較多，部分未能專論之章節，將請同學輪流釋義和摘要。
四、預擬授課內容
1.「文」作為思想主題所代表之意義
2.《文⼼雕龍》篇章結構與原理
3.經學文學化之意義
4.文學史之思想意義
5.個體作為⼈文制作主體之意義
6.文體論思想與經學性
7.文與⾃然問題分析
五、評量⽅式：
課堂報告  60% 、期末考  40%

任課教師  Instructor ：劉⼈鵬
上課時間  Time ： F2F3F4 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C501 ／ 30
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
（暫定，開學後可能依學⽣情況⽽調整）
課程說明：
本課程從⽅法與視野著眼，選擇性地探討⽬前性／別研究的若⼲議題。本學期主要討論⼆個議題，其
⼀是「如何研究
古典文學中的性／別」，其⼆為「『中國婦女』與『國族』：『⾃主』或『主體性』的焦慮」；以具
體文本為例，討
論⽬前性／別研究中知識框架、詮釋、再現等相關問題。不同於⼀般先介紹理論再解讀文本的慣習，
本課程先從文本
發現相關議題，⽽後透過理論選讀，擴⼤視野，並進⼀步思考問題。

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
* 教學內容及進度 Content and syllabus:
本課程專為從未學過華語之學⽣所設計，從發⾳及拼⾳開始教授，讓學⽣在短時間內學會⼀些常⽤
的基本⽇常⽣活⽤語，內容主題涵蓋：簡單的⾃我介紹、打招呼、談論家⼈、愛好、購物、食物、
地點、⽅位及時間，並能⽤中文詢問及回應選擇性問題進⽽給予簡單建議。
Mandarin Basic I is designed for students who have never learned Chinese
before. The course will be covering from phonics/pinyin to basic daily
conversation (e.g., self-introduction, saying hello, family, hobbies,
shopping, food, location, and time). Students will also learn how to ask
questions and answer simple questions, or make simple suggestions. Classes
include listening, speaking, reading and writing.
*授課⽅式 Teaching methods:
老師講授、師⽣互動、⼩組討論、活動練習、任務型教學
Lectures, class activities, group discussion, task-based learning

⼩考  Quizzes ： 15%
期中考（筆試 ) Midterm (written) ： 15%
期末考（筆試） Final Exam (written) ： 30%

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Mandarin Basic Ⅱ

上課時間  Time ： TaTbRaRb 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 103 ／ 47

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
修習過初級華語⼀，或學習時數達到 700-100 個⼩時，累積詞彙量約 400 個。本課程預計學習範圍為
《當代中文課程》第⼀冊第八課⾄第⼗五課，授課時數共 72 ⼩時。 Mandarin Basic (II) is for
students who have taken Mandarin Basic (I), or have learned 70-100 hours of
Mandarin before (need to know at least 400 Chinese characters, familiar with
pinyin system and basic sentence structures). We are going to learn Lesson 8-15
with A Course in Contemporary Chinese Book 1.
1.本課程除了希望學⽣對於簡短的⾔談，能理解內容與掌握重點、能使⽤簡單的短語或句⼦敘述解
釋原因或說明理由、⽇常⽣活中熟悉的事物及每⽇例⾏性事務，並能簡單地描述事件及短片的內
容。  The class focuses on basic communication skills, more characters and
grammars. Students are required to explain/describe the reasons and
daily/routine affairs. Classes are comprised of listening, speaking, reading
and writing lessons.
2.內容涵蓋：旅遊計畫、交通⼯具、休閒活動、食物、租屋、未來計畫及個⼈經驗、電話⽤語、表
達祝賀與祝福、天氣、比較兩個事件、⾝體症狀等。  The content including travel plan,
transportation, activities and hobbies, foods, rent a house, future plan and
experiences, phone phrases, blessing phrases, weather, comparison, symptoms of
body, etc.
3.中文課有很多練習、功課和考試，選課以前，請你想⼀想。
****IMPORTANT******Please think twice before you take this course.****
1. This course will require students to do "a lot of homework" (e.g.,listening
and writing assignment).
2. This course will require students to do the "quizzes and exams" periodically.
3. If you have many experiment in you lab, or you are too busy to learn, please
choose the other course.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
A Course in Contemporary Chinese (Textbook) 1
A Course in Contemporary Chinese (Student Workbook) 1
A Course in Contemporary Chinese (Character Workbook) 1

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程預計學習範圍為《當代中文課程》第⼆冊第⼀課⾄第七課，授課時數共 72 ⼩時。
1.本課程希望學⽣能以中文表達比較、妥協及建議，並能⽤中文描述⽇常⽣活時程及學習語⾔的經驗
與過去的學歷及經驗；此外，能使⽤中文提出假設性問題或回應該類問題；就文化部分，除了讓學
⽣了解台灣婚禮傳統並能表達對文化差異之體認及對新事物的看法。
2.內容涵蓋：問路、交通⽅式、專業領域相關詞語、祝賀語、租屋、喜好等。
3.已有此課程學分者，不建議再修讀。
4.中文課有很多練習、作業和考試，都要準時完成，我建議你要選課以前，想⼀想再選。
***This course will require students to do a lot of homework (e.g.,writing and
speaking assignment).
***This course will require students to do the quizzes and exams periodically.
***If you have many experiment in you lab, or you are too busy to learn, please
choose the other course.
***Please think twice before you take this course.

⼀、課程⼤綱 (Course Description):
The Basic conversation class is a course that helps students build their
language foundation within a short period of time so they will not have

文表達接受或婉拒邀約及個⼈⼼中滿意與失望、談論事件或情形的好壞、說出及聽懂抱怨並給予建
議，更甚能推測⼀
件事的起因。

●課程說明／ Course Description
在這⾨課，我們主要學的是「從事商業貿易或在⼯作時會聽到和看到」的中文。
除了中文之外，我們也會學怎麼讀懂和怎麼寫⼀些職場上常⾒的文件或表單。
〈商⽤華語⼆〉會介紹的⼯作情境有這些：
參加商業的展覽、宴請客⼾、產品⾏銷、客⼾服務、國際貿易與商務談判。
如果你想更加了解怎麼⽤中文⼯作，或者想為以後找⼯作提早做準備，這⾨課很歡迎你。
＊兩週會上完⼀課，加上詞彙與閱讀材料都不簡單，因此不建議初級學習者選修。
Please note that the course is not suitable for basic-level Chinese learners.

中文名稱  Course Title ：通訊之隨機程序
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Random Processes for Communications
任課教師  Instructor ：洪樂文
上課時間  Time ： T7T8W7W8 上課教室  Room ：台達 210 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course will cover the fundamental theory of random processes with
emphasis on applications to signal processing and communications. This is a
basic yet important course for students pursuing studies in these fields.
The course will include basic concepts, stationarity, convergence of random
sequences, law of large numbers, important examples of random processes, and
applications to communications and signal processing.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Athanasios Papoulis and S. Unnikrishna Pillai, "Probability, Random
Variables, and Stochastic Processes," McGraw Hill, 2002
Robert G. Gallager, Stochastic Processes: Theory for Applications, Cambridge
University Press, 2017
三、參考書籍 (References)
TBD
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
3 hours of weekly lectures plus reading assignments and homework
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1.Brief Review on Random Variables and Random Vectors.
2.Random Sequences and Random Processes
Basic concepts; basic principles of discrete-time linear systems; Random
sequences and linear systems; Wide-sense stationary (WSS) random sequences;
Markov random sequences; Vector Random sequences and state equations;
Convergence of Random sequences; Law of large numbers
3.Random Processes
Basic definitions; Some important random processes; Continuous-time linear
systems with random inputs; Wide-sense stationary processes and LSI systems;
Periodic and cyclostationary processes; Vector processes and state
equations.
Midterm
4.Advanced Topics in Random Processes
Markov Chains; Ergodicity; Karhunen-Loeve expansion; Representation of
bandlimited and periodic processes.
5.Applications to Statistical Signal Processing
Estimation of random variables; innovation sequences and Kalman Filtering;
Wiener filters for random processes; Spectral Estimation.
Final Exam
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
30% Homework
35% Midterm
35% Final Exam.

516000學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：

中文名稱  Course Title ：展頻通訊
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Spread Spectrum Communications
任課教師  Instructor ：蔡育仁
上課時間  Time ： T7T8R7 上課教室  Room ：台達 212 ／ 22
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course introduces the fundamental knowledge of spread spectrum communication systems. Two major
spread spectrum techniques, including direct-sequence spread spectrum (DSSS) and frequency-hop spread
spectrum (FHSS), will be comprehensively studied. Three principal functions, including the pseudo-random
sequence generator, code tracking loop and the initial code synchronizer, will be deeply investigated. Finally,
from the system viewpoint, the CDMA concept and some related techniques will be introduced.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Roger L. Peterson, Introduction to Spread Spectrum Communications, Prentice Hall International, 1995.
三、參考書籍 (References)
Valery P. Ipatov, Spread Spectrum and CDMA – Principles and Applications, John Wiley & Sons, 2005.
K. Fazel and S. Kaiser, Multi-Carrier and Spread Spectrum Systems, John Wiley & Sons, 2003.
Kamil Sh. Zigangirov, Theory of Code Division Multiple Access Communication, John Wiley & Sons, 2004.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures (Lecture notes will be provided in the following website.)
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to Spread Spectrum Systems
2. Direct-Sequence Spread Spectrum Technique
3. Frequency-Hop Spread Spectrum Technique
4. Binary Shift-Register Sequences
5. m-sequences
6. Gold-sequences
7. Code Tracking Loops
8. Initial Synchronization
9. Code Division Multiple Access
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Homework: 30%
Midterm Exam: 35%
Final Exam: 35%

科號  Course Number ： 11120COM
541000學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
32
中文名稱  Course Title ：光纖通訊系統
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Optical Fiber Communication Systems
任課教師  Instructor ：馮開明  Feng Kai-Ming
上課時間  Time ： R2R3R4 上課教室  Room ：台達 202 ／ 32
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This is a basic introductory course of current optical fiber communication
system. In this course, you will learn the basic concept of optical fiber,
some selected fiber devices, and optical communication systems, including
Wavelength-Division-Multiplexing (WDM) system, analog CATV system, and optical
networks. This course will focus more on the physical layer design of optical
fiber communication systems. Some basic and frequently used optical network
protocols will also be introduced. This course is suitable for seniors and
graduate students who are interested in both communications and electro-optics
and would like to pursue further studies on the physical layer of optical
communication systems and devices.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Govind P. Agrawal, Fiber-Optic Communication Systems, 3rd Edition, John Wiley &
Sons, Inc., 2002.
三、參考書籍 (References)
Optical Fiber Telecommunications, VI A & VI B, edited by Ivan Kaminow & Tingye
Li, Academic Press, 2002.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Oral
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction: Evolution of telecommunication systems and networks
2. Characteristics of optical fiber:
Basic characteristics of optical fiber: optical fiber geometries, wave
propagation in fiber, fiber dispersion, fiber attenuation, fiber
nonlinearities and fiber fabrication.
3. Optical Fiber Components:
Passive Devices: star couplers, WDM couplers, array-waveguide grating
(AWG), attenuators… etc.
Active Devices: transmitter, receiver, modulator, optical amplifier… etc.
4. Optical Fiber Systems
System design and performance, multiple wavelength channel lightwave system
(WDM), soliton communication systems, analog CATV system and challenges of
next generation optical fiber communication systems.
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Homework (every other week): 20%,
Midterm Examination: 40%
Final Examination or Term Paper & Oral Presentation 40%

科號  Course Number ： 11120CS
125000學分  Credit ： 2⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
120
中文名稱  Course Title ：資料結構導論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Data Structure
任課教師  Instructor ：韓永楷
上課時間  Time ： M5M6 上課教室  Room ：台達 107 ／ 150
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This course introduces some classical and smart methods to store the data so
that we can answer questions about the data efficiently. As an example, let us
imagine that we have the exam scores of all students, and from time to time
different student would ask how many other students get a higher score than
him/her. In order to speed up the query, one may store the scores in sorted
order rather than in a random order.
Our focus will be on both the theoretical performance and the practical
implementation of the data structures.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Book)
1. Introduction to Algorithms, 3rd edition, MIT Press, by T. Cormen, C. E.
Leiserson, and R. L. Rivest
三、參考書籍  (References)
1. Algorithms in C++, (or Algorithms in Java), by R. Sedgewick
2. The Art of Computer Programming, by D. E. Knuth
3. Fundamentals of Data Structures in C++, by E. Horowitz, S. Sahni, and
D. Mehta
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Home Study + Classroom Discussion + Online Discussion
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
Tentative topics to be covered:
1. Growth of Functions
2. Arrays
3. Heaps
4. Sorting
5. Lists, Stacks, and Queues
6. Trees and Graphs
7. Searching Set Data
8. Hashing

3 Assignments (Programming) 40%
3 Exams (Programming) 60%

[課程概述  Course Description]
The course “Introduction to programming II” has two goals. First, it drills
the programmability of students via more practices and examples. Second, it
introduces the basic knowledge and concepts of computer science through
programming. Students who want to take this course should be familiar with
basic programming in C.

programming
5. How to make programs smarter? ----- AI and computer gaming

中文名稱  Course Title ： Python 語⾔程式入⾨
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Programming in Python
任課教師  Instructor ：周百祥
上課時間  Time ： M2W3W4 上課教室  Room ：台達 108 ／ 116
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Description
This course introduces fundamental programming concepts in the Python language and related
environment. Fundamental concepts include overview of computer systems, Python environment setup,
Python language overview, command line interface, numbers, string formatting, sequences, dictionaries
and sets, control flow, exception, file, function, recursion, object orientation, inheritance, polymorphism,
and modules. The programming environment will be primarily text-based in Unix environment, although
graphical user interface (IDLE) and web-based (Jupyter) will also be demonstrated.
Restrictions:
- CS1358 and EECS1210 may not both be taken for credit.
Textbooks
- None required
References
- 洪維恩，《 Python 教學⼿冊》， ISBN 9789863126881, 出版社：旗標科技股份有限公司
- Mark Summerfield, Programming in Python 3: A Complete Introduction to the Python Language, Second
Edition, Addison-Wesley, 2010, Person Education, Inc., Boston, MA USA.
- Python website, www.python.org
Teaching Method
- 2 hours of recorded lecture (Mandarin with English captions) and a quiz every other week.
Syllabus
Week 1 - introduction, environment setup
Week 2 - tour of Python
Week 3 - basic types, command-line application
Week 4 - command-line application (cont'd), strings
Week 5 - collections: sequence (list, tuple), set, dict
Week 6 - control constructs: if, while, for
Week 7 - exceptions, files
Week 8 - functions
Week 9 - recursion, functional programming
Week 10 -object-oriented programming part 1: class, method
Week 11 - object-oriented programming part 2: inheritance, operator overloading
Week 12 - generators, iterators
Week 13 - standard library part 1: data types, itertools
Week 14 - standard library part 2: regular expressions, Tkinter
Evaluation
30% - assignments
30% - quizzes
40% - final exam

中文名稱  Course Title ：軟體設計與實驗

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、  課程說明  (Course Description)
This course presents hands-on labs in the software aspect for students to be
familiar with software design and development processes. The class follows a
mainstream of building a useful web/mobile app under selected topics. We introduce
some important software design concepts and development tools.
The course is taught in two parallel tracks. The first track guide students to
identify user needs , design core features, build prototypes, and conduct
usability tests. The second part teaches fundamental web programming techniques,
including javascript, reactive programming, backend development, and web/app
intelligence.
Students are required to be familiar with an object-oriented programming
language
(like C++ or Java) and data structure.

TRACK-II HTML/CSS, javascript, reactive programming, backend development,
and
web/app intelligence

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Probability
任課教師  Instructor ：李端興

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course introduces the students to the theory of probability.
The course covers the following subjects in probability: probability space,
independence, conditional probability, random variables, mathematical expectations,
probability density functions and limit theorems.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Saeed Ghahramani, "Fundamentals of Probability with stochastic processes," 4-th edition, Pearson, 2019.
三、參考書籍 (References)
Sheldon Ross, “A first course in probability,” eighth edition, Pearson, 2010.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecturing
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Axionms of Probability (2 weeks)
2. Combinatorial Analysis (2 weeks)
3. Conditional Probability and Independence (2 weeks)
4. Distribution Functions and Discrete Random Variables (2 weeks)
5. Continuous Random Variables (2 weeks)
6. Jointly Distributed Random Variables (2 weeks)
7. Expectations and Variances (2 weeks)
8. Limit Theorems (2 weeks)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
1. Home work: 15%
2. Midterm I: 25%
3. Midterm II: 25%
3. Final: 25%
4. Class participation: 10%

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程為嵌入式系統之入⾨課程，簡介嵌入式系統之基本概念。課程⾸先介紹 Cortex A-53 微控制器以
及如何操控 Cortex A-53 的主要元件，如 basic I/O, timing and clocking, interrupt
handling, serial communication 等，以進⾏嵌入式系統開發。其次，課程利⽤ Raspberry Pi 開發
板，介紹 embedded real-time OS, synchronization, sensor modules 等。課程設計以實驗
為
主，修課學⽣須每週上實驗課，並在期末完成⼀期末專題。建議學⽣先修作業系統。

Learning Bytes Publishing, 2016.

Language and C: Third Edition, E-Man Press LLC, 2017.

10. ADC and PWM

科號  Course Number ： 11120CS
446100學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
100
中文名稱  Course Title ：軟體⼯程
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Software Engineering
任課教師  Instructor ：黃慶育
上課時間  Time ： M5M6R5 上課教室  Room ：台達 105 ／ 142
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
The course is an introduction to software engineering. State-of-practice and
state-of-the-art principles, methods, and tools for planning, design,
coding, validation and maintenance of software systems will be studied and
discussed. Among the topics covered are: software requirement engineering,
specification techniques, structured design, structured programming, top-down
design and development, segmentation and modularization techniques,
information hiding, iterative enhancement, design and code inspection
techniques, correctness, chief-programmer teams, the software life cycle
methodology, software management, software validation and verification
techniques, software metrics, resource and cost models, software reliability
measurement, data collection and analysis. The course discusses both the
empirical aspects of software engineering and the underlying theory.
Practical software engineering is given special attention.
⼆、指定⽤書
1. Roger S. Pressman, Software Engineering: A Practitioner's Approach, 8th
Edition, McGraw-Hill, 2014.
2. Ian Sommerville, Software Engineering, 10th Edition, Pearson, 2016.
3. Shari Lawrence Pfleeger and Joanne M. Atlee, Software Engineering: Theory
and Practice, 4th Edition, Prentice Hall, 2010.
三、參考書籍
1. Stephen Schach, object Oriented and Classical Software Engineering, 8th
Edition, McGraw-Hill, 2011.
2. Shari Lawrence Pfleeger and Joanne M. Atlee, Software Engineering: Theory
and Practice, 4th Edition, Prentice Hall, 2009.
3. Watts S. Humphrey, Introduction to the Team Software Process, Addison
Wesley, 1999.
四、教學⽅式
教學⽅式：以投影片⼝述為主，數次電腦輔助軟體⼯程⼯具 (CASE Tools) 現場⽰範 (Demo) 為
輔，另安排學期中１～２次的「校外企業參訪」，使本課程授課內容能與業界實際發展情況緊密
結合。
五、教學進度
教學進度：依指定⽤書之內容每週 1 個章節 (Chapter) ，必要時酌量調整之。另本課程內含校外
企業參訪 (1~2 次 ), 每次均有參訪⼈限 .
1. 軟體⼯程導論 (Introduction to Software Engineering)
2. 軟體開發過程 (Software Development Process Model)
3. 軟體專案管理 (Software Project Management)
4. 軟體成本估算 (Software Cost Estimation)
5. 軟體⼤⼩度量 (Software Size Estimation)
6. 軟體品質保証 (Software Quality Assurance)
7. 校外企業參訪 (I)---optional
8. 軟體需求分析 (Software Requirement Analysis)
9. 軟體系統分析與設計 (Software System Analysis and Design)
10.軟體測試 I(Software Testing I)
11.軟體測試 II(Software Testing II)
12.軟體可靠度⼯程簡介 (Software Reliability Engineering)
13.軟體能⼒成熟度整合模式簡介 ( ＣＭＭＩ )
14.軟體風險管理 (Software Risk Management)

科號  Course Number ： 11120CS
512200學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
40
中文名稱  Course Title ：超⼤型積體電路量產可⾏性設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： VLSI Design for Manufacturability
任課教師  Instructor ：麥偉基  MAK WAI KEI
上課時間  Time ： T5T6R7 上課教室  Room ：台達 104 ／ 116
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
We have seen an incredible increase in the achievable density, performance, and complexity of integrated
circuits. It is the result of the IC industry's continuous scaling of the minimum feature size. However, there are
many challenges in maintaining the aggressive pace of technology scaling. Chip fabrication has become
increasingly difficult with various kinds of manufacturing effects surfacing. As a result, many more
manufacturing design rules are added and more sophisticated design methodologies are introduced.
Manufacturing-aware physical design is necessary to ensure chip manufacturability and guarantee the yield.
Besides, the conventional 193nm immersion (193i) lithography with single exposure has already reached its
printability limit at the 28nm technology node. To extend Moore’s Law, different solutions like extensions of
193 immersion with multiple patterning, extreme ultraviolet (EUV) lithography, directed self-assembly (DSA),
nanoimprint, and electron beam (e-beam) lithography have been and are still being actively explored by the
semiconductor industry.
In this course, we will introduce manufacturing-aware physical design. We will examine some representative
research works in this area and learn a variety of algorithmic techniques for solving these challenging
problems efficiently.
This course will be of interest to three types of students:
1. Students interested in integrated circuit design and manufacturing.
2. Students interested in software design. Many of the optimization algorithms we will talk about (A*-search,
linear programming, integer linear programming, dynamic programming, different graph algorithms, Monte
Carlo algorithm, satisfiability, etc.) have many applications outside of CAD tool design. Understanding these
algorithms is an essential component of any software designer's arsenal.
3. Students interested in pursuing research in CAD tool design. This is an exciting, fast moving area with
many
research opportunities.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
No required textbook.
Lecture notes will be provided at the class.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures, assignments, literature survey, student presentation
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Maze Routing under Nanometer Design Rules
2. Redundant Via Insertion
3. Dummy Fill Insertion
4. Detailed Placement Refinement for Complex Manufacturing Constraints
5. Lithography Hotspot Detection
6. Double/Triple Patterning-Aware Physical Design (layout decomposition, routing, detailed placement)
7. Self-Aligned Double Patterning (SADP)-Aware Physical Design (layout decomposition, routing)
8. E-Beam Direct Write/Mask Writing
9. Optimization with Hybrid Lithography (Multiple Patterning/Directed Self-Assembly/e-beam)
10. Extreme Ultraviolet (EUV) Lithography Optimization
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Assignments: 40%
Exam (or Project): 30%
Survey & presentation of research papers: 30%

40
中文名稱  Course Title ：多媒體網路與系統
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Multimedia Networking and Systems
任課教師  Instructor ：徐正炘
上課時間  Time ： M7M8R6 上課教室  Room ：台達 102 ／ 100
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
1. 課程說明 (Course Description)
This course covers the latest research in the areas of networking and multimedia systems. Despite the basic
concepts of multimedia networking will be reviewed, the course is a graduate-level course and requires each
student to work on an intensive term project. Students are expected to regularly present their project progress
and turn in publishable technical reports, in order to pass the course.
The lectures will be given in English. All the reports must be in English.
2. 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
- Li, Drew, and Liu, Fundamentals of Multimedia, 3rd Ed., Springer, 2021 (available online on campus).
- Kurose and Rose, Computer Networking: A Top-down Approach, 8th Edition, Person, 2022.
3. 參考書籍 (References)
- Students will search, print, read, and present the latest search papers under the guidance of the instructor.
4. 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Each student will propose and carry out a research project. The expectation for each graduate student is to
generate a research paper at the end of the semester. The expectation for each undergraduate student is to
generate a report for a well-known multimedia grand challenge problem; or to produce a good system demo
with demo abstract at the end of the semester. Students who do not deliver publishable reports at the end of the
semester will fail the course.
5. 教學進度 (Syllabus)
The following tentative topics will be presented by the instructor, if not all students are familiar with them
already.
- Internet Architecture and Services
- Audio/Video Coding Overview
- Scalable Video Coding
- Adaptive Multimedia Streaming
- Stream Synchronization
- Streaming to Wireless and Mobile Devices
- Content-aware Multimedia Streaming and Storage
- 3D Mobile Video
The following is not an exhausted list of the latest research topic in multimedia networking:
- Volumetric videos streamed to head mounted displays (3DoF+ or 6DoF)
- Multimedia Internet-of-Things
- Media-Aware Network Elements
- Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality
- 3D Scene Reconstructions
- Machine-learning Enabled Multimedia
- Point Cloud Compression
- Multimodal Speaker Recognition in Video Conferences
- Decentralized Social Media
6. 成績考核 (Evaluations)
- Quizzes (10 times): 30%
- Paper presentation and discussion: 30%
- Term paper: 40%
Note that students who do not deliver publishable reports at the end of the semester will receive failing grades.

任課教師  Instructor ：蔡明哲
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W2 上課教室  Room ：台達 102 ／ 100
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Graph theory is a delightful playground for the exploration of proof techniques
in discrete mathematics, and its results have applications in many areas of the
computing, social, and natural sciences. Some algorithms and applications are
included, but the focus is on understanding the structure of graphs and the
techniques used to analyze problems in graph theory.
Students that would like to take this course are assumed to be interested in and
have knowledge of discrete maths and algorithm.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
“Introduction to Graph Theory", Douglas B. West, 2rd Edition, Prentice Hall

任課教師  Instructor ：⽯維寬

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course
Description)
This course will
focus
on the
traditionally
central
areas of
the theory of
computation:
automata
and
computability.
1. The automata
theory
studies
the definitions and
properties of
models of
computation.
These
models
are used in several
applied areas
of computer
science. E.g.,
the
finite
automaton model is
used
in text
processing,
compilers, and
hardware design.
2. The
computability
theory
studies how to
classify
problems
that are
solvable by
computers and
problems that are
not
solvable.
The theory
arises from the
discovery
that certain basic
problems
cannot be solved
by computers.
(The
discovery
was made during the
first half of
the 20th
century, by
mathematicians
such as Godel,
Turing,
and
Church.)
In this course, we
will
introduce
some of the
fundamental
results
in each
of the above areas.

Book)

Complexity,
by Christos
Papadimitiou
2. Introduction
to
Automata
Theory, Languages,
and
Computation, by
John
Hopcroft,
Rajeev
Motwani, and Jeff
Ullman.
3 Introduction
to
the Theory
of Computation (2nd
Edition), by
Michael Sipser

Theory:

科號  Course Number ： 11120CS
541200學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
50
中文名稱  Course Title ：虛擬化技術與應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Virtualization technology and its applications
任課教師  Instructor ：李哲榮
上課時間  Time ： F5F6F7 上課教室  Room ：台達 104 ／ 116
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
虛擬化技術已經廣泛被應⽤於遊戲開發、雲端計算、邊緣計算、 5G 基地台等應⽤。不但軟體上的改
進，
連帶的硬體上的設計也以輔助虛擬化為主要的訴求之⼀，現今⾼端的 CPU 都已經能⽀援虛擬化技術，
⽽越
來越多的 GPU 和網路卡也有⽀援虛擬化的設備。可以說虛擬化的技術已經普及到各個領域。本課程將
介紹
虛擬機器與 container 系統，包括他們的原理和實作細節，並且配合系統的實作，讓學⽣可以更深入的
了解虛擬技術的運作。此外，我們也將介紹虛擬化技術的各項運⽤，包含雲端計算的資料中⼼、容錯
系
統、 5G基地台、邊緣計算等。
課程內容
甲、  虛擬化技術介紹
i. CPU虛擬化
ii. 記憶體虛擬化
iii. 網路虛擬化
iv. 儲存裝置虛擬化
⼄、  Container 技術介紹
i. Namespace 、 Cgroup 、 layered FS
ii. OCI規範 CRI 、 CNI 、 CSI
iii. 案例探討  Docker 、 Kata container 、 gvisor
iv. 協作系統 Kubernetes
丙、  虛擬化技術應⽤
i. 遊戲模擬機  VM emulation
ii. 5G基地台 NFV 、 VM consolidation 、 KSM
iii. 雲端計算  資料中⼼  容錯系統 VM migration
iv. 邊緣計算安全測試環境  VM isolation
丁、  Container 技術應⽤
i. 敏捷開發 DevOps
ii. 微服務 Microservices
iii. 雲端 PaaS 服務平台  Autoscaling
iv. 邊緣計算快速佈署
實驗教材
甲、  虛擬遊戲機
⼄、  CUJU 容錯系統
丙、  Kubernetes 應⽤
參考資料
1. Virtualization Essentials, 2nd Edition Matthew Portnoy

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程主要介紹電腦繪圖的觀念及應⽤，第⼀階段將從最基礎的繪圖管線流程介紹各個模組的功
能，讓同學了解電腦繪圖最後成像的過程及其原理；第⼆階段將介紹進階的應⽤，包括可程式化的
Shader、 3D 建模、特殊效果、全域照明、動畫控制、繪圖硬體和效能調教等，讓同學了解各種應
⽤是如何⽤電腦繪圖的技術來達成。

Victor Kerlow. (This book is for casual reading.)

Programmable Shaders (1 week)
Modeling 3D objects (2 week)
Special Effects (2 week)
Global Illumination (2 week)
Animation (1 week)
Graphics Hardware (1 week)
Performance Tuning (1 week)

554000學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：

中文名稱  Course Title ：圖形識別
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Pattern Recognition
任課教師  Instructor ：許秋婷
上課時間  Time ： M5M6R4 上課教室  Room ：台達 102 ／ 100
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The goal of pattern recognition is to classify unknown patterns into a
number of categories, to automatically detect patterns in data, and to make data-
driven decisions.
This course will teach students basic pattern recognition procedures as well as
some selected techniques.
⼆、參考書籍 (References)
- S. Theodoridis and K. Koutroumbas, Pattern Recognition, 4th
Edition, Academic Press, 2009.
- C.M. Bishop, Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning, Springer, 2006.
- R.O. Duda, P.E. Hart, D.G. Stork, Pattern Classification, 2nd Edition, John
Wiley, 2001.
- E. Alpaydin, Introduction to Machine Learning, 3rd Edition, The MIT Press,
2014.
三、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
- Lecture
- In-class discussion
四、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction
2. Supervised pattern recognition
- Bayesian decision theory
- Linear classifiers
- Nonlinear classifiers
- Feature selection
- Dimension reduction
- Context-dependent classification
3. Unsupervised pattern recognition
- Basic concepts
- Selected topics
五、成績考核 (Evaluation)
- Assignments
- Projects & reports
- Oral presentation
六、可連結之網⾴位址
https://elearn.nthu.edu.tw/

科號  Course Number ： 11120CS
560400學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 0
中文名稱  Course Title ：⼈⼯智慧與藝術導論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Artificial Intelligence and Arts
任課教師  Instructor ：吳中浩
上課時間  Time ： T5T6T7 上課教室  Room ：資電  127 ／ 0
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course description)
The main objectives of this course are threefold:
1) Understanding of art.
2) Understanding of artificial intelligence.
3) Understanding of why and how to apply AI to arts.
The lecture consists of two parts. The first part presents different aspects of art, including aesthetics,
aesthetic evaluation, art & psychology, art & perception, art & cognition, and art & creativity.
The second part presents AI art, aesthetic creativity and the 2nd thought of computer, AI,
art and aesthetics, including recent researches of AI-generated art, AI techniques,
deep neutral networks (DNNs), and computer-generated art.
The lecture will also address some philosophical debates about AI-generated art,
such as “Can machine create?” and “Is AI-generated art ‘ART’?” From the discussions,
the attended students should understand the properties and characteristics of art as well as
the AI technology, and thus develop proper methods by applying AI to art creation.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
No required textbook
Lecture note will be provided at the class.
三、參考書籍 (References)
References and reading assignments will be given at the class.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures and discussion.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1) Introduction (1 week)
2) PART I:
2.1) Introduction to aesthetics (2 weeks)
2.2) Art and psychology/perception/cognition (2.5 weeks)
2.3) Art and creativity (1.5 weeks)
3) PART II:
3.1) Introduction to AI techniques (1 week)
3.2) Introduction to AI arts (1 week)
3.3) Artistic creativity using AI (1.5 weeks)
3.4) Generative arts (1.5 weeks)
3.5) Art creation using machine-learning (DL/NN) (3 weeks)
3.6) The 2nd thought of computer, AI, art and aesthetics (1 week)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Term paper assignments: 40%
Final project: 60%

中文名稱  Course Title ：演化計算
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Evolutionary Computation
任課教師  Instructor ：丁川康
上課時間  Time ： M7M8M9 上課教室  Room ：台達 106 ／ 98
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This course provides an introduction to the algorithms, theory, and application
of evolutionary computation geared towards the students who are interested in
development and/or application of the subject. Topics in algorithms and theory
include genetic algorithms, evolution strategies, genetic programming, parameter
setting and analysis. Topics in application include optimization, constraint
handling, machine learning, and multi-objective optimization.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Book)
A.E. Eiben and J.E. Smith, Introduction to Evolutionary Computing, Springer
Verlag, 2003/2010.
三、參考書籍  (References)
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Lecture slides and blackboard teaching
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
1. Introduction
2. What is an Evolutionary Algorithm?
3. Genetic Algorithms
4. Evolution Strategies
5. Genetic Programming
6. Multi-objective Evolutionary Algorithms
7. Working with EAs
六、成績考核  (Evaluation)
Assignment: 30%
Midterm Exam: 40%
Project: 30%

- Pitch detection
- Chord and tonality analysis

- MIR evaluation and reproducibility
- Recommendation system
- Music and motion
- Music performance analysis
- MIR and human-computer interaction
- MIR and new multimedia arts
- Computational musicology

任課教師  Instructor ：李濬屹
上課時間  Time ： TaTb 上課教室  Room ：資電  125 ／ 0
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程為開設給⼤四，碩⼠，博⼠的研究所課程，為⼀個探討智慧型機器⼈的深入主題的課程。由於
智慧型機
器⼈的發展⽇新⽉異，其中的特殊主題，包含感知  (Perception) 、智慧控制  (Intelligent
Control)、巡航  (Navigation) 、視覺⾥程  (Visual Odometry) 、虛擬⾄真實轉移  (Sim-to-Real
Transferring) 等等。這些研究主題通常並無包含於基礎的機器學習以及深度學習課程，但卻都是最近
⼀兩
年於智慧型機器⼈領域最為前沿且最重要的研究⽅向。此課程將以專題討論的模式，搭配演算法實
作，訓練修
課學⽣實際學習以上這些研究領域，以對智慧型機器⼈領域有更優秀的研究實⼒。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
無，本課程將探討最新的智慧型機器⼈領域，主要將以研究論文為主。研究論文將來⾃智慧型機器⼈
領域最頂
尖的研討會論文，包含 ICRA 、 IROS 、 RSS 、 CoRL 、 CVPR 、 ICCV 、 ECCV 等。
三、參考書籍 (References)
“An Introduction to AI Robotics” by Robin R. Murphy, first edition
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
本課程將使⽤專題討論的形式，每週探討不同的智慧型機器⼈主題，教材包含最新頂尖會議的研究論
文。課程
中將⿎勵學⽣對論文內容提出質疑，⿎勵學⽣提出改善⽅案，尤其希望參與課程的學⽣能夠實際將⾃
⾝想法與
概念經由實驗，投稿⾄頂尖 AI 以及機器⼈研討會。
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
本課程教學進度將根據以下進度規劃 :
- 智慧型機器⼈以及⼈⼯智慧概念簡述  (Review of Intelligent Robotics and Artificial
Intelligence Concepts)
- 感知  (Perception)
- 深度增強式學習智慧控制  (Intelligent Control)
- 巡航  (Navigation))
- 虛擬⾄真實轉移  (Sim-to-Real Transferring)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
本課程的成績將由以下⽅式評量 :
- 課程討論參與、研究論文評析  (100%)

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
邊緣智慧  (Edge Intelligence/AI) 是基於邊緣運算  (Edge Computing) 以及⼈⼯智慧  (AI) 應運⽽
⽣的次世代網路框架，除了繼承邊緣運算之分散式架構特性，能將應⽤程式、數據資料與服務的運
算，由雲端伺
服器中⼼，搬移⾄貼近使⽤者端的霧端邊緣節點來處理以⼤幅降低服務延遲時間。考量到智慧物聯網
(AIoT)
服務將產⽣多元⼤數據以滿⾜各式應⽤情境，邊緣智慧將關注如何在確保使⽤者隱私前提下，讓這些
數據能夠透
過⼈⼯智慧訓練模型淬鍊出有⽤之資訊。本課程將以研究最新的邊緣智慧技術為主，探討跟 B5G/6G 的
銜接性、
如何基於 Edge Computing 架構整合 AI 、如何實現 AIoT 各式應⽤等。特別會關注 Google 提出之聯邦式學
習架
構 (Federated Learning) 以實現具隱私考量之邊緣智慧學習策略，並進⼀步聚焦相關之資安議題⽬標使
邊
緣智慧服務順利實現。

無

五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Distributed computing (2 weeks)
2. Fog/edge computing (4 weeks)
3. B5G/6G communication (3 weeks)
4. Federated learning (3 weeks)
5. Edge intelligence/AI (4 weeks)
6. Edge privacy and security (2 weeks)

科號  Course Number ： 11120CSR
510300學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：⼈⼯類神經突觸及記憶體運算元件
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Artificial Neuromorphic Synapse and Memory Computing
Device
任課教師  Instructor ：謝易叡
上課時間  Time ： R6R7R8 上課教室  Room ：綜三  205 ／ 30
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明
Neuromorphic computing aims to realize artificial intelligence (AI) by mimicking
the mechanisms of neurons and synapses that make up the human brain. Inspired by
the cognitive functions of the human brain that current computers cannot provide,
neuromorphic devices have been widely investigated. This course will introduce
several conventional memories to students, including NOR and NAND FLASH,
resistive-random-access-memory (RRAM), phase-change-memory (PCM), and Ferro-
electric-random-access-memory (FeRAM). We will discuss operation principles,
process flows, cell structures, array architectures, and challenges of scaling and
reliability issues and the applications to the Neuromorphic computing using the
nonvolatile memories
● 參考書籍
1. Neuromorphic Devices for Brain-inspired Computing: Artificial Intelligence,
Perception, and Robotics. Qing Wan (Editor), Yi Shi (Editor), 2022, Wiley, ISBN:
978-3-527-34979-1 https://bit.ly/3VsVACb
● 教學⽅式 : Normal face-to-face lecture
● 教學進度
Week Topics
1. Introduction-
2. In-memory Computing in AIOT era
3. Brain-inspired Neuromorphic Computing
4. Device Physics of Non-volatile memory
5. NOR FLASH
6. NOR FLASH for neuromorphic Computing
7. NAND FLASH
8. NAND FLASH for Neuromorphic Computing
9. no class
10. Phase-change-memory (PCM)
11. PCM for Neuromorphic Computing
12. Resistive-random-access-memory (RRAM)
13. RRAM for Neuromorphic Computing
14. Ferro-electric Random-access Memory
15. FeRAM for Neuropod Computing
16. Final report (1)
16. Final report (2)
● 成績考核
100 points comes from the results of final report.

任課教師  Instructor ：王廷基
上課時間  Time ： F2F3F4 上課教室  Room ：綜三 LRA ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Description:
This course will include 6 major topics dividing into 2 semesters and provide
student essential capabilities to understand the challenges and requirement in
each design phases for advanced design methodologies. They are:
1. Overall System Level Design Planning and EDA (Electronic Design Automation)
2. Digital Design and Sign-off
3. Custom, Analog and RF Design
4. RF and Simulation with DRC/LVS
5. SiP, System-in-package (Modifying Components and Netlist/Setting Design Rules),
Design Verification and Manufacturing Output
6. Routing and High-Density Interconnect with Simulation
In the first semester, this course will focus on the overview of system level
design architecture and how EDA tools can help design planning and production.
Then the course will introduce from digital IC design, analog and mixed signal IC
design with close loop simulation and verification methodology.
References: Cadence Design System
Teaching Method: Lectures and discussions
Syllabus:
1. Overall System Level Design Planning: Integrated 3D-IC Platform
2. Digital Design and Sign-off: Synthesis and Test
3. Digital Design and Sign-off: Implementation
4. Digital Design and Sign-off: Silicon Signoff, Equivalence Checking
5. Custom IC, Analog and RF Design: Circuit Design, Simulation, Modeling and RF
Design
6. Custom IC, Analog and RF Design: Layout Design and Advanced Nodes
Evaluation: One midterm exam and one final exam
Website: eeclass

391202學分  Credit ： 1⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
10
中文名稱  Course Title ：書報討論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Seminar
任課教師  Instructor ：邱于芯
上課時間  Time ： R2 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼆  113 ／ 60
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Requirement:
1.The presentation order will be decided in the first class.
2.Each student will select and present a peer-reviewed research paper (i.e.,
no Reviews/Perspectives), published in the last 4 years (2020~2023) by any of
the corresponding authors below:
Karl Deisseroth; Catherine Dulac; Ehud Isacoff; Lily Y. Jan; Thomas J. Jentsch;
David Julius; Jonathan Kipnis; Zachary A. Knight; Ardem Patapoutian; Kodi
Ravichandran; Li-Huei Tsai; Kay M. Tye.
Or, a peer-reviewed research paper, published within 2 years (2021-2023),
depicting roles of ion channels in immune cells on journals with Impact Factor
more than 10 (https://jcr.clarivate.com/).
Grading Criteria (pending to change):
R26; Oral presentation (45%):
o Submit the paper of choice on time (5%)
o Post your paper of choice on time (5%)
o Submit the presentation slides on time (5%)
o Averaged score from the Presentation Evaluation Form (30%)
R26; Participation (40%):
o Submit 2 questions to iLMS (22%)
o participate in Q&A (18%)
R26; Attendance (15%): no skipping class more than 2 times without prior
notice or acceptable reasons. Student coming in 10 minutes after class start
is considered as skipping class.
R26; Presentation in English: for those who choose to present the paper in
English, additional 5 bonus points will be added to the final score. Note, the
final score is capped at 100 pts.
Online Resources:
NCBI Pubmed ：  http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/
Journal Citation Reports ： https://jcr.clarivate.com/
Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/
Faculty of 1000: https://f1000.com/prime/home
bioRxiv: https://www.biorxiv.org/

10
中文名稱  Course Title ：書報討論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Seminar
任課教師  Instructor ：林郁婷
上課時間  Time ： R2 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼆ 207 ／ 10
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Requirements:
1. Course requirements will be presented in the first class, including paper
selection, presentation order and grading criteria. Student presentation will be
started from the third class.
2. Presented papers should be selected from top peer-reviewed journals and
published in the last two year.
3. The presenter has to provide the paper to classmates and the teacher one week
before the presentation week. Each presentation should be finished in 30-35
minutes and discussion will be in the next 10 minutes.
4. The host will be the previous presenter and responsible for the brief
introduction in the beginning and Q&A session after presentation.
5. Students should read the paper before each class and participate in the Q&A
session. Each student should have at least three questions in the semester.
6. Grading: Oral presentation 70%; Q&A 20%; Attendance 10 %.

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
這⾨課主要介紹在現代⾃由市場經濟及⾦融體系下，中央銀⾏扮演的⾓⾊與任務、貨幣政策的⽬標、

論。
本課程主要探討的議題如下：
(1) 中央銀⾏扮演的⾓⾊與任務
(2) 貨幣政策的⽬標、⼯具與操作⽅式
(3) 貨幣政策的傳導機制
(4) ⾦融監督與管理

Location: 旺宏懷樸  Main Library Building (MXIC) Chou Hwai Pwu Lecture Hall
Course Website: 國立清華⼤學  eLearn 數位學習平台  (elearn.nthu.edu.tw)
TA: TBA
Course .objectives:
This course is the second part of a two-semester sequence. The purpose of this
sequence is an introduction to statistical methods and applications for
economics students. We will emphasize on statistical concepts and methods that
are commonly used in economics and business, and these materials will be
presented with applications to data analysis. In the spring semester, we will
focus on hypothesis tests, linear regression with one regressor, linear
regressions with multiple regressors, nonparametric statistics, analysis of
variance and forecasting.
Textbook:
Anderson, D., D. Sweeney, T. Williams, J. Camm, J. Cochran, M. Fry, and J.
Ohlmann (2019). Statistics for Business and Economics. 14th edition. Cengage.
Evaluation:
The course grade is based on three elements: four assignments, a midterm
exam,
and a final exam.
Assignments: There will be four problem sets and they will be assigned after
finishing major topics. You have at least seven days to work on each
assignment. The assignments will include both problem solving and empirical
exercises. Solution keys will be posted on the course website soon after the
submission deadline, so late submission is not accepted. Empirical exercises
require the use of excel or R.
Midterm Exam: The midterm will be held in class during the class hours. The
exam is expected to take 120 minutes. There will be no make-up exams for the
midterm. If you miss the midterm, you must give a valid reason and proof, and
the weight will be assigned to the final.
Final Exam: The final exam will be held during the class hours. It is
comprehensive and it is expected to take 120 minutes. If you have to miss the
final, you must give a valid reason and proof, and contact me to arrange a make-
up final exam.
The grades are assigned according to the following formula:
20% 4 Assignments
35% Midterm Exam
45% Final Exam
Reading List
1. Inferences about means and proportions with two populations (chapter 10)
2. Inferences about population variances (chapter 11)
3. Comparing multiple proportions (chapter 12)
4. Experimental design and analysis of variance (chapter 13)
5. Simple linear regression (chapter 14)
6. Multiple regression (chapter 15)
7. Regression analysis: model building (chapter 16)
8. Time series analysis (chapter 17)
9. Nonparametric methods (chapter 18)
Note: chapters 17 and 18 will be covered if time permits.

11120ECON227400學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
50
中文名稱  Course Title ：成本與管理會計⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Cost & Management Accounting (II)
任課教師  Instructor ：林育光
上課時間  Time ： S2S3S4 上課教室  Room ：台積 103 ／ 94
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
不論營利事業或非營利事業，亦不論組織規模的⼤⼩，「成本」經常是管理者做決斷時所需要
的關鍵性資訊。本課程主要的⽬的，在循序漸進地介紹與討論各類成本計算的⽅法與成本管理的理
論，引導學⽣瞭解處於動態環境下的組織，如何運⽤成本會計的技術，進⾏規劃、控制與做決策。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Horngren’s Cost Accounting ：  A Managerial Emphasis （ Global Edition ） 17/e,2021
三、參考書籍 (References)
無
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)

期末考範圍： Chapter 19~24

Ch17 Cost Allocation: Joint Products and Byproducts
Ch18 Process Costing
Ch19 Spoilage, Rework, and Scrap
Ch20 Balanced Scorecard: Quality and Time

Considerations

11120ECON309201學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
80
中文名稱  Course Title ：總體經濟學⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Macroeconomics (II)
任課教師  Instructor ：黃朝熙
上課時間  Time ： M7M8M9 上課教室  Room ：台積 224 ／ 124
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程將介紹景氣循環的成因與特⾊以及凱因斯與古典學派景氣循環的理論。我們並以這些理論為背
景，討論政府因
應景氣循環的對策︰財政政策與貨幣政策。本課程亦將介紹物價膨脹與失業的成因、其間的關係、以
及解決物價膨脹
與失業問題的⽅法。最後，本課程將介紹開放總體經濟模型以及匯率制度、匯率決定的理論、以及固
定匯率制度與浮
動匯率制度的優缺點等問題。
This course discusses the main features and likely causes of business cycles. The classical and Keynesian
theories of business cycles will be introduced. We shall also discuss the effects of government policies
(fiscal and monetary policies) on aggregate output and general price level. The course will also cover topics
on the Phillips curve (i.e., the relation between inflation and unemployment rate) and exchange rate
determination.

Education, 2021. （雙葉書廊 )
三、參考書籍 (References)

Mankiw, Gregory N., Macroeconomics (any edition)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)

五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
本課程將涵蓋  Abel, Bernanke and Croushore 教科書的第 8 章⾄第 15 章，平均約每六堂課教完⼀章。
The course will cover chapters 8-15 of Abel, Bernanke and Croushore.

成績 30% ，期
末考佔學期成績 40% 。

final, the respective weights are 15%, 15%, 30% and 40%.

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
介紹期貨市場之運作⽅式及各期貨交易所之商品內容  , 除深入淺出說明期貨與選擇權的理論定
價模式外 , 將充分探討實務上的策略應⽤。整個課程設計兼顧理論與實務，搭配介紹其他衍⽣性
⾦融商品之操作，期使同學們能完全領會期貨市場的奧妙與威⼒ !
The operation mechanism of futures market and the products in major Futures
Exchanges will be introduced in this course. By taking the course, students
will learn the futures trading both from pricing theory and practical
transactions. Additional material about other derivative products is also
provided to let students understand the most delicate knowledge in futures
market.

這⾨課要將深入介紹文化經濟學的重要主題，並且指導同學瞭解相關的理論與應⽤實務。文化經濟學

界受
到重視。學術研究文獻快速成⻑，相關的應⽤實務著作更為可觀，這⾨課將要求同學⼤量閱讀文獻，

業活動的興趣。每位選修的同學必須有積極閱讀與收集資料，⼀學期之中，我們會有許多的⼝頭報告

寫作業的要求，具有很強的學習意願與準備的同學才適合選這⾨課。上課⽅式以同學報告討論為主，

任課教師  Instructor ：李怡嫺

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
1.The emphasis is on understanding and applying basic accounting principles
and other concepts that guide the reporting of the effect of transactions
and other economic events on the financial condition and operating results
of a business.
2.To provide an opportunity to apply theoretical solutions to practical
problems.
Since this course is offered to students with non-accounting major and that
the number of participants is expected to be manageable, the detailed
contents of the course may be adjusted and tailored, during the semester, to
the needs of the class and in accordance with the different backgrounds of
the participants.
With over 15-year experience in the accounting profession, the instructor is
also prepared and keen to share, whenever appropriate, her experiences as a
accounting manager with certificate of CPA(Certified Public Accountant)in
USA and SAP Finance consultant ; particularly, the accounting's application
in the Accounting policies and procedures and accounting system .

Intermeditate Accounting, IFRS Edition

定產業規範
(regulation) 政策或市場⼲預的參考。為了⽅便分析寡佔廠商的策略 , 我們也將介紹非合作賽局理論。

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Reading and Writing in Economics

上課時間  Time ： F2F3F4 上課教室  Room ：台積 205 ／ 63
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
ECON5005 經濟學文獻閱讀與寫作
課程說明
授課老師：黃春興
Email： cshwang@mx.nthu.edu.tw
⼀、  課程說明：
當前經濟學在課程設計上過於強調數理分析，⼀則容易導致初學者和研究⽣以數學模型去替代真實的
經濟運作，⼆則無法深入理解經濟理論和概念的完整意義。本課程要求同學們廣泛地閱讀對經濟學基
本概
念和體系發展有重要貢獻的經濟文獻，以期降低上述培育計畫的缺陷。
受限於授課時數，本課程將僅選擇不採⽤數學模型和計量分析論述的經濟文獻。
⼆、指定⽤書：  無。
三、參考書籍：  無。
四、教學⽅式：
1. 本課程除要求同學閱讀與寫作外，也要求每位同學上台報告，詳細⽅式將於第⼀堂課討論。
2. 每位同學必須在期末，繳交與其上台報告相關的之⻑文報告， 3000-5000 字。
3. 每位同學必須就上課的文章中，選擇五篇文章，繳交與該文內容相關的短文報告， 1000-1500 字。共
五篇。不得與⻑文報告相同主題。
4. 上課時討論報告繳交⽅式
五、成績考核：
1. 同學上台報告最⾼可得 25 分。計分標準以內容理解、陳述清晰、時間掌握為準。報告⽅式由同學⾃
由
設計。短文報告，每篇最⾼可得 10 分。⻑文報告最⾼可得 25 分。總計 100 分。
2. 每週上課必須出席簽名。每位同學可缺席三次機會。此外，缺席⼀次扣總成績 10 分。
3. 上課秩序：除了該週上台報告之同學外，其他同學上課時不允許操作⼿機、平版或電腦，也不允許
閱
讀其他讀物。每次違規扣總成績 10 分。
4. 違規簽名或報告以各種形式抄襲，⼀經發現，該學期成績以不及格計。
六、教學進度：
公布於課程網站。
課程網站：  http://mx.nthu.edu.tw/~cshwang/ ，  請點選  教學 / 經濟文獻閱讀與寫作。

⼀、課程說明  (Course Description):
This course aims to provide sufficient mathematic training for students whose majors are in engineering or
physics. The content emphasizes partial differential equations and
complex functions. This course is the mathematic foundation of electromagnetics, modern physics, classical
physics, fluidic mechanics and so on. Basic mathematic skills, especially calculus and knowledge of ordinary
differential equation, are required.

1. Review of Ordinary Differential Equation

3. Integral transform
4. Complex Numbers and Functions (Chap. 13) & Complex Integration (Chap. 14)
5. Power Series, Taylor Series (Chap. 15)
6. Laurent Series. Residue Integration (Chap. 16)
7. Conformal Mapping
8. Numerics

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
1. Purpose:
Linear algebra is a branch of mathematics that studies systems of linear
equations and the properties of matrices. The concepts of linear algebra are
extremely useful in engineering, physics, economics and social sciences, and
natural sciences. In this class, we hope to build a solid foundation of
elementary linear algebra for students. Various applications of linear algebra
in different areas will also be addressed.
2. Course Outline:
(1) Vectors and Matrices
(2) Solving Linear Equations
(3) Vector Spaces and Subspaces
(4) Orthogonality
(5) Determinants
(6) Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors
(7) Linear Transformations
3. Prerequisite: Calculus
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
G. Strang, Introduction to Linear Algebra, International Edition. Wellesley, MA,
Wellesley-Cambridge Press, 2019.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. S. Friedberg, A. Insel, and L. Spence, Linear Algebra, 5th Edition. Pearson,
2019.
2. S. J. Leon, Linear Algebra with Applications, 9th Edition. Pearson, 2015.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)

五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
(1) Vectors and Matrices
(2) Solving Linear Equations
(3) Vector Spaces and Subspaces
(4) Orthogonality
(5) Determinants
(6) Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors
(7) Linear Transformations

● Course Description
This is one of the mandatory courses for the EE Department. This course introduces
the basic theory of linear circuit analysis, which helps students for solving
realistic problems involving these circuits and further being able to design
complex electronic, communication, computer, power, and control systems.

Energy storage elements

中文名稱  Course Title ：邏輯設計實驗
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Logic Design Laboratory

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程能讓學員深入了解邏輯電路之設計流程，親⾝體會數位電路之設計經驗。本實驗需先修過邏輯
設計 (EECS1010) 課程始能加選，本實驗幫助同學快速領悟邏輯設計理論，並能實際應⽤所學於硬體
實驗電路，如此，能讓同學對數位邏輯設計有更深⼀層的體驗與認知。
This is the first course for logic design lab.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Pong P. Chu, FPGA Prototyping by Verilog Examples, 2008, John Wiley & Sons.
(NTHU library has the
ebook.)
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. M. Morris R. Mano and Michael D. Ciletti, Digital Design: With an
Introduction to the Verilog HDL, VHDL, and SystemVerilog (6th Edition), Pearson
International Edition. (Textbook of EECS1010 Logic Design)
2. Michael Keating, Reuse Methodology Manual for System-on-a-Chip Designs, 2002,
Kluwer Academic Publishers. (NTHU library has the ebook.)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
本課程將教授數位電路設計的實作技術，將邏輯設計之理論實現在實體的可程式邏輯晶片中。將教授
硬體描述語⾔ Verilog HDL 、硬體模擬器、 FPGA 電路板使⽤、邏輯分析儀使⽤等硬體設計技術。此
外並搭配多個實驗主題的實作，學⽣可學習到邏輯晶片之設計流程，相關主題包括組合電路設計、序
列電路設計、計數器設計、有限狀態機設計、投票機設計、多功能時鐘設計。本課程將以上課與上機
實際操作互相搭配，學⽣預計能學習到數位邏輯電路設計之基本技術。

1.Verilog RTL 介紹

8.電⼦⾳效
9.LCD

科號  Course Number ： 11120EE
223002學分  Credit ： 2⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
20
中文名稱  Course Title ：邏輯設計實驗
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Logic Design Laboratory
任課教師  Instructor ：黃元豪
上課時間  Time ： T7T8T9 上課教室  Room ：台達 217 ／ 135
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
邏輯設計實驗  (EE 2230002)
** 同學預修科⽬為 ” 邏輯設計 ” ，加簽同學請第⼀次上課到課堂，書⾯實體加簽。
1. 課程⼤綱
本課程將教授數位電路設計的實作技術，將邏輯設計之理論實現在實體的可程式邏輯晶片中。將教
授硬體描述語⾔ Verilog HDL 、硬體模擬器、 FPGA 電路板使⽤、邏輯分析儀使⽤等硬體設計技術。
此外並搭配多個實驗主題的實作，學⽣可學習到邏輯晶片之設計流程，相關主題包括組合電路設
計、序列電路設計、計數器設計、有限狀態機設計、計算機設計、多功能時鐘設計、鍵盤控制與
VGA控制等。本課程將以上課與上機實際操作互相搭配，學⽣預計能學習到數位邏輯電路設計之基
本技術。
2. 教科書：
上課投影片講義
3. 參考書⽬：
William J. Dally and R. curtis Harting, Digital Design - A Systems Approach,
2013, Cambridge University Press.
M. Morris Mano & Michael D. Ciletti, Digital Design, 4th ed. 2007, Pearson
Prentice Hall.
4. 上課⽅式 :
演講及上機實習
5. 課程內容
Introduction to Verilog RTL
FPGA Emulation
Counters and Shifter Registers I
Counters and Shifter Registers II

60
中文名稱  Course Title ：電⼦學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Electronics
任課教師  Instructor ：⾦雅琴  Ya-Chin King
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R3R4 上課教室  Room ：台達 217 ／ 135
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is an introductory course of microelectronics. We will focus
on
the fundamental knowledge of microelectronic circuits and emphasize the
design-
oriented approach. This course introduces the most important concepts for
design
of analog circuits such as semiconductor diodes and transistors, and various
amplifier configurations. The frequency response, differential pairs,
multistage
amplifiers are also included. By developing solid understanding of basic
knowledge, learning microelectronics could be enjoyable.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
B. Razavi, "Fundamentals of Microelectronics," Wiley, 2008.
三、參考書籍 (References)
A. Sedra and K. Smith, "Microelectronic circuits," 5th edition, Oxford
university press, 2004
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Power point handouts are used in this class together with a tablet computer
for
equation derivation and additional materials. The course materials are also
recorded by the software "powercam" and uploaded in LMS system for easy
access.
A quiz is held on a bi-weekly basis to help the students following the
course
schedule. The homework is also assigned bi-weekly. The students also have
the
opportunity to use the CAD tool (SPICE) for circuit design and verify the
materials learned in the class.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to microelectronics (ch. 1)
- Examples of electronic systems
- Basic circuit theorems
2. Basic physics of semiconductors and diodes (ch. 2 and ch. 3)
- Semiconductor material properties
- PN junction and diodes
- Diode circuits and applications
3. Basic physics of transistors and their equivalent circuit models
(ch. 4 and ch. 6)
- Basic structures and characteristics of MOSFETs and BJTs
- Equivalent circuit model of MOSFETs and BJTs
- Large-signal and small-signal operation
4. Single-stage (multi-stage) amplifiers and frequency response
(ch. 5, ch. 7, ch. 9, and ch. 11)
- Operating point analysis and design
- MOSFET and BJT amplifier topologies (CS, CG, CD, and cascode)
- Transfer function and Bode's plot
- Frequency response of different amplifiers
5. Differential amplifiers (ch. 9 and ch. 10)
- Basic MOS and BJT differential pairs
- Large-signal and small-signal analysis
- Current mirror and active load
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Homework: 20%
Quiz: 20%
Midterm: 30%
Final: 30%

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The main objective of this introductory course is to help students develop
programming skills to solve problems. As computers are becoming more powerful
and ubiquitous, proper use of computers can increase productivity significantly.
Thus, the ability to write efficient programs to solve problems improves one’s
core competence and can be an important differentiator for one’s career. Among
today’s popular programming languages, C is found to have the biggest impacts.
Many modern computer languages borrowed heavily from C. Thus, proficiency in C
language would pave ways to good programming in other languages. In this course,
we will devote most of the time in C programming. object-oriented programming
and classes, however, will also be briefly introduced.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)

Walters, Godfrey Muganda, Addison Wesley.

expressions and operators

科號  Course Number ： 11120EE
240500學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 5
中文名稱  Course Title ：嵌入式系統與實驗
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Embedded System Laboratory
任課教師  Instructor ：劉靖家
上課時間  Time ： W7W8W9 上課教室  Room ：台達 216 ／ 103
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
We use C/C++ in this course with ARM mbed library to write control codes for an embedded Cortex M4
board.
And we show through hands-on practice labs on interfacing with different sensors and actuators, and
eventually building a smart IoT device. Starting with basic digital and analog inputs and outputs, we build an
arbitrary wave generator and analyzer. Also we demo how to display captured information on a full-color
LCD.
Several serial protocols are then introduced including UART, SPI and I2C. Remote procedure calls with serial
protocols are applied to send control messages between PC and M4. Besides wired control, we use Zigbee
for low power wireless messaging. IoT applications based on Ethernet (WiFi) will also be demonstrated.
Finally, we use a Boe Bot car platform to integrate all components.
⼆、教科書 (Textbooks)
Fast and Effective embedded Systems Design: Applying the ARM mbed (Second Edition), 2016, by Rob
Toulson and Tim Wilmshurst, Newnes.
三、參考書籍 (References)
embedded System Interfacing 1st Edition, Design for the Internet-of-Things (IoT) and Cyber-Physical
Systems (CPS), by Marilyn Wolf, Morgan Kaufmann, 2019
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
One-hour lecture and two-hour lab per week
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)

Mbed Lab 3 Analog Output
03 Mbed Lab 4 Analog Input
04 Mbed Lab 5 Liquid Crystal Displays

06 Mbed Lab 7 Serial Communication
07 Mbed Lab 8 Audio Synthesis on mbed
週次 課程內容

● 課程說明  Course Description
1. Data structures?
A data structure is a particular way of organizing data in a computer so that it can be
used effectively.
The idea is to reduce the space and time complexities of different tasks.
Data structures can be considered as essential building blocks in modern computer
science.
2. The objective of this course:
To provide a solid training for understanding various data structures, including their
design, analysis, and implementation.

306001學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
65
中文名稱  Course Title ：機率
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Probability
任課教師  Instructor ：呂忠津  Lu Chung-Chin
上課時間  Time ： T5T6R5R6 上課教室  Room ：台達 211 ／ 51
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This course discusses the basic mathematical models for physical phenomena which
possess random features or for problems which can be solved by randomization
methods. The aim of this course is to consolidate students' way of thinking from
intuitive reasoning to rigorous reasoning with a logical framework. This
course requires knowledge on calculus, both single and multiple variables. It is
required for students to read Chapter 1: Combinatorial Analysis of the textbook
by S. Ross before class begins. Quiz #1 on combinatorial analysis will be held
during the 1st recitation class in 19:00-21:00 on Monday February 13, 2023 in
Delta 211. This course adopts a 16-week semester so that it is an intense
course.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Book)
S. Ross, A First Course in Probability, 10th edn. Pearson Educational
international, 2020. (Agent in Taiwan: Hwa Tai Publishing ( 華泰文化 ), Tel:
(04)2422-3877 ext. 532, Email: sales8@hwatai.com.tw.)
三、參考書籍 (References)
References will be mentioned in the lectures when cited.
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
1. This is an English–teaching course. In class, you are welcome to raise
questions in any language. If you speak a language other than English, Taiwanese
or Mandarin, please have someone to translate it to any of the above three
languages.
2. We will basically follow the contents of the textbook from the axiomatic
foundation of probability in Chapter 2 to the limit theorems in Chapter 8.
Additional materials, including supplemental lemmas and theorems, will be
provided to facilitate and/or enrich the development of the theory.
3. Doing exercise problems is an essential part of learning any mathematical
subject, including this course. Recommended exercises will be assigned every
week for you to practice the basic concepts and results learned in the classroom
and to prepare the quiz which will be held during the recitation class every
Monday 19:00 – 21:00 in Delta 211, except holidays and the week right after a
midterm. The 1st set of recommended exercises will be announced on NTHU eeclass
course website on February 7th, 2023. Students do not need to turn in any
solutions of the recommended
exercises.
4. There will be a total of 12 quizzes. Only the 10 highest scored quizzes will
be counted to calculate the semester quiz average. You may be absent from at
most 2 quizzes so that there will be no make-up quizzes. The 1st quiz will be
held during the 1st recitation class in 19:00-21:00 on Monday February 13, 2023
in Delta 211. The coverage of the 1st quiz is Chapter 1 of the textbook on
combinatorial analysis, which is required for you to study before class begins.
5. It is essential that students attend lecture class each day and if you have
to miss a class, you should make every attempt to make up the work by obtaining
notes from other students. However it is almost impossible to learn as much on
your own from an activity that was carried out and discussed in class.
6. There will be two online make-up classes to be held on March 4th and April
1st Saturdays. The online course website will be announced then.
7. All exams are closed book exams. You are allowed to bring in one A4 sheet of
paper for each midterm exam and two A4 sheets of papers for the final exam,
filled with hand-written or typed notes. You may write whatever you wish on both
sides of the paper.
8. The final exam is cumulative and will cover everything taught in the whole
semester.
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
Students are required to read Chapter 1 of the textbook which give a coverage of
combinatorial analysis before class begins. The following topics will be covered
in the class lectures:
1. Axioms of probability and properties of probability
2. Conditional probability, Bayes’s formula, and statistical independence
3. Random variables, discrete random variables, and distribution functions
4. Continuous random variables and functions of random variables
5. Jointly distributed random variables and conditional distributions
6. Properties of expectation, conditional expectation, moment generating
functions, and jointly normal random variables
7. Laws of large numbers and the central limit theorem
六、成績考核  (Evaluation)
There are weekly quizzes (30%), first midterm (20%), second midterm (20%), and
one final (30%). Alphabetical grade will be given as your final grade. The time
schedule is as follows:
(1) Recommended exercises will be announced every Thursday on NTHU eeclass
course website, which are for students to prepare the quiz to be held during the
recitation class every Monday 19:00 – 21:00 in Delta 211, except holidays and
the week right after a midterm. The 1st set of recommended exercises will be
announced on February 7th, 2023 before class begins. Students do not need to
turn in any solutions of the recommended exercises.
(2) Midterm I – 12:40 – 15:10, Thursday March 16, 2023.
Coverage: Chapters 2-4 of the textbook.
(3) Midterm II –12:40 – 15:10, Thursday April 20, 2023.
Coverage: Chapters 5-6 of the textbook.
(4) Final – 12:40 – 15:10, Thursday June 1, 2023.
Coverage: Chapters 2-8 of the textbook.

Course website at http://eeclass.nthu.edu.tw

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This is a fundamental course for analysis and design of analog integrated
circuits. It covers quantitative analyses, design considerations
and system applications from circuit and physical viewpoints. Most material
is for CMOS technology. BJT will be introduced briefly.
Topics for this course includes
- Modern VLSI technologies, device operations and models.
- Elementary gain stages.
- Current sources.
- Frequency responses.
- Feedback, stability and compensation.
- Operational amplifiers.
- Bandgap references.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Behzad Razavi,
Design of Analog CMOS Integrated Circuits 2/e,
McGraw-Hill, 2016.

CMOS Analog Circuit Design,
2nd Edition, Oxford Univ. Press, 2002.

中文名稱  Course Title ：控制系統
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Feedback Control Systems
任課教師  Instructor ：盧向成
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R3 上課教室  Room ：台達 215 ／ 135
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Feedback control is widely used in mechatronic systems and other fields,
especially in fields with stringent performance requirements such as fast
response and high accuracy (e.g. robot, unmanned vehicles, etc). Through the
introduction to system modeling, stability, and performance analysis, students
should develop an understanding of frequency-domain and root-locus methods for
control system design.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
R. C. Dorf and R. H. Bishop, Modern Control Systems, 13th edition, Pearson
Education Limited, 2017.
三、參考書籍 (References)
Norman S. Nise, Control Systems Engineering, 6th edition, John Wiley &Sons,
2011.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Blackboard and powerpoint presentation.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Chapter 1 Introduction to Control Systems
Chapter 2 Mathematical Models of Systems
Chapter 4 Feedback Control System Characteristics
Chapter 5 The Performance of Feedback Control Systems
Chapter 6 The Stability of Linear Feedback Systems
Chapter 7 The Root Locus Method
Chapter 8 Frequency Response Methods
Chapter 9 Stability in the Frequency Domain
Chapter 10 The Design of Feedback Control Systems
(optional) Chapter 3 and 11 The Design of State Variable Feedback Control
Systems

This course will provide an introductory overview on digital signal
processing. The concept and applications of discrete/digital signal processing

intuition on DSP and preparation for DSP lab and advanced graduate course of
