中文名稱  Course Title ：機器學習導論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Machine Learning
任課教師  Instructor ：楊雅棠
上課時間  Time ： T5T6R6 上課教室  Room ：綜四 121 ／ 190
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Description:
Machine learning is programming computers to optimize a performance criterion using example data or past
experience. We need learning in cases where we cannot directly write a computer program to solve a given
problem. This course discusses may methods that have their bases in different fields: statistics, pattern
recognition, neural network, artificial intelligence, signal processing, control, and data mining. Examples from
wide variety of subject such as biology, control, statistical mechanics and robotics will be given as proper
context for machine learning. Programming codes as embodiment of the algorithm in machine learning will be
analyzed in details.
Syllabus
1. Introduction; probability theory and statistics; things you need for computational thinking; random number
generator and Monte Carlo method
2. Supervised learning
3. Baysian decision theory
4. Parametric method
5. Multivariate method
6. Clustering
7. non-parametric method
8. linear discriminant
9. multi-layer perceptron; neural network
10. Deep learning
11. Reinforcement learning
12. Special topics on current research frontier (spiking neuron network)
Textbook
1. Ethem Alpaydin, Introduction to machine learning, 4th edition, MIT Press.
References:
1. Artificial Intelligence, Stuart Russel and Peter Norvig, Prentice Hall.1995
2. Masashi Sugiyama, Statistical Reinforcement Learning CRC
3. Duda, R.O. P. E. Hart, and D. G. Stork 2001 Pattern Classification, 2nd ed. New York: Wiley. (Excellent
book
on neural network. Plenty of good figures to study.)
Method:
Powerpoint sides will be used for teaching.
Grading& Evaluation
Homework (40%) and Midterm and final exam (60%)
科號  Course Number ： 11120EE
380000學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
32
中文名稱  Course Title ：電能處理
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Power Processing
任課教師  Instructor ：吳財福
上課時間  Time ： R7R8R9 上課教室  Room ：台達 202 ／ 32
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課從⾃然規律、⽣命機理談起，接著引出電能處理的法則和電⼒轉換器的拓樸結構，讓學⽣對電
能處理有全⾯性的基本概念，也可以連結⾄⾃然界、⽣物器官及其他領域暨有的運作和控制機制。
然後，回頭來談電能處理器所需⽤到的器件和驅動電路，並且運⽤⾃然法則來衍⽣出各式各樣的電
能處理器結構。
藉由這樣的啟發訓練，將要求學⽣從⾃然界或其它領域找到可以比擬⽤在電能處理上的機制，那麼
學⽣可以體會到「駕馭⾃然圭臬無窮妙⽤」、「究竟天下道理  萬源歸宗」。
上過本課程後預計可以開闊學⽣的視野和激發學⽣的想像⼒。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
1.EPARC ，電⼒電⼦學綜論，第⼆版，全華圖書， 2011 年。
2.補充講義。
三、參考書籍 (References)
1.文淑娟、李玟青等編，⽣理學，第⼆版，新文京， 2010 年。
2.N. Mohan, T. M. Undeland and W. P. Robbins, Power Electronics, John Wiley
& Sons, New York, 2nd Edition, 2008.
3.M. K. Kazimierczuk and D. Czarkowski, Resonant Power Converters, John
Wiley & Sons, New York, 1995.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
⼝頭授課。
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1.本課程相關⽣理和物理現象介紹 (2 週 )
2.電能處理發展歷史介紹 (1 週 )
3.功率元件探討
-被動元件 (2 週 )
-開關元件 (3 週 )
4.期中考
5.轉換器結構與衍⽣原理探討
-轉換器種類 (1 週 )
-硬切式轉換器 (2 週 )
-軟切式軟換器 (2 週 )
6.轉換器分析與設計 (3 週 )
7.期末考
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
1.作業成績： 20%
2.期中考成績： 40%
3.期末考成績： 40%

中文名稱  Course Title ：電動機械實驗
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Electrical Machinery Laboratory
任課教師  Instructor ：張淵智
上課時間  Time ： W7W8W9 上課教室  Room ：台達 201 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明：
1.實驗內容  (Contents) ：
(1) 功率半導體元件概要  (Overview of power semiconductor devices) 。
(2) 步進⾺達之驅動控制  ( 以分離電路及 IC 組裝 ) (Stepping motor driving control):
此類⾺達常⽤於電腦周邊裝置如磁碟機、資訊裝置、半導體製程機具等。
(3) 直流無刷⾺達及⼀些應⽤於電腦周邊致動器⽤⾺達之驅動控制  ( 以分離電路及 IC 組裝 )
(Brushless DC motor and other motors used in computer peripherals, information
devices and manufacturing equipments) 。
(4) 電⼦式⽇光燈及冷陰極螢光燈⽤安定器  (Electronic ballasts for fluorescent lamps and
cold-fluorescent lamps):
此類變頻點燈電路亦常⾒於液晶顯⽰器之背光照明、汽⾞頭燈等。
(5) 變壓器之穩態及暫態特性  (Power transformer static and transient
characteristics) 。
(6) 電⼒系統之傳輸特性及電⼒品質量測  (Measurements of power transmission
characteristics and power quality parameters 。
(7) 永磁直流⾺達之電⼒電⼦速度控制  ( 以分離電路及 IC 組裝 ) (Power electronic speed
control for permanent-magnet DC motor):
此類⾺達常⽤於電腦週邊裝置、資訊裝置、玩具等。
(8) 單相感應機之電⼒電⼦速度控制  ( 以分離電路及 IC 組裝 ) (Power electronic speed control
for single-phase AC motor):
此類⾺達常⽤於家電電器、散熱扇、壓縮機、冷氣機等。
(9) 直流發電機基本操作特性  (DC generator operation characteristics) 。
(10) 直流⾺達基本操作特性  (DC motor operation characteristics) 。
(11) ⼯業控制配電  (Industrial control distribution) 。
(12) 同步發電機基本操作特性  (Three-phase synchronous generator operation
characteristics) 。
(13) 同步⾺達基本操作特性  (Three-phase synchronous motor operation
characteristics) 。
(14) 三相感應⾺達基本操作特性  (Three-phase induction motor operation
characteristics) 。
(15) 三相感應發電機基本操作特性  (Three-phase induction generator operation
characteristics) 。
(16) 單相感應⾺達基本操作特性  (Single-phase motors operation characteristics) 。
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Books) ：以講義進⾏之  (Lecture notes) 。
三、參考書籍  (References) ：
[1] P.C. Sen," Principles of Electric Machines and Power Electronics," 2nd
Edition, 1996.
[2] A. E. Fitzgerald, Charles Kingsley, Jr. and Stephen D. Umans, Electric
Machinery,6/e, McGraw-Hill Higher Education, 2003.
[3] Stephen Chapman, Electric Machinery Fundamentals, McGraw-Hill, 2003.
[4] Charles A. Gross, Electric machines, CRC Press, 2006.
[5] James L. Kirtley, Electric Power Principles: Sources, Conversion, Distribution
and Use, John Wiley, 2010.

附註：太赫茲 (Terahertz = 10^12 赫茲 ) 波，是位於毫米波 (mm-Wave) 和紅外光波 (Infrared) 間
的電磁波波段。因太赫茲波和物質之間的獨特交互作⽤關係，常應⽤於遠端透視、分⼦解析、⽣醫感
測、癌症偵測、新穎材料開發等。近年來，太赫茲技術被認為是 6G/B6G 無線通訊最核⼼的技術之
⼀。

科號  Course Number ： 11120EE
398000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 5
中文名稱  Course Title ：演算法
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Algorithms
任課教師  Instructor ：張彌彰  CHANG MI CHANG
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R4 上課教室  Room ：台達 212 ／ 22
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Computer algorithms specify unambiguous steps to solve specific problems. The efficiency of these
algorithms can make huge impacts on the execution time or the memory requirement for solving large size
problems. In this course, how to analyze an algorithm is first introduced. Then some common approaches to
develop algorithms are described. That includes divide and conquer, greedy algorithms, dynamic
programming, branch and bound, etc. Finally, some known hard problems that would take very long time to
find the best solution are presented. If a problem falls into this category, known as NP-complete problems,
then one should not try to find the exact solution, instead, a sub-optimal solution should be sought for.
Extensive research on writing effective algorithms to solve practical problems have been carried out in the
20'th century, this course covers some of the basic ones to enable students to develop algorithmic skills
such that they can solve practical problems in the future.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
E. Horowitz, S. Sahni, and S. Rajasekeran, Computer Algorithms, 2nd Edition, Silicon Press, 2008.
三、參考書籍 (References)
T.H. Cormen, C.E. Leiserson, R.L. Rivest, and C. Stein, Introduction to Algorithms, 3rd Edition, The MIT
Press,
2009.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture and discussion.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction
2. Program performance analysis
3. Divide and conquer
4. The greedy method
5. Dynamic programming
6. Traversal and search
7. Backtracking
8. Branch and bound
9. Lower bound theory
10. NP-hard and NP-complete problems
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Homework: 50%
Midterm exam and quizzes : 30%
Final exam: 20%

任課教師  Instructor ：張彌彰  CHANG MI CHANG

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Mathematics is one of the most important subjects in applied sciences. Though most of us have had
extensive training in Mathematics, solving mathematical problems to get numerical answers are not
immediately obvious to most of the students. In this course, how to use computers to solve mathematical
problems to finding approximated numerical solutions will be introduced. This capability should help
students in future researches or even industrial career to solve real life problems. Theories in Numerical
Analysis will be introduced with extensive hand-on programming homework.

Press, 1988.

中文名稱  Course Title ：固態電⼦實驗 -- 半導體製程與實驗
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Solid-State Electronics Laboratory-Semiconductor
Processing
任課教師  Instructor ：邱博文
上課時間  Time ： T7T8T9 上課教室  Room ：台達 201 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The silicon integrated circuit is surely one of the wonders of our age. The
ability to fabricate tens of millions of individual components on a chip with an
area of a few centimeter square has enabled the information age. This course
attempts to describe not only the manufacturing practice associated with the
technologies used in silicon chip fabrication, but also the underlying scientific
basis for those technologies. This course will show the students how silicon
field-effect transistors are made using the knowledge learned in the ULSI
technologies.
However, due to the limited implementation hours, students can only fabricate
p-type or n-type MOSFET with characteristics measured and simulated.
⼆、參考書籍 (References)
1. J. D. Plummer, M. M. Deal, and P. B. Griffin, Silicon VLSI Technology,
Prentice
Hall, 2000.
2. Michael Quirk and Julian Serda, Semiconductor Manufacturing Technology,
Prentice
Hall, 2001.
3. Robert Doering and Yoshio Nishi, Handbook of Semiconductor Manufacturing
Technology,
CRC Press 2008.
三、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
1. In Chinese
2. The TA will give the students a mini instruction of the fabrication process
and principles.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. MOS structure and MOS process flow
2. RCA clean and Wet oxidation for MOS
3. Optical lithography-1 + Wet etching for MOS
4. TCAD simulation Ⅰ (Process)
5. TCAD simulation Ⅱ (Device)
6. Exam of TCAD simulation
7. RTA for MOS
8. Wet etching
9. Optical lithography-2 + Wet etching for MOS
10. metallization for MOS via E-gun
11. Optical lithography-3 + Wet etching for MOS
12. Backside metallization
13. Measurement of MOS

1. Pre-assessment: those who cannot pass the assessment will fail in the final
score.
2. Simulation test (40%)
3. Measurement report (60%)

中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣醫影像導論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Biomedical Imaging
任課教師  Instructor ：李夢麟
上課時間  Time ： T5T6R6 上課教室  Room ：台達 202 ／ 32
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Instructor: 李夢麟  Meng-Lin Li
Course description:
This is an introductory course of biomedical “imaging” (i.e., designing a
camera which is capable of seeing through human body and small animals) with
emphasis on the signals and systems aspects. It will cover the most important
imaging modalities - projection radiography, X-ray computed tomography,
nuclear medicine imaging, ultrasound imaging, and magnetic resonance imaging.
Basic principles, instrumentation, image characteristics, clinical
applications, and recent progress of these imaging modalities will be
discussed. The students will learn how to apply the knowledge learned in the
course "Signals and Systems" to biomedical imaging.
Prerequisites:
Signals and Systems (at least knowledge of Fourier transform and sampling),
Programming (for computer homework), or consent of the instructor
Topics:
1. Introduction
2. Ultrasound Imaging
3. Magnetic Resonance Imaging
4. X-Ray Imaging
5. X-Ray Computed Tomography
6. Nuclear Medicine Imaging:
Positron Emission Tomography (PET)
Single Photon Emission Computed Tomography (SPECT)
7. Site Visit: We will arrange visits to NTHU Brain
Research Center (and perhaps Mackay Memorial Hospital, Hsinchu).
Textbook:
1. Class notes and related materials will be announced on the NTHU EECLASS
elearning system (http://eeclass.nthu.edu.tw/).
Tentative lecture method:
Flipped classroom
(Powerpoint lecture slides + Asynchrounous on-line lectures + In class Q&A)
References:
1. P. Suetens, “Fundamentals of Medical Imaging,” Cambridge University Press,
2002. (in NTHU library, you can locate the newest version)
2. J. L. Prince, and J. links, “Medical Imaging Signals and Systems,”
Prentice Hall, 2005.
3. A. Macovski, “Medical Imaging,” Prentice Hall, 1983.
4. A. Webb, “Introduction to Biomedical Imaging,” IEEE Press, 2003.
5. K. K. Shung, M. B. Smith, and B. Tsui, “Principles of Medical Imaging,”
Academic Press, 1992.
Note:
It is difficult to find a single textbook which details all of the
aforementioned course materials. Accordingly, we will draw upon other
references (book chapters, research articles, etc.) and internet resources as
needed.

40% Midterm

later.)

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Communication Systems (II)
任課教師  Instructor ：蔡育仁

先修課程  (Prerequisites)

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is a sequel to EE 3640 Communication Systems I. The goal of this course is to provide a
comprehensive introduction to the basic principles, fundamental limits and technologies of digital
communications, including signal-space representations, digital modulation techniques, data detection
schemes, information theory, multichannel transmission, error-control coding, spread-spectrum modulation,
and other related topics. Students can learn much about the basic concepts of communication systems, digital
modulation, data transmission and reception, and some important theorems of digital communications.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Simon Haykin, Communication Systems, 4th Edition, John Wiley & Sons, 2001.

R. E. Ziemer, and W. H. Tranter, Principles of Communications: Systems, Modulation and Noise, 7th Edition,
Wiley, 2014.

484000學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
40
中文名稱  Course Title ：電機控制
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Electric Machinery Control
任課教師  Instructor ：廖聰明
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R3 上課教室  Room ：台達 208 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
電機控制  (Electric Machinery Control)
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
An industrial control plant, such as motor drive, is basically an
interdisciplinary system including actuator, mechanical load, power
electronic converter, controller, sensing and transducing schemes,
interfacing scheme. Its high driving performance can be achieved only if the
proper design of constituted components and their match are made. This
course is emphasized on the introduction to the system configuration of
industrial control plants, their constituted components, and the mechatronic
practical issues.
任課教師 : 廖聰明  (C. M. Liaw)
先修課程 : 電路學 . 電⼦學或電⼯學
主要內容 :
1. Introduction to electric machine control and mechatronics ( 機電整合 ).
2. Overview of power semiconductor devices.
3. Introduction to motor drives and their applications.
4. Dynamic and static specifications of sensors and transducers.
5. Sensors and transducers (for mechatronic system control).
6. Signal conditioning circuits for sensors and transducers.
7. V/I, I/V, F/V, V/F, A/D, D/A converters.
8. Shielding and grounding of power electronic systems.
9. Analog controllers.
10. Digital controllers (fuzzy controller).
11. Power electronic converters (AC-DC and DC-DC converters).
12. DC motor drives (converter-fed and chopper-fed)
13. Overview of some AC motor drives and special motor drives:
14. Modulation techniques and harmonic analysis for power converters.
15. Inverters (DC-AC converters).
16. Induction motor drives.
17. Permanent-magnet synchronous motor (PMSM) drives (Brushless DC Motor
(BDCM) drives).
18. Switched-reluctance motor (SRM) drives.
19. Experiments (Solid-state DC motor control, AC/DC controlled rectifiers
(Optional)).
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
[1] 講義  (Handouts).
[2] Timothy J. Maloney, Modern industrial electronics, 5th Ed., Pearson
Prentice Hall, 2004.

Thomson Learning, 2002.

applied mechatronics, CRC Press, 2000.

Design,
3rd Ed., John Wiley & Sons, Inc., 2003.

中文名稱  Course Title ：影像感測器積體電路設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Image Sensor IC Design
任課教師  Instructor ：謝志成
上課時間  Time ： T4R3R4 上課教室  Room ：台達 201 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is organized on selected topics in the design and analysis of
mixed-signal IC design for CMOS image sensor. It covers quantitative analyses,
design considerations and system applications from circuit and architecture
viewpoints. Starting with an introduction of fundamentals of CIS, a variety of
smart CMOS imagers with different operations and structures will be discussed.
For
application-wise design, sensor technologies like high dynamic range, low power,
low noise, and depth sensing etc. will be included. The mixed-signal IC design
and implementation of selected key blocks in CIS including analog-font-end (AFE)
and analog-to-digital converter are covered.
1.Introduction
2.Fundamentals of CMOS Image sensors.
3.Smart Imaging and Applications
4.Analog Front End
5.Data Converter
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Lecture note

Phototransduction
to Image Processing”, 2004
3.Tony C. Carusone, David A. Johns, and Kenneth W. Martin, “Analog
Integrated
Circuit Design,” 2nd Edition, John Wiley & Sons, Inc. 2012.
4.R. Jacob Baker, “CMOS Circuit Design, Layout, and Simulation,” 2nd
Edition,
IEEE Press, 2005.
5.Allan Hastings, “The Art of Analog Layout”, 2nd Edition, Prentice Hall,
2005

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程的⽬標是使軟件設計⼈員能夠開發⾼效的硬件加速器，並
進⼀步開發⼀種以有效⽅式集成應⽤
程序和硬件加速器的系統。
本課程分為兩個部分。第⼀部分是提供開發 C / C ++ 代碼的技
能，該代碼可以有效地轉換為硬件。
它從邏輯設計， FPGA 架構，使⽤ Pynq-Z2 板， EDA ⼯具，了解⾼級
綜合的內部⼯作流程， C / CC
+到RTL映射，設計分析和優化的背景開始。逐步說明⽰例。有⼤
量的實驗⼯作和作業，以給學⽣實
踐經驗。學期結束前，將舉⾏⼀系列有關最終項⽬的研討會介
紹。
第⼆部分是探索硬件軟件的協同設計。通過探討各種體系結構問
題，從⾼級主題⾼級綜合開始。通過
探索性能瓶頸，⼯作分區，設計有效的通信協議和運算核⼼開發
來實踐軟件 - 硬件協作的過程。憑藉
所學的技能，團隊中的學⽣將研究⼀個學期項⽬來解決實際應
⽤，⽰例應⽤包括數據庫，⽣物信息
學，財務，機器學習等。學期項⽬將產⽣各種硬件 - 軟件協同設計
問題被討論。該過程就像從計劃到
成功交付解決⽅案來開發真正的嵌入式產品。
● 先修要求 (prerequisite)
*Knowledge of C/C++
*The basic concept of digital logic, computer
architecture
*Knowledge of algorithms, and data structures
*Experiences with RTL design for ASIC or FPGA
would be helpful, but not
required

High-Level Synthesis,
https://bit.ly/3x4r8mp

PYNQ-Z2

Analysis

Upon completion of the course, students will be
able to (1) use HLS tools to
design complex digital circuit (2) Independently
analyze and optimize the design
(3) Independently research on specific application
area, evaluate and use open-
source resource to develop end-to-end application
acceleration (4) Collaborate
with other members in a small team to develop a
solution for an application
acceleration.

中文名稱  Course Title ：內嵌式記憶體電路設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Embedded Memory Circuit Design
任課教師  Instructor ：張孟凡
上課時間  Time ： T7T8T9 上課教室  Room ：台達 211 ／ 51
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明 (Course Description)：
This course introduces general knowledge of various on-chip memories to
students who are interesting in circuit design, system-level designs, design for
manufacturing (DFM) or process integrations.
Current embedded memories (ROM, SRAM, CAM, ROM, OTP/MTP, and FLASH) and
next-generation memories will be introduced. This course will study the devices
and circuit of memory bitcell, memory structures, sense amplifiers, high-voltage
circuits, and other digital and analog peripheral circuits. This course also will
cover the basic concept of computing-in-memory for AI chips. The system-level
applications, techniques of low-power and low-voltage designs, and design-for-
manufacturing (DFM) issues for embedded memories are also included.
Students who are interesting in transistor-level circuit designs, SoC designs,
semiconductor devices, or process integrations are welcome to take this course.
課程內容：
1. Overview of embedded memories
2. SRAM (SP, DP, RF, CAM)
3. Advanced SRAM
4. DRAM
5. ROM, OTP and MTP
6. FLASH (NOR & NAND)
7. Emerging memories (MRAM, PCM, ReRAM ..)
8. Design for manufacturing/yield of memory
9. Low-power and low-voltage memories
10. Computing-in-memory for AI

1. Exam.

1. VLSI
2. Electronics
3. Logic Designs
4. Familiar with HSPICE simulation
5. Familiar with IC schematic and Layout tools (very important)
科號  Course Number ： 11120EE
525400學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 0
中文名稱  Course Title ：⾼等數位晶片設計流程
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Advanced Digital Design Flow
任課教師  Instructor ：黃朝宗
上課時間  Time ： R7R8R9Ra 上課教室  Room ：台達 201 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
EE5254 Advanced Digital Design Flow ( ⾼等數位晶片設計流程 ) (updated on
2022/12/21)
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
**教學⽬標 :
學習數位電路晶片之進階設計流程，與現今趨勢接軌，培養後摩爾定律時代所需之晶片設計知識
**課程特⾊ :
使⽤ TSMC 16nm FinFET 設計教育套件 (N16 ADFP) 演練數位電路晶片之進階設計流程，包含 FinFET
library, hierarchical flow, flip chip, power gating 等
**修課條件 :
必需修過積體電路設計實驗，或類似具有數位電路晶片流程實際演練之課程
**特別註明 :
1) N16 ADFP 的使⽤有相當嚴格之要求，包含簽署使⽤者切結書 (University User’s
Acknowledgement) 、⼯作站上電⼦資料不可攜出、不可對螢幕進⾏拍照等；⽬前亦要求學⽣必須親
⾃在電機系⼯作站教室 ( 如資電 406) 裡操作，是否開放遠端操作將於學期開始時宣布
2) 此課程須⻑時間使⽤ EDA tool 完成上機實習、作業與專題，若無相關經驗或準備，切勿輕易嘗
試；第⼀次作業即會測試是否能獨立完成從 RTL 到 APR 的流程
**選課說明 :
⽬標修課⼈限為 20 ⼈，僅在加退選期間透過加簽選課，並僅供電資學院和半導體學院學⽣修課，會
在第⼀次上課 (2/16) 說明加簽細節，並在第⼆次上課 (2/23) 前通知結果
**加簽⾨檻 :
1) 已簽署使⽤者切結書
2) 先前修課證明
3) 任何有助加簽順位之說明 (Optional)

四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
本課程教學包含兩種形式：課堂上課 (lecture) 和上機實習 (lab) ，採隔週輪流上課 (3 ⼩時 ) 和實習
(4⼩時 )進⾏；上課內容以說明原理與技術為主，⽽實習以實際演練為主，會以⼀⼩型智慧影像 CNN
加速器為基底，從 simulation 和 synthesis ，⼀路完成到 sign-off verification ；共有三份⼤型
作業以及⼀個 Term project 。

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Design of Chip Security

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程將指導學⽣如何在積體電路設計的專業基礎上，考量資訊安全需求，進⾏晶片的數位電路設
計，與 FPGA 開發驗證，由於實作內容豐富，建議修課學⽣預先具備 C 語⾔能⼒。
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
投影片教材為主
● 參考書籍 (References)
1. Introduction to Hardware Security and Trust (2012, Springer)
2. Hardware Security - A Hands-on Learning Approach (2018, Elsevier)
3. Understanding Cryptography: A Textbook for Students and Practitioners (2010,
Springer)
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
本課程授課⽅式為投影片授課輔數位電路設計的實作。學⽣將會了解設計安全晶片應有的概念及考
量，並獨立完成 3 次實作作業，與 1 次實作專題報告，其中實作內容含兩部分 :
1.數位電路設計 (RTL)
2.FPGA的開發與驗證
課程設計著重於學⽣基礎理論的認知，及設計成果的呈現，訓練學⽣理論與實作並⽤，以及⼝頭報
告能⼒。

科號  Course Number ： 11120EE
551000學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
40
中文名稱  Course Title ：系統理論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： System Theory
任課教師  Instructor ：邱偉育
上課時間  Time ： T5T6R6 上課教室  Room ：台達 201 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
System analysis and design have become important given the increasing need for
IoT. When several things are connected and form a system, how to analyze it and
design the corresponding control methods are critical. This course covers some
basic concepts of system formulations and theory. We will have some discussions on
the analysis and design for systems represented by state-space models.
State-space approaches are powerful in the sense that they can cover both linear
and nonlinear systems. However, we must know the models in advance to perform
analysis and design. Model-free approaches, on the other hand, can address the
situation where the models are difficult to obtain. Model-free approaches
generally rely on the use of data, yielding data-driven science and
engineering; one dominant model-free approach would be the use of machine
learning. This course will cover both model-based and model-free approaches for
the analysis and design of dynamical systems. Students who wish to take this
course should have taken some relevant undergraduate courses such as control
system and linear algebra.
● 參考書籍 (References)
# C.-T. Chen, Linear System Theory and Design, 4th edition.
# R. C. Dorf and Robert H. Bishop, Modern Control Systems, 13th edition.
# W.-Y. Chiu, Introduction to Reinforcement learning, 1st edition (in Chinese).
# R. S Sutton and A. G. Barto, Reinforcement learning: An Introduction, 2nd
edition.
# Steven L. Brunton and J. Nathan Kutz, Data-Driven Science and Engineering:
Machine Learning, Dynamical Systems, and Control, 2nd edition.
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Blackboard presentation, PowerPoint presentation, class discussion, and video
watching.
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
Dimensionality Reduction and Transforms
Linear control theory
Neural networks and deep learning
Data-driven dynamical systems
Balanced Models for control
Data-driven control
Reinforcement learning
*Reduced-order Models (optional)
*Interpolation for parametric reduced-order models (optional)
*Physics-informed machine learning (optional)
● 成績考核 (Evaluation)
Class participation (class discussions, homework, oral presentation): 40%
Exams: 15% x 4=60%
科號  Course Number ： 11120EE
578000學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
22
中文名稱  Course Title ：智慧電網
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Smart Grid
任課教師  Instructor ：朱家⿑
上課時間  Time ： M7M8T7T8 上課教室  Room ：台達 215 ／ 135
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Electric power systems are experiencing significant changes at the worldwide
scale in order to become cleaner, smarter, and more reliable. This course will
examine a wide range of topics related to these changes, which are primarily
caused by the introduction of new information technologies, renewable energy
penetration, digitalized equipment, new operational strategies, and so forth.
The emphasis will be put on the modeling and control of smart grid systems.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
1. A. G. Phadke and J. Thorp, Synchronized Phasor Measurements and Their
Applications, Springer-Verlag, 2018.
2. A. Yazdani, R. Iravani, Voltage-Source Converters in Power Systems: Modeling,
Control, and Applications, Wiley, 2010.
3. R. Teodorescu, M. Liserre, and P. Rodriguez, Grid Converters for Photovoltaic
and Wind Power Systems, Wiley, 2011.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Anaya-Lara, N. Jenkins, J. Ekanayake, P. Cartwright, M. Huges, Wind Energy
Generation: Modelling and Control, Wiley, 2009.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture+ Computer Simulations
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Smart Grids: Infrastructure, Technology, and Solutions. Basic Concepts of
Smart Power Systems; Smart Grid Distributed Generation Systems; Microgrid
Systems.
2. Synchronized Phasor Measurements Techniques. Phasor Measurement Units and
Data Concentrator; Phasor Estimation of Nominal Frequency Inputs; Phasor
Estimation at Off-Nominal Frequency Inputs; Frequency Estimation; State
Estimation.
3. Grid Converters. Converter: Circuit Topologies and Their Control; Grid
Synchronization; Islanding Detection; Control of Grid Converter under Grid
Faults; Grid Filter Design; Parallel operation of Inverters in Distributed
Generation Systems; Power Flow Control of a Single Distributed Generation
Unit.
4. Wind Energy Generation. Introduction to a Wind Energy Generation System;
Fixed-Speed Induction Generator-based　 Wind Turbines; Doubly-Fed Induction
Generator-based Wind Turbines; Fully-rated Converter-based Wind
Turbines; Influence of Wind Farms on Network Dynamic Performance; The
Integration of Wind Farms into the Power System.
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Homeworks (50%)+ 1 Midterm (25%)+ 1 Final (25%)

40
中文名稱  Course Title ：固態能量轉換
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Solid-State Power Conversion
任課教師  Instructor ：廖聰明
上課時間  Time ： M5M6R5 上課教室  Room ：台達 210 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The major topics include:
1. Square-Wave inverters: Phase-shifted control; Six-Step inverter.
2. Fourier series analyses of specical symmetric waveforms.
3. Phasor analysis approach.
4. Pulse-Width Modulation inverters: Sine-Triangle PWM; Stationary
frame transformation and synchronous frame transformation;
Space-Vector PWM; Zero sequence injection.
5. Current Regulator: Hysteresis regulator; Synchronous frame PI
regulator; Predictive regulator.
6. Multilevel inverters: Neutral point clamped (NPC); Flying
Capacitor; Cascaded H Bridge; SVPWM of multilevel inverter.
7. Random switching technoques.
8. Application Examples: PMSM drives; Field Oriented Control of induction
machines; Active Filter Systems; Static VAR Compensators; Electric vehicles,
Microgrids; Energy storage systems.
9. IGBT implementation issues: Gate Driver and protection; Low
stray inductance bus plane; Parallel connection of IGBTs.
10. Applications of wide band-gap devices (SiC and GaN devices).

科號  Course Number ： 11120EE
625000學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
80
中文名稱  Course Title ：超⼤型積體電路測試
英文名稱  Course English Title ： VLSI Testing
任課教師  Instructor ：黃錫瑜
上課時間  Time ： MaMbMc 上課教室  Room ：台達 216 ／ 103
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is devoted to the fundamental knowledge of testing Very
Large-Scale Integrated circuits (VLSI). The emphasis is on the investigation
of various technically feasible test solutions combining both Design-for-
Testability hardware and Computer-Aided Design algorithms for test-pattern
generation to ensure the overall testability and quality of manufactured
ICs. It begins with the topics of fault modeling and fault simulation,
followed by the algorithms of Automatic Test Pattern Generation (ATPG).
Then, widely adopted Design-for-Testability (DFT) techniques in IC design
industry, such as Scan Test, Built-In Self-Test (BIST), and test compression
will be introduced. Upon the completion of this course, the students will
know how to apply all kinds of test solutions to make an IC easily testable
and reliable in a cost-effective way.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
L.-T. Wang, C.-W. Wu, and X. Wen, “VLSI Test Principles and Architectures:
Design for Testability,” Morgan Kaufmann, July 2006.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
lecture with slides
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction
2. Fault Modeling
3. Fault Simulation
4. Design-for-Testability (DFT) and Scan Test
5. Automatic Test Pattern Generation (ATPG)
6. Delay Test
7. Built-In Self-Test (BIST)
8. Test Compression
9. Boundary Scan Test
10. Power and Clock Network Testing
11. Fault Diagnosis
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
出席 5% 實作型作業 30% 期中考 30% 期末考 35%

中文名稱  Course Title ：仿⽣系統設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Biomimetic System Design
任課教師  Instructor ：鄭桂忠
上課時間  Time ： T5T6R6 上課教室  Room ：台達 210 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course introduces various neuromorphic VLSI systems, including the sensory
systems such as silicon retina, silicon cochlea, electronic nose, learning and
memory in silicon, and cognitive functions in silicon. The emerging technologies
for interfacing silicon with neural tissue, and for further developing a hybrid
neuron-silicon system in which neuromorphic neurons can interact with biological
neurons will also be introduced.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Power-point handouts will be prepared
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. "Analog VLSI and Neural Systems", ed. C. A. Mead, 1990
2. “Neuromorphic systems”, ed. By Leslie S. Smith and Alister Hamilton,
World Science, 1998
3. “Learning on Silicon – Adaptive VLSI Neural Systems”, ed. by Gert
Cauwenberghs and Magdy A. Bayoumi, Kluwer Academic Publisher, 1999
4. “Smart adaptive systems on silicon”, ed. by Maurizio Valle, Kluwer
Academic Publisher, 2004
5. “Neural Engineering” ed. by Bin He, Kluwer Academic Publisher, 2005
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
The course is lectured in English with power-point handouts.
There will be five HWs and a final project to lead the students to construct
spiking neural networks.
Related materials will be distributed in class.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to Neuromorphic
2. Physiology and biophysics of neurons and synapses
3. Mathematical models of neurons and synapses
4. Dynamical system theory
5. Learning: An Introduction
6. Supervised learning systems
7. Unsupervised learning systems
8. Hebbian learning systems
9. Attentive systems
10. System example
11. Silicon-Neuron Interfaces / Prosthetic systems
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
HW 60%
Class 20%
Final project 20%

中文名稱  Course Title ：記憶體系統
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Memory Systems
任課教師  Instructor ：呂仁碩
上課時間  Time ： M3M4R2 上課教室  Room ：台達 208 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The memory hierarchy plays an increasingly important role in determining the cost, performance, power
consumption, and reliability of SoC, mobiles, PCs, and datacenters. Students interested in these industries or
research areas may want to have architectural-level knowledge in the memory hierarchy. This course
introduces architectural-level techniques of designing, managing, and optimizing a memory hierarchy at all
levels, including on-chip caches, main memory, storage caches, and storage. In addition, emerging topics such
as active storage and processing in memory will also be introduced.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Selected papers from computer architecture conferences
三、參考書籍 (References)
"Memory Systems: Cache, DRAM, Disk", Bruce Jacob, Spencer Ng, David Wang, 2010
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture, paper presentation by students, in class discussion,
programming assignments, midterm exam, Final exam
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. On-chip caches
2. Main memory
3. Storage caches
4. Solid state storage
5. Active storage, processing in memory, datacenter storage

科號  Course Number ：
11120EECS101002學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
75
中文名稱  Course Title ：邏輯設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Logic Design
任課教師  Instructor ：麥偉基  MAK WAI KEI
上課時間  Time ： M7M8R5R6 上課教室  Room ：台達 104 ／ 116
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
This course helps the students to understand the basic theory of digital logic design and the implementation
of logic circuit. In the beginning, the advantages of digital logic and data representation in binary will be
discussed. Combinational logic simplification using Boolean algebra and K-maps will be introduced. We will
cover the design and usage of combinational building blocks like decoders, encoders, multiplexers, and
adders. Then, basic storage elements like latches and various types of flip-flops will be described before
diving into the design and analysis of more general sequential circuits. We will study the design of different
types of registers and counters, and the design of memory. At the end, we will discuss how to design a digital
system systematically as a combination of a datapath and a control unit. Verilog for describing logic circuits
will introduced throughout the course.
⼆、指定⽤書
Digital Design (6th edition), by M.M. Mano and M.D. Ciletti, Pearson International Edition.
四、教學⽅式
Lecture 
五、教學進度
1. Introductory Digital Design Concepts
2. Boolean Algebra and Logic Gates
3. Gate-Level Minimization
4. Combinational Logic
5. Synchronous Sequential Logic
6. Registers and Counters
7. Memory
8. Digital System Design
六、成績考核
Homeworks 26%; Exam: 74% (2x27%+20%)

https://eelcass.nthu.edu.tw/

Course Description
This course introduces fundamental programming concepts in the Python language and
related
environment. Fundamental concepts include overview of computer systems, Python
environment setup,
Python language overview, command line interface, numbers, string formatting,
sequences, dictionaries
and sets, control flow, exception, file, function, recursion, object orientation,
inheritance, polymorphism,
and modules. The programming environment will be primarily text-based in Unix
environment, although
graphical user interface (IDLE) and web-based (Jupyter) will also be
demonstrated.
Restrictions:
- EECS1210 and CS1358 may not both be taken for credit.
Textbooks
- None required
References
- 洪維恩，《 Python 教學⼿冊》， ISBN 9789863126881, 出版社：旗標科技股份有限公司
- Mark Summerfield, Programming in Python 3: A Complete Introduction to the Python
Language, Second
Edition, Addison-Wesley, 2010, Person Education, Inc., Boston, MA USA.
- Python website, www.python.org
Teaching Method
- 2 hours of recorded lecture (Mandarin with English captions) quiz every other
week.
Syllabus
Week 1 - introduction, environment setup
Week 2 - tour of Python
Week 3 - basic types, command-line application
Week 4 - command-line application (cont'd), strings
Week 5 - collections: sequence (list, tuple), set, dict
Week 6 - control constructs: if, while, for
Week 7 - exceptions, files
Week 8 - functions
Week 9 - recursion, functional programming
Week 10 - object-oriented programming part 1: class, method
Week 11 - object-oriented programming part 2: inheritance, operator overloading
Week 12 - generators, iterators
Week 13 - standard library part 1: data types, itertools
Week 14 - standard library part 2: regular expressions, Tkinter
Evaluation
30% - assignments
30% - quizzes
40% - final exam
Course website
https://elearn.nthu.edu.tw/

中文名稱  Course Title ：訊號與系統
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Signals and Systems
任課教師  Instructor ：林嘉文
上課時間  Time ： W5W6R8R9 上課教室  Room ：台達 216 ／ 103
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Description:
This is a mandatory course intended to consolidate the mathematical foundations
to various fields of electrical engineering, such as signal processing,
communications, optics, and control. In this course, we will introduce various
analysis methods along with some practical examples. We will focus on continuous-
time/discrete-time deterministic signals and linear time-invariant systems. We
will cover the convolution, Fourier series, Fourier transform, Laplace transform,
and z-transform operations. The length of this course is 16 weeks.
Textbook:
Oppenheim, Willsky, with Nawab, Signals and Systems, 2nd Ed., Pearson Education
Limited, (2014).
Class notes: Course materials available on https://eeclass.nthu.edu.tw/
Teaching Method:
Lectures in Chinese. Questions are welcome both in English or Chinese.
Course Content:
Fundamentals of Signals and Systems
Linear Time-Invariant Systems
Fourier Series Representation of Periodic Signals
The Continuous-Time Fourier Transform
The Discrete-Time Fourier Transform
Time and Frequency Characterization of LTI Systems
Sampling
Communication Systems
The Laplace Transform
The z-Transform
Grading:
Homework/Quiz (30%)
Examination 1 (20%)
Examination 2 (25%)
Examination 3 (25%)
Ethics policy:
As a student of NTHU, you are here to learn.
1. You should always bear honor and confidence in your mind. You should be
responsible for your own grade and in a longer term, your future. You can start
by finishing your own class assignments.
2. Plagiarism in any form is unacceptable. The plagiarist will receive a 0%
for that assignment. We do, however, encourage discussions among classmates.
3. Misconducts during examinations will result in failure of this course.
4. Overly active club participation makes no excuse for late homework and/or
missing exams.

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
"Signals and Systems" is a fundamental course to the study of many fields that constitute the discipline of
electrical engineering, such as signal processing, communications, and control. In this course, we will describe
various analysis methods along with some practical examples for continuous-time/discrete-time deterministic
signals and linear time-invariant systems, including the convolution, Fourier series, Fourier transform, Laplace
transform, z-transform operations, and so on.
⼆、指定⽤書
Alan V. Oppenheim and Alan S. Willsky, with S. Hamid Nawab, Signals and Systems, 2nd Ed., Pearson
Education Limited, 2014 (or Prentice-Hall, 1997; or 2nd Adapted Ed. with Adaptor Jian-Jiun Ding, Pearson
Education Taiwan and Eurasia Book Co., 2016)
三、參考書籍
1. Matthew N. O. Sadiku and Warsame H. Ali, Signals and Systems: A Primer with MATLAB®, CRC Press,
2016.
2. Simon Haykin and Barry Van Veen, Signals and Systems, 2nd Ed., John Wiley & Sons, Inc., 2003.
3. Leland B. Jackson, Signals, Systems, and Transforms, Addison-Wesley, 1991.
四、教學⽅式

五、教學進度

mid term 2

中文名稱  Course Title ：常微分⽅程
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Ordinary Differential Equations
任課教師  Instructor ：劉光浩
上課時間  Time ： T5T6R5R6 上課教室  Room ：旺宏懷樸／ 170
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
*課程說明 (Course Description)*
This course aims to provide sufficient mathematic training for students whose
majors are in engineering. The content emphasizes in ordinary, Fourier analysis,
and integral transform. This course is the mathematic foundation of
electromagnetics, modern physics, solid- state physics and so on. Basic mathematic
skills, especially calculus, are required.
*指定⽤書 (Text Books)*
Erwin Kreyszig, Advanced Engineering Mathematics, 10th Edition, Wiley Plus.
*參考書籍 (References)*
Peter O’neil, Advanced Engineering Mathematics, 8th Edition, Cengage Learning.
*教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)*
Mainly on blackboard. Supplementary materials in Powerpoint slides will be used
too.
*教學進度 (Syllabus)*
1. First-order ordinary differential equations
2. Second-order linear differential equations (including Power series method and
special functions, i.e. Bessel functions, Legendre's polynomials)
3. Laplace transforms and Fourier transforms
4. Sturm-Liouville Problem and eigenfunction expansion (wide-sense Fourier Series)
*成績考核 (Evaluation)*
Attendance, participation homework and quiz (20 %), Midterm I (25 %), Midterm II
(25 %), Final exam (30 %)
** May be adjusted in the end of the semester

科號  Course Number ：
11120EECS402000學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
90
中文名稱  Course Title ：演算法
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Algorithms
任課教師  Instructor ：韓永楷
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F3 上課教室  Room ：台達 107 ／ 150
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
There are many problems around us, and they need some fast and good methods to 
be 
solved.  For instance, 
  (i)  Suppose that we have been very lazy the last few weeks, 
       and suddenly, we find that 10 homeworks A,B,C,D,E,..., J
       will be due next week.   The homeworks have different deadlines,
       and some will be on Monday, some will be on Friday.  
       We have an estimation of how fast we can finish each homework.
       Questions:  Can we finish all of them?  
                   If so, which one should we do first, which one next?
 
  (ii) Suppose that our school has 100 landmarks (such as the library, 
       the EECS building, the main gate, etc), and you want to design 
       a system so that if a user enters any two landmarks (say, A and B), 
       your system can immediately suggest a shortest route from A to B.
       Of course, you can find all the 100x100 routes by yourself, but 
       it would be better if you can write a computer program to do it
       for you.  Is there any efficient computer program for this problem?
To solve a particular problem, there are usually many different methods.  
For instance, in Problem (i), we can try all possible arrangements of the 
homeworks A,B,C,D,E, ... and see if they can all be finished in time.  
However, we need to try 10! arrangements, and this would take a long time.
On the other hand, if we want to finish all the homeworks, it seems that
we should do the one whose deadline is nearest first, and then do the one
whose deadline is second nearest, and so on.  There may be other methods 
we can try.  One question arises:  Among all methods, is there one which
is always faster and better than the others?   
In this course, we will look at a lot of fundamental problems that are solved 
daily around us, and we will study their solutions (that is, the methods or 
the algorithms), and show how to analyze the performance of the 
solutions.  We will also introduce general techniques to help us design a good 
algorithm when we face a new problem.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Book)  
    Introduction to algorithms, 2nd edition, the MIT press, 2001
    by T. Cormen, C. E. Leiserson, and R. L. Rivest 
三、參考書籍  (References)   
    1. Algorithms in C++, (or Algorithms in Java), by R. Sedgewick
    2. The Art of Computer Programming, by D. E. Knuth
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)  
    Lectures and Tutorials (in English)
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
　I.   Mathematical Foundations
        1. Introduction
　      2. Growth of Functions
        3. Summations
        4. Recurrences
  II.  Sorting and Order Statistics
        6. Heapsort
        7. Quicksort
        8. Sorting In Linear Time
        9. Medians and Order Statistics
  III. Data Structures:  Self Study
  IV.  Advanced Design and Analysis Techniques
       15. Dynamic Programming
       16. Greedy Algorithms
       17. Amortized Analysis
       
  V.   Advanced Data Structures
       19. Binomial Heaps
       20. Fibonacii Heaps
       21. Data Structures for Disjoint Sets
       
  VI.  Graph Algorithms
       22. Elementary Graph Algorithms
       23. Minimum Spanning Trees
       24. Single-Source Shortest Paths
       25. All-Pairs Shortest Paths
       
  VII. Selected Topics
       34. NP-Completeness
       35. Approximation Algorithms
六、成績考核  (Evaluation)   
    5--6 assignments    0%
    3 exams           100%
    ----------------------
    Total             100%
    There are two formula for your final score:
    (1) 20 + (average of 3 exams) * 0.8
    (2) (average of the best 2 exams) * 0.8 + (the worst one) * 0.2
    Final score = Maximum of (1) and (2).

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Computer Architecture

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
To understand how computer systems work. Emphasis will be placed on
1. What characterizes the performance of a computer
2. Instruction set design and its interaction with a compiler
3. Basic building blocks: I/O, Memory, Datapath, Control
4. Pipelined datapath
5. Memory hierarchy
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
D.A.Patterson and J. L. Hennessy, Computer Organization and Design:
The Hardware/Software Interface (RISC-V Edition), Morgan Kaufmann, 2017.
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures and discussions
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Course outlines
1: Computer abstractions and technology
2: The role of performance
3: Instructions: language of the machine
4: Arithmetic for computers
5: The processor: datapath and control
6: Enhancing performance with pipelining
7: Large and fast: exploiting memory hierarchy

Homework, mid-term examination, final examination

科號  Course Number ： 11120EMD
500700學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
25
中文名稱  Course Title ：公司法與公司治理
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Corporate Law & Corporate Governance
任課教師  Instructor ：蔡昌憲
邱婉茜
上課時間  Time ： SaSbSc 上課教室  Room ：台積 429 ／ 36
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
1. Course Description:
This course is to introduce legal fundamentals and economic/financial concepts
governing corporations’ operation, finance, and relations among the management,
shareholders, and other stakeholders in a corporation. In addition to a focus of
corporate finance and the functions of the security market, this course will, from
time to time, make comparison between the U.S. and Taiwanese models of corporate
law, corporate governance, while looking into emerging trends in business
sustainability or ESG (environmental, social & corporate governance).
2. References:
The course materials are those to be assigned and distributed to students bit by
bit in class.
3. Teaching Methods:
Via course lectures, students will develop critical skills in assessing the
relevance of the principles of corporate law, corporate governance and finance to
real-world situations. Moreover, active and significant student participation in
class discussion is required.
4. Course Schedule:
(1) An Introduction to Corporate Governance
(2) Fundamentals of Corporate Law: Introduction to Legal and Economic Views of
Business Associations
(3) Functions of the Board of Directors and the Role of Independent Directors
(4) Corporate fraud, agency conflicts, and corporate governance
(5) Sustainable Corporate Governance: An International and Comparative Perspective
5. Aligned Learning Goals and Learning objectives:
(1) To recognize and explain concepts of corporate law
(2) To understand traditional corporate governance on agency conflicts and
corporate fraud
(3) To discuss the cutting-edge issue of sustainable corporate governance

任課教師  Instructor ：林福仁  LIN FU REN
劉⽟雯
上課時間  Time ： MaMbMc 上課教室  Room ：台積 429 ／ 36
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
EMD 800800
Management of Knowledge and Organizational Behavior
Instructors:
林福仁教授、劉⽟雯教授
Introduction:
This course consists of two subjects: knowledge management and organizational
behavior. Two instructors will convey their domain expertise on these two subjects
via case teaching, discussion, and lecture. Knowledge management covers topics in
knowledge creation, organizational learning, KM systems, and AI in knowledge
management. Organizational Behavior covers topics in rewards, motivation,
communication and negotiation, teams, leadership, employee selection and
migration.
objectives:
After completing this course consisting of knowledge management and organizational
behavior, students are expected to demonstrate the following learning outcomes:
1. Be familiar with the major concepts of organizational behavior and issues that
managers encounter, and with principles, practices and models that help managers
deal with these issues.
2. Be able to see how the relationships among people within an organization and
relationships among organizations influence organizational effectiveness.
3. Understand the knowledge creating, acquisition, encoding, and retrieval within
and among organizations.
4. Understand the role of technology played in knowledge management and
organizational learning.
I. Classroom Participation (30%)
In-class Discussion
The learning experience in a course like this one depends heavily on each student
being prepared to actively participate in every class session. Positive
participation includes attendance, active involvement in all in-class exercises
and discussions, and maintenance of a classroom demeanor that encourages the
participation of others. You will be evaluated on the quantity as well as the
quality of your contribution and insights.
II. Individual Assignments (40%)
In addition, closing to the end of every class, each student is required to
summarize what you have learned in our class on that day. The summary should
include both key ideas from each article and your main takeaway from our class
discussion.
III. Case Study (30%)
Questions for each case will be provided before the class. Each student is
required to provide your answers and insights in the reflection paper. The papers
must be double-spaced with one-inch margins and use 12-point font size. No more
than four pages. Bring the paper to class for further group discussions.

中文名稱  Course Title ：法律、創新與公司治理
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Law, Innovation and Corporate Governance
任課教師  Instructor ：林勤富
蔡昌憲
上課時間  Time ： WaWb 上課教室  Room ：⾺來⻄亞／ 0
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
【本課程對應之學習⽬標與核⼼能⼒  Aligned Learning Goals and Learning objectives】
(1) Students will identify common legal or ethical problems in the practice of
business and
innovation activities.
(2) Students will identify how law incorporates ethical standards to regulate
immoral
business behavior.
(3) Students will be equipped with the knowledge needed to legally and
ethically manage
decision-making practices in today's business operations.
(4) Students will acquire analytical skills to examine and respond to the
legal challenges
posed by emerging technologies, such as biotechnology and artificial intelligence.
【課程⽬標  Course objectives】
⻑期以來，台灣強調以貿易及科技立國。在以科技創新為主軸的清⼤ EMBA 教育理念下，本課
程的設計，將強調以學員在對應前述挑戰下應具有的核⼼競爭元素為核⼼。本課程的內容則
將以 EMBA 課程設計理念為宗，強調在全球化視⾓下，法律如何應對新興科技與服務創新帶來
的挑戰，⼜應如何成為有效的知識⼯具，融入企業經理⼈的決策模式。
【課程說明  Course Description】
本課程將分為⼆⼤主軸⽅向進⾏，預計採分組案例研習，並搭配延伸研究資源之提供等設
計，⿎勵學員參與討論，藉以發現問題，之後再交由教師回覆。本課程將透過這種反饋式教
學的⽅法，以深化學習成果的可操作性。課程內容所欲傳遞給學員的核⼼知識，將包含⼆⼤
主軸：其⼀為新興科技發展與服務創新所帶來的法律議題與挑戰；其⼆為公司治理與法律風
險控管。
【教學進度  Course Schedule ( 暫定 ) 】
(⼀) 認識新興科技與企業創新的機遇與挑戰
(⼆) 前沿科技的法律管制趨勢與制度選擇
(三) 認識董事與經理⼈的法律風險

500900學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：創新與創業
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Innovation and Entrepreneurship
任課教師  Instructor ：張元杰
胡美智
上課時間  Time ： S8S9 上課教室  Room ：深圳研究／ 0
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
National Tsing Hua University
College of Technology Management ／ EMBA
Course Syllabus: Innovation and Entrepreneurship ( 創新與創業 )
授課教師／ Instructors
張元杰  Dr. Yuan-Chieh Chang (yucchang@mx.nthu.edu.tw)
胡美智  Dr. Mei-Chih Hu (mchu@mx.nthu.edu.tw)
課程助教／ Class TA:
TBA
A. 課程介紹／ Course Description:
1.介紹創業管理的基礎知識與技能，使學⽣能瞭解創業精神與經濟發展、企業管理之間的關係
及
實務創業家所關⼼主要問題。
2.開拓學⽣的視野，瞭解專業經理⼈除了要為股東善盡效率管理⼈之責任外，發揮創業精神才
是
創造企業成⻑及獲得超額利潤的來源。有助於培養 MBA 學⽣以創新思維，處理既有企業的新事業
發展管理、創投事業經營與⾃⾏創業的能⼒。
3.使學⽣瞭解新創事業的特性與其所⾯臨的相關管理問題，如分析創業商機、撰寫創業計畫
書、
籌募資⾦、管理成⻑與經營團隊管理。
The objective of this course is to provide the student with an
understanding of the problems and challenges facing an entrepreneur in the
process of creating a business. The course will use the development of a
business plan as the focal point. Groups of students will develop a business
plan piece by piece. Each group will make 2 case presentations and write a
business plan during the semester.
Therefore the focus of this course is the planning and development of new
ventures for the growth and profits of new or existing enterprises. The
students will gain a firm understanding and the competence in the area of
entrepreneurship. The business plan projects are required, which will
further elaborate on particular aspects of the course according to the
student’s own objectives and background. The business plan projects also
help to consolidate theories and best practices from the western countries
to the context of Taiwan’s industries. Interactive learning is emphasized
throughout the course. Student’s participation in class, including
discussion, homework, and project presentation is a critical and integral
part of the course.
B. Textbooks:
Timmons, J.A. and Spinelli, S. (2018) New Venture Creation: Entrepreneurship
for the 21st Century, 9th Ed., McGraw-Hill. ( 華泰代理 )
C. References:
1.Compers, P. and Lerner, J. (1999) The Venture Capital Cycle, MA: The MIT
Press.
2.Dollinger, M. J. (1999) Entrepreneurship: Strategies and Resources, NJ:
Prentice-Hall.
3.Holt, D. H. (1992) Entrepreneurship: New Venture Creation, NJ: Prentice-
Hall.
4.Kao, John (1989) Entrepreneurship, Creativity, and Organization: Text,
Cases, and Readings, International Edition, NJ: Prentice-Hall.
5.劉世平  譯  (1999) 企業家精神，商業周刊出版社。
D. Evaluation:
1.Participation 30%
2.Homework 30%
3.Final report 40%
E. Teaching Approach:
1.Lecture 50%
2.Case Study 30%
3.Presentation 20%
Q95;

6.商機評估與個案

科號  Course Number ： 11120ENE
512500學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
32
中文名稱  Course Title ：半導體物理
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Semiconductor Physics
任課教師  Instructor ：吳⽟書
上課時間  Time ： T2T3T4 上課教室  Room ：台達 202 ／ 32
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course focuses on the basic physics of semiconductors, in particular
the various quantum processes that are important for device applications.
The highlights are band structures, electron-
impurity scattering, optical transitions, and electron transport theory.
The students are required to have backgrounds in quantum mechanics and
solid state physics both at the introductory level.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
my own lecture notes
三、參考書籍 (References)
"Semiconductor physics and applications", by Balkanski and Wallis
"Principles of the theory of solids", by J. M. Ziman
"Quantum processes in semiconductors", by B. K. Ridley
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Mainly by class lectures.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Theory of band structures
i) Bloch's theorem: a revisit
ii) tight-binding method
ii) k.p method (with review of time-independent perturbation theory)
2. Effective mass theory
i) Effective mass theorem
ii)applications:
external field
impurity states in semiconductors
excitons
3. Semi-classical theory of carrier transport
i) phenomenological description of carrier scattering
ii) DC / AC electrical conductivity
iii) carrier transport in magnetic field
4. optical properties of solids
i) review of time-dependent perturbation theory / Fermi's
golden rule
ii) light-matter interaction (with review of Maxwell equations,
vector potential concept)
iii) quantum mechanical derivation of optical absorption
iv) quantum well photodetectors
v) complex dielectric function
vi) simple harmonic oscillator model of dielectric function
vii) Kramers-Kronig relation
5. carrier scattering
i) neutral impurity scattering
ii) ionized impurity scattering
iii) electron-phonon scattering
6. elelctron transport theory
i) Boltzmann transport equation
ii) relaxation time approximation
iii) analytic solution in the linear transport regime
iv) device equations
v) high field transport
vi) hot electron phenomena: velocity saturation
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
homework, midterm and final tests
七、可連結之網⾴位址
科號  Course Number ： 11120ENE
513000學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
22
中文名稱  Course Title ：量⼦⼒學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Quantum Mechanics
任課教師  Instructor ：洪勝富
上課時間  Time ： W7W8R8 上課教室  Room ：台達 212 ／ 22
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This is a course on elementary quantum mechanics aiming for applications in
solid-state physics and optoelectronic devices. Emphasis is put on the basic
concepts and techniques, which will be applicable to solid state physics and
optical properties of semiconductors. A heuristic approach will be adopted to
introduce the basic concepts as well as the Schrodinger equation. We will soon
move to one-dimensional bound state problems. Extended state problems in one
dimension will also be explored. Algebraic operator method for simple harmonic
oscillator will be covered. We will then introduce angular momentum operators and
central potential problems. Time-independent and time-dependent perturbation
methods will be included. Finally, identical particles with focus on equilibrium
statistics will be introduced if time allows.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Handouts and homeworks will be distributed.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. A. Yariv, An introduction to theory and applications of quantum mechanics, New
York
: Wiley.
2. A.P. French and Edwin F. Taylor, An Introduction to Quantum Physics, Norton &
Company
3. David A.B. Miller, Quantum Mechanics for Scientists and Engineers, Cambridge
University Press
4. Bernard Diu, Franck Laloe, and Claude Cohen-Tannoudji, Quantum Mechanics, Vol.
1 and
2, New York: Wiley.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecturing with powerpoints.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. history and dilemmas of classical physics in early nineteen century
2. a heuristic introduction to basic concepts in quantum physics
3. one-dimensional bound state problems
4. algebraic method for simple harmonic oscillator
5. one-dimensional scattering problems
6. angular momentum operator and central potential problems
7. time-independent perturbation method
8. time-dependent perturbation method and Fermi golden rule
9. identical particles and Boson/Fermion statistics
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
1. 作業 (30%) 2. 考試  (2x35%)

中文名稱  Course Title ：微波電路分析及設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Analysis and Design of Microwave Circuits
任課教師  Instructor ：徐碩鴻  Hsu Shuo Hung
上課時間  Time ： M5M6W6 上課教室  Room ：台達 201 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Welcome to the world of microwave circuits. This area impacts many recent
electronic developments such as wireless communication and high-speed
optoelectronic systems. This course introduces concepts and principles of
circuit analysis and design at microwave frequencies by examining both
active and passive devices. Microwave device modeling and non-ideal effects
in circuit operation such as noise and nonlinear distortion are also
emphasized. The design techniques required to develop most of the major
building blocks in modern microwave systems are also included.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
G. Gonzalez, “Microwave Transistor Amplifiers: Analysis & Design,” Prentice
Hall, 1996.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. G. D. Vendelin, "Microwave circuit design using linear and nonlinear
techniques", Wiley-interscience, 1990
2. I. Bahl and P. Bhartia, "Microwave solid state circuit design", 2nd edition,
Wiley-interscience, 2003
3. T. Lee, "The Design of CMOS radio-frequency integrated circuits", 2nd
edition, Cambridge, 2004.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Power point handouts are used in this class and the notes are written on the
computer directly using a tablet laptop computer. CAD tool (Advanced Design
System) is intensively used in this class to let the students have opportunities
using industrial standard approaches for microwave circuit design.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
- Introduction
- Two-port networks
- Transmission line
- S-parameters
- Power waves and power gain
- Matching network
- Microwave transistor amplifier design
- Bias networks
- Device characteristics and modeling
- Low noise amplifier
- Broadband amplifier
- Power amplifier
- Microwave oscillator
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
- Homework (20%)
- Quiz (10%)
- Midterm (20%)
- Final exam (20%)
- Final project (30%)

A. Course Description: Introduction of Detailed investigation of
the basic principles of 'unit' processes used in the fabrication of solid-state
devices and integrated circuits for silicon based electronics and beyond.
Emphasis is placed on the fundamental aspects of lithography, film deposition, wet
etching, anisotropic dry etching, crystal growth, ion implantation, and chemical
vapor deposition of metals and insulators.
B. Text Books:
1. Silicon VLSI Technology, Fundamentals, Practice and Modeling, J. D. Plummer,
M.D. Deal, and P.B. Griffin, Prentice-Hall, 2000, ISBN: 0-13-085037-3.
C. Reference book:

ISBN: 978-0-471-23279-7
2. Semiconductor Devices: Physics and Technology 3/E, S. M. Sze, M.-K. Lee,
Wiley, 2012
3. Semiconductor Manufacturing Technology, M. Quirk and J. Serda, Prentice Hall,
2001.
4. Semiconductor Physics & Devices Basic Principles 4/E(IE), D. A. Neamen,
McGrawHill
2012, ISBN ： 978-0-071-08902-9
D. Teaching Method
1. In English (>85%)/Chinese (<15%)

we start the chapter.

Wafers

中文名稱  Course Title ：兆赫波科技
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Terahertz Science and Technology
任課教師  Instructor ：楊尚樺
上課時間  Time ： M5M6W7 上課教室  Room ：台達 208 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Description:
This course provides graduate students with an overview of the unique properties
of terahertz waves and potential applications as well as the state of the current
terahertz systems and their major technological challenges. The topics covered in
this course include: terahertz sources, terahertz detectors, terahertz electronic
components, sensing with terahertz radiation, and terahertz applications
(biology, medicine, space sciences, pharmaceutical industry, security and
communications).
References:
"Sensing with Terahertz Radiation", Daniel Mittleman, ed. (Springer, 2004)
"Terahertz Spectroscopy: Principles and Applications" (Optical Science and
Engineering Series), Susan L. Dexheimer, ed. (CRC Press, Taylor and Francis
group,
2007)
"Terahertz Sensing Technology: Emerging Scientific Applications & Novel Device
Concepts" (Selected Topics in Electronics and Systems, Vol. 32), Dwight L.
Woolard,
William R. Loerop, Michael Shur (Eds), (World Scientific, 2003)
“Millimeter and Submillimeter Wave Spectroscopy of Solids” (Topics in Applied
Physics) by George Gruner (Editor), (Springer, Topics in Appl. Phys, vol.74,
1998)
“Infrared and millimeter waves" Kenneth J. Button (editor) (New York: Academic
Press,
1979)
Syllabus:
Week 1: Introduction to Terahertz Technology
Week 2: THz Sources (I)
Week 3: THz Sources (II)
Week 4: THz Detectors (I)
Week 5: THz Detectors (II)
Week 6: THz Waveguides
Week 7: THz Modulators
Week 8: Midterm I
Week 9: THz Spectroscopy Systems
Week 10: THz Imaging Systems
Week 11: THz Communication Systems
Week 12: Midterm II
Week 13: THz lab (I)
Week 14: THz lab (II)
Week 15: THz lab (III)
Week 16: THz lab (IV)
Week 17: Oral Presentation
Week 18: Oral Presentation
Evaluation:
1. Participation: 40%
2. Midterm: 20%
3. Oral Presentation: 10%
4. Final Project: 30%

中文名稱  Course Title ：半導體光偵測器與電路
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Semiconductor Photodetectors and Circuits
任課教師  Instructor ：徐永珍  Hsu, Yung-Jane
上課時間  Time ： T7T8R7 上課教室  Room ：台達 209 ／ 53
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程將涵蓋半導體光偵測器⽤到的基本物理 ( 包括 Optoelectronic Processes 以及 Electrical
Processes) 、各種光偵測器的基本結構與運作原理、不同應⽤要求下的光偵測器結構設計和
電路設計 , 並著重光偵測器系統整合考量 . 由於將同時討論到元件與電路 , 對於已經修過基本半
導體物理、固態電⼦元件、以及類比積體電路設計等課程的學⽣⽽⾔較能輕鬆學習 .
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Lecture notes will be delivered.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Papers
2. Pankove, "Optical Processes in Solids"
3. Silvano Donati, "Photodetectors: Devices, Circuits and Applications"
4. Jeong-Woo Park edited,"Photodiodes - World Activities in 2011"
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
課程主題包括 :
Optoelectronic and electrical processes in semiconductors
Applications, detection regimes, and figures of merit
Photodiodes and circuits
Phototransistors and circuits
Avalanche photodiodes and circuits
Avalanche photodiodes in Geiger mode and circuits
CMOS and BiCMOS Photodetectors and circuits
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
以期中與期末報告為主 , 搭配不定期的作業 .

中文名稱  Course Title ：半導體功率元件
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Semiconductor Power Devices
任課教師  Instructor ：黃智⽅
上課時間  Time ： T7T8R7 上課教室  Room ：台達 208 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀,課程說明 (Course Description)
This course aims to provide students with a comprehensive view of modern
semiconductor devices for power electronic applications. After completing this
course, the students will be able to understand the operating physics and
electrical characteristics of power devices, as well as their design
considerations.
⼆,指定⽤書 (Text Books)
1. Class notes
三,參考書籍 (References)
1. B.J. Baliga, Power Semiconductor Devices, PWS Publishing Co., latest edition.
2. Josef Lutz et al., Semiconductor Power Devices, Springer-Verlag, 2011.
3. Mohan, Undeland, and Robbins, Power Electronics: Converters, Applications and
Design, John Wiley and Sons, latest edition.
四,教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
In Chinese.
五,教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Semiconductor fundamentals and transport physics (2 weeks)
2. Breakdown mechanisms and edge terminations (3 weeks)
3. Power rectifier (2 weeks)
4. Power BJT and thyristor (3 weeks)
5. Power MOSFET (3 weeks)
6. Insulated gate bipolar transistor (IGBT) (3 weeks)
7. Other high-power devices (2 week)
六,成績考核 (Evaluation)
To be determined
七,講義位址 (http://)
elearn.nthu.edu.tw

上課時間  Time ： W7W8W9 上課教室  Room ：台達 217 ／ 135
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course will examine in detail the modern Logic non-volalitile memory
including device structure, process, reliability, design, characterization,
qualification, application and IP.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
"Logic Non-Volatile Memory" by Charles Ching-Hsiang Hsu , World Scientific 2014.
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to Logic non-volalitile memory.
2. Review of Semiconductor Physics.
3. Review of Semiconductor Device Physics.
4. OTP Cell, Process Integration and Reliability.
5. OTP Design.
6. OTP ESD and Applications.
7. FLASH Devices and Process Integration.
8. FLASH P Reliability.
9. FLASH Design.
10. EEPROM Devices and Process Integration.
11. EEPROM Design.
12. OTP/FLASH/EEPROM Testing, Characterization and Qualification.
13. NVM IP Foundry.

100200學分  Credit ： 1⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
30
中文名稱  Course Title ：⼯程與系統科學探索
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Exploring ESS
任課教師  Instructor ：歐陽汎怡
陳燦耀
吳順吉
上課時間  Time ： W7W8 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  501 ／ 90
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程背景與⽬標
本課程採⽤「共時授課形式」，邀請系上不同領域教授共同參與，讓⼤⼀新⽣可深入了解⼯科系的多
種
⾯向。參與本課程的學⽣除有機會和系上各領域教授及其實驗室有近距離接觸，也能參觀國內幾個和
本
系密切合作的國家級研究機構。
本課程包含三⼤主題：
（⼀）⼯科系介紹及探索：介紹本系的研究領域及相關議題。各研究領域在全球及台灣的現況與發
展、
並安排各實驗室輪習；
（⼆）新興科技特性與應⽤介紹：介紹近年來流⾏的新興科技的相關特性以及應⽤場域與介紹不同科
技
如何被研發或應⽤在場域中，題材包含 : ⽣物醫學感測，次世代材料、半導體分析技術，醫學物理治
療
技術等；
（三）創新設計發想：介紹設計思考步驟及分組別發想並評估，⿎勵所得發想可參與原科院創意競
賽。
修課⼈數上限： 30 ⼈
參考書⽬：
無。
評量⽅式
1. 實驗室輪習⼼得報告：包含⽉⼼得報告 (A4 ⼀⾴計 3 次 )+ 期末報告 (A4 四⾴會議論文格式，內容涵蓋
整學期輪習⼼得及未來的修課與研究規劃 ) 。（ 60% ）
2. 分組期中提案：提案內容需包含設計理念、初步構想和預期成果，⼝頭報告 10 分鐘，書⾯說明⾄多
A4兩⾴。（ 15% ）
3. 分組期末提案發表：設計成果⼝頭報告與具體執⾏書⾯規劃，成績評比除受課老師評比，也會有各
組內外互評。（ 25% ）
每2週上課⼀次（每次  2 hrs. ）
1. 課程說明與實驗室輪習規劃
2. 設計思考⼯作坊
3. 研究議題分享⼀  授課與系上教授
4. 研究機構參訪⼀
5. 期中提案報告
6. 簡報技巧⼯作坊
7. 研究議題分享⼆  授課與系上教授
8. 研究機構參訪⼆
9. 期末提案發表

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Energy and Environment

上課時間  Time ： W3W4 上課教室  Room ：⼯科 NE69 ／ 240
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
(暫定 )
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
本課程涵蓋不同能源型態的基本原理與應⽤⽅式，同時也將說明不同形式能源的可⽤量與經濟性，
及其對地球環境的影響。本課程區分下列主題：能源基礎概念、⽯化燃料、熱引擎、再⽣能源（太
陽能、氫能、風能、⽔⼒、⽣質能）、核能、節能與潔能、交通運輸之應⽤、空氣污染與溫室效
應。
⼆、教科書  (Text books)
Richard A. Dunlap (Dalhousie University), Sustainable Energy, SI Edition,
CENGAGE
Learning ( 歐亞書局 )
三、參考書籍  (Reference)
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
投影片
群組討論報告
⼾外教學與課堂討論
課程模組 : 網址  http://www.learnenergy.tw/index.php?inter=digital&caid=4
兩次於課堂中播放課程模組的影片，課堂拍照記錄。
遠端教學  ( 視疫情狀況調整 )
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
Chapter 0. Overview on energy engineering and the corresponding impacts on
environment (week 1–2)
Chapter 1. Introduction to Energy Generation, Delivery, and Conversion (week
2–4)
course module 1: week 4
Chapter 2. Energy Sources (week 4 – 5)
Chapter 3. Fossil Fuels: Petroleum, Natural Gas and Coal(week 5–7)
Chapter 4. Environmental Impact of energy use and conversion (week 7–8)
course module 2: week 8
Chapter 5. out door experience and oral presentation on weekly findings (week
9–17)

50
中文名稱  Course Title ：電⼦學⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Electronics II
任課教師  Instructor ：盧志文
上課時間  Time ： F7F8F9 上課教室  Room ：⼯科 NE69 ／ 240
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Having learned the major electronics devices (MOSFET and BJT) and their basic
circuit applications in Electronics-I, more complex analog circuits and systems
will be lectured in this course. Both MOSFET and BJT circuits will be studied and
the emphasis will be put on MOSFET since it is used in most integrated circuit.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Sedra/Smith, "Microelectronic Circuits", Oxfrod, 7th Ed.
三、參考書籍 (References)
Neaman,"Electronic Circuit Analysis And Design,"Irwin.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Power-point handouts
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Integrated-circuit amplifiers
2. Differential and multistage amplifiers
3. Frequency Response
4. Feedback
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
平時測驗 40%, 期中考 30%, 期末考 30%
七、可連結之網⾴位址
http://mx.nthu.edu.tw/~yunhwu/Electronics-2.htm
科號  Course Number ： 11120ESS
226001學分  Credit ： 2⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
40
中文名稱  Course Title ：電⼦學實驗⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Electronics Lab. II
任課教師  Instructor ：巫勇賢
上課時間  Time ： T9TaTbTc 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  304 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Syllabus:
In this course you will learn about the basic principles of circuit design and
operation in a practical, real-world laboratory setting. You will work both
with
discrete components such as resistors, capacitors, diodes, and transistors as
well
as with integrated components such as operational amplifiers and timer 555. In
addition, you will become familiar with the operation of basic electronic test
equipment (digital multi-meters, oscilloscopes, function generators, curve
tracers, etc.). In addition, you will further understand the characteristics
of
transistors through the semiconductor analyzer which is very important for
device
development. There are 12 experiments this semester.
Handout: Download from Web Site
http://greenelectronics.wixsite.com/yung-hsien-wu/
The schedule of this course can be found below.
Preview:
You are strongly encouraged to read ahead of the lectures. After each lecture,
you
should review the corresponding material in the textbook and then read the
next
section or two before the following lecture. This familiarization process will
allow you to digest information from the lectures more easily.
Grading:
The final grade will depend on the items with relative weights shown below:
Labs.... （出席 + 時間獎勵） 30 %
Quiz....................25 %
Final Exam..............20 %
Homework............……..20 %
Evaluation by TA .....…..5 %

Exp-5 High Frequency Response for BJT Amplifier 　
Exp-6 BJT Differential Amplifier 　
Exp-7 Basic Operation of OP741 　
Exp-8 Digital to Analog Converter 　
Exp-9 Analog to Digital Converter 　
Exp-10 Analog Comparator 　
Exp-11 555 Timer IC Application 　
Exp-12 Introduction to Semiconductor Analyzer

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程介紹基礎電磁學理論與應⽤ , 內容包括：傳輸線簡介 , 向量分析 , 靜電場與電位 , 電位分析計算

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Engineering Thermodynamics
任課教師  Instructor ：李敏

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
ESS 2410 ⼯程熱⼒學
Engineering Thermodynamics
The course will be offered in English in regular sessions. The contents of the
lecture will be reviewed in Chinese in an extra hour of lecture each week.
Course Description
This course is the second course of thermodynamics. The pre-required of
this course is “Thermodynamics”. The topics covered in this course are
listed according to the text book chosen. This course is the fundamental
course for the field of Nuclear Power Plant Technology, Energy Engineering
and System, and micro electric machines engineering.
Contents Hours Homework
Overview and Review 4 #1
Chapter 8 Exergy 6 #2
Chapter 9 Gas Power Cycles 8 #3, #4
Chapter 10 Vapor and Combined Power Cycles 8 #5, #6
Mid-term Examination ： April 19th, Wednesday, 7:00pm Room 402
Chapter 11 Refrigeration Cycles 7 #7
Chapter 13 Gas Mixtures 2 #8
Chapter 14 Gas-Vapor Mixture and
Air-Conditioning 6 #9
Chapter 15 Chemical Reaction 8 #10,#11
Final Examination ： June 14th , Wednesday, 7:00pm Room 402
Text： Yunus A. Cengel, Michael A. Boles, Mehmet Kanoglu, "Thermodynamics; an
Engineering Approach," Ninth Edition in SI Unit, McGraw Hill, 2020.
Reference ： Michael J. Moran; Howard N. Sphapiro, "Fundamentals of Engineering
Thermodynamics," Global Edition, John Wiley & Sons Inc., 2017.
Richard E. Sonntag, Claus Borgnakke, and Gordan J.Van Wylen, "Fundamentals of
Engineering Thermodynamics," 6th Edition, John Wiley & Sons Inc., 2002.

Course keywords:

● 課程說明 (Course Description)
Introduce fundamental concepts in materials science. After this course, you
will learn about materials structure, how structure dictates properties, and
how the processing can change the structure.

edition, John Wiley and Sons, 2020.

Edition, Pearson, 1989.
(2) J.F. Shackelford, Introduction to Materials Science for Engineers, 8th
Edition, Pearson, 2014.
(3) W.F. Smith, J. Hashemi, Foundations of Materials Science and Engineering,
5th Edition, McGraw-Hill Education, 2009.
(4) D.R. Askeland, P.P. Fulay, W.J. Wright, The Science and Engineering of
Materials, 6th Edition, Cengage Learning, 2010.
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures with PowerPoint materials highlight important portions of each
chapter.

Chapter 3 Structure of Crystalline Solids
Chapter 4 Imperfections in Solids
Chapter 5 Diffusion

Chapter 8 Failure

科號  Course Number ： 11120ESS
251000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：材料熱⼒學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Thermodynamics of Materials
任課教師  Instructor ：朱鵬維
上課時間  Time ： T5T6F5F6 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  504 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
This course includes three major parts: basic thermodynamics, solution
thermodynamics/binary phase diagrams, and chemical reactions. The first part
includes the three laws of thermodynamics, auxiliary functions, and free
energy calculation. The second part starts from gas behavior, one-component
system, solution behavior, and finally binary phase diagram. The third part
teaches gas-gas reactions and gas-solid reactions. Students will learn the
physical meaning of the three laws of thermodynamics, the calculation of
thermodynamic functions and the applications of thermodynamics in materials
science. This course aims to provide a basis for a variety of subsequent
courses in Materials Science.
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
David R. Gaskell, David E. Laughlin, Introduction to the Thermodynamics of
Materials, 6th edition, Taylor & Francis Group, CRC Press, 2017.
● 參考書籍 (References)
(1) C.H.P. Lupis, Chemical Thermodynamics of Materials, Prentice Hall, 1983.
(2) R.T. DeHoff, Thermodynamics in Materials Science, 2nd edition, Taylor &
Francis Group, CRC Press, 2006.
(3) D.V. Ragone, Thermodynamics of Materials, Wiley, 1995.
(4) C.B.P. Finn, Thermal Physics, 2nd edition, Taylor & Francis Group, CRC
Press, 1993.
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures with digital board writing and PowerPoint materials highlight
important concepts and calculation demonstrations.
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
Introduction & Definition of Terms
The First Law of Thermodynamics
The Second Law of Thermodynamics
Auxiliary Functions
Heat Capacity, Enthalpy, Entropy, and The Third Law of Thermodynamics
The Behavior of Gas
Phase Equilibrium in a One-Component System
The Behavior of Solutions
Construction of Binary Phase Diagram from Gibbs Free Energy Curves
Chemical Reactions of Gases and Gas-Solid System
● 成績考核 (Evaluation)
5% of class activities,
30% of homework,
20% of 1st midterm exam,
25% of 2nd midterm exam,
25% of final exam.

eLearn數位學習平台  https://elearn.nthu.edu.tw/, including syllabus, lecture
notes, homework problems, etc.

304000學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
50
中文名稱  Course Title ：機率與統計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Probability and Statistics
任課教師  Instructor ：蕭百沂
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R3R4 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  501 ／ 90
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This is an introductory course for statistics and probability for
undergraduate students. The purpose of this course is to introduce the methods
to handle the variability of experimental data and explain how to apply them
to real engineering problems. Topics include the basic concepts of
probability, discrete and continuous random variables, probability
distributions, sampling distributions, point estimation of parameters,
interval estimation for a single sample, hypothesis tests for a single sample,
and simple linear regression.
預備知識 : 微積分、⼯數⼀。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Montgomery/Runger, Applied Statistics and Probability for Engineers, 7th ed.,
John Wiley & Sons 2019
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Johnson, Miller & Freund's Probability and Statistics for
Engineers, Pearson (9th Ed.) 2018
2. Hayter, Probability and Statistics for Engineers and Scientists, 4th ed.,
Brooks/Cole 2012.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
板書授課，每周授課 150 分鐘
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Basic concepts of probability
2. Discrete and continuous random variables
3. Probability distributions
4. Sampling distributions
5. Point estimation of parameters
6. Interval estimation for a single sample
7. Hypothesis tests for a single sample
8. Simple linear regression
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
1. Homework 30%
2. Midterm exam 35%
3. Final exam 35%
4. 點名（加分⽤ )
七、可連結之網⾴位址
None

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
宗旨：
分析動態系統在暫態及穩態的反應，學習設計回授控制器以改進系統的反應。
內容：
Ch. 1. An Overview and Brief History of Feedback Control
Ch. 3. Dynamic Response
Ch. 4. A First Analysis of Feedback
Ch. 5. The Root-Locus Design Method
Ch. 6. The Frequency-Response Design Method

上課講解

Chapter 4 A First Analysis of Feedback (9 hrs)

Course Description
This course introduces the fundamental principles of heat transfer. This course
is a required course for the field of nuclear power plant technology, energy
engineering and system, and micro electric machines engineering. The topics covered
in the courses are listed in the following.
Text Book
Frank P. Incropera, David P. Dewitt, Theodore L. Bergman, Adrienne S. Lavine,
"Incropera’s Principles of Heat and Mass Transfer", Global Edition, John Wiley &
Sons,1996
Refernce
Yunus A. Cengel, "Heat Transfer, A Practical Approach," 6th Edition, McGraw-Hill,
2021
Website：

Chapter 2 Introduction to Conduction (3 hours)
Chapter 3 One-Dimensional, Steady-State Heat Conduction (6 hours)
Chapter 4 Two-Dimensional, Steady-State Heat Conduction (5 hours)
Chapter 5 Transient Conduction (6 hours)
23 hours

Chapter 7 External Flow (6 hours)
Chapter 8 Internal Flow (5 hours)
Chapter 9 Free Convection (6 hours)
Chapter 11 Heat Exchanger (5 hours)
27 hours

中文名稱  Course Title ：機器學習導論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Machine Learning
任課教師  Instructor ：吳順吉
上課時間  Time ： T5T6R5R6 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  503 ／ 90
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course introduces basic concepts in machine learning and their associated
mathematical tools. It is aimed at advanced undergraduates, and assumes no
previous knowledge of or machine learning concepts. Knowledge of multivariate
calculus, basic linear algebra some familiarity with probabilities would be
helpful but not essential. Topics to be covered include probability
distributions, supervised learning, Bayesian decision theory, parametric
methods, multivariate methods, dimensionality reduction, clustering,
nonparametric methods, decision trees, linear discrimination, multilayer
perceptrons, and deep learning.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Introduction to Machine Learning, Ethem Alpaydin, 3rd ed. 2014, The MIT Press.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Applied Statistics and Probability for Engineers, Douglas C.
Montgomery, 6th ed. 2014, John Wiley & Sons.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
課堂授課，每周上課  150 分鐘
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
1. Introduction
2. Math Background
3. Supervised Learning
4. Bayesian Decision Theory
5. Parametric Methods
6. Multivariate Methods
7. Dimensionality Reduction
8. Clustering
9. Nonparametric Methods
10. Linear Discrimination
11. Multilayer Perceptron
12. Deep Learning

1. Computer Assignments 40%
2. Personal Project (Oral Presentation + Report) 35%
3. Class Competition (Competition ranking) 25%
No make-up exam!!

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程介紹固態物理的基本知識。固態物理導論⼀的重要課題，通常包含了量⼦⼒學
及統計熱⼒學，⽽電磁⼒是其最主要的作⽤⼒，因此修課學⽣應具備基本物理，及近代物理
之知識。
課程⽬標為把固態物質的特性具體的整理成多個主題，包含：晶體結構、倒晶格結構、能帶理論、⼒
學特性、電學特性、光學特性、磁學特性、熱學特性、聲⼦物理、半導體物理  … 等，做⼀深入等探
討，固態物理是⼀⾨應⽤的學科，學習或建構固態物理，是可以直接⽤來瞭解與解決固態材料
與⼯程的問題。  非常適合： 1. ⼤學部⼤三⼤四  材料科學 , 光電科學 , 電⼦科學 , 半導體科學相關領
域。 2. 碩⼠班未曾修過固態物理的之學⽣
Required background: Modern physics I, Engineering Mathematics

無
