中文名稱  Course Title ：⿊洞天文物理導論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Black Hole Astrophysics
任課教師  Instructor ：楊湘怡
上課時間  Time ： T5T6T7 上課教室  Room ：物  208 ／ 30
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Introduction to Black Hole Astrophysics -- Syllabus
Studying black holes is an important subject in astrophysics, including the newly discovered gravitational
waves, and the evolution of galaxies in the universe. This course aims to provide students who are interested
in astrophysics with fundamental knowledge about black holes. The lectures will cover stellar-mass black
holes and supermassive black holes and their related phenomena, with a balance between theories and
observations. We will start from the black hole properties predicted by Einstein's theory of general relativity,
to major advancements and discoveries in recent years.
Because of the fast development of the field and frequent coverages by scientific media, in the latter 2/3 of
the semester, students are expected to give short oral presentations on a selected black-hole related news.
This allows the students to learn how to research an interested topic, summarize knowledge systematically,
and express in a clear, structured way. In addition, students will write a research proposal as the final team
report, which involves proposing a new idea based on what we learned in class. In the last class, we will also
conduct a proposal review to let the peers to evaluate proposals from other teams. In addition to traditional
lecturing, more interactive teaching such as group activities and discussions will also be incorporated. The
design of this course aims to provide trainings of the soft skills that are useful not only for academia but also
for industry.
The references include:
1. Introduction to Black Hole Astrophysics, Gustavo E. Romero & Gabriela S. Vila, Springer (2014)
2. Introduction to Black Hole Physics, Valeri P. Frolov & Andrei Zelnikov, Oxford (2011)
3. Gravity's Fatal Attraction: Black Holes in the Universe, Mitchell Begelman, Cambridge (2009)
4. Black Holes and Time Warps: Einstein's Outrageous Legacy, Kip S. Thorne, W. W. Norton & Company
(1995)
(The first two books have free online copies)
The grades would be evaluated as follows:
Homework (30%)
Oral presentation (30%)
Final team report (30%)
Class participation (10%)
Tentative schedule:
Week 1: A brief history of black holes (BHs)
Week 2: Einstein’s theory of special relativity
Week 3: Einstein’s theory of general relativity
Week 4: Schwarzschild BHs and Kerr BHs
Week 5: Observational discovery of BHs
Week 6: The birth of stellar mass BHs
Week 7: BH accretion disks
Week 8: Measuring BH masses and spins
Week 9: Supermassive BHs (SMBHs) and Active Galactic Nuclei (AGN)
Week 10: The SMBH at our Galactic center
Week 11: AGN Jets
Week 12: AGN feedback on galaxies
Week 13: SMBHs origin and growth
Week 14: Recent triumphs of GR – the first image of BH
Week 15: Recent triumphs of GR – gravitational waves
Week 16: Other interesting topics: primordial BHs, Hawking radiation, information paradox. Project
evaluation.
Notes:
(1) Lectures will be taught in English. If there are no English-speaking students, teaching in Mandarin can be
considered.
(2) Suggested pre-requisites: General Astronomy I & II

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
“古典⼒學 “ 為 “ 理論⼒學 “ 的延伸課程。適合修過 " 理論⼒學 " 的⼤三（含）以上及研究所同學修習。
主要內容為
a) quick review on Principle of Least Action, Lagrangian and Hamilton formulation.
b) extensive discussion on Canonical Transformation.
c) application of the principle of least action and Lagrangian in classical fields
and special relativity.
d) role of Canonical Transformation in Quantum Mechanics.
e) classical mechanics and Quantum Path Integral.
Course contents:
1. Generalized Coordinates and Lagrange's Equations
2. The Principle of Least Action and Lagrange's Equations
3. Special Relativity and Covariant Lagrangian formulation
4. Hamilton Equations of Motion
5. Canonical Transformation (and its relation to Quantum Theory)
6. Hamilton-Jacobi Theory
7. The Principle of Least Action in Continuous System and Classical Fields
8. Lagrangian (Action) in Quantum Mechanics and Path Integral (Dirac & Feynman)
9. Canonical Transformation in Dirac's Quantum Field Theory

課程說明 (Course Description)
Electrodynamics is a two semester course focussing on advanced topics. We assume that the students are
familiar with the Maxwell equations and some basic concepts like Green’s functions and non-Cartesian
coordinate systems.
Some of the topics covered in this lecture are
1) Electromagnetism as a relativistic gauge theory
2) Electromagnetic waves and propagation
3) Waveguides, cavities and optical fibers
4) Radiations (Bremsstrahlung, Cerenkov radiation, etc.)
5) Optics (Scattering, Diffraction, etc.)

11120PHYS539100學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：超穎材料物理⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Metamaterial Physics II
任課教師  Instructor ：果尚志
上課時間  Time ： F5F6F7 上課教室  Room ：物  504 ／ 36
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
This course is intended not only for a special branch of physics but targeted for general concepts and
methods, and their applications to different area in solid state physics, emerging materials (optical
metamaterials, topological materials, and quantum materials), and photonics. In the past two decades of
teaching various courses in physics, such as general physics, solid state physics, optics/photonics, and
pursuing various frontier research topics, I have found it striking that a large number and variety of subjects
which are actually accessible to the same principles or concepts. For example, wave propagation in periodic
structures and the concept of reciprocal k-space appear on one side problems of solid state physics, like
diffraction of X-rays by crystals, thermal vibrations in crystal lattices, electronic band structures in solids, and
on the other side problems intimately related to optics, namely, propagation of light waves in periodic
structures and filtering properties of such systems, namely, photonic and plasmonic crystals based on
subwavelength dielectric and metallic structures.
More recently, it has also become apparent that mathematical and high energy physics concepts, such as
topology, topological quantum numbers (topological invariants), space-time symmetry (symmetry breaking),
massless Dirac equation, Weyl fermion, and Majorana fermion can play an important role in the modern
development of condensed matter physics and photonic technologies. However, in conventional physics
curriculum, these concepts and methods are scattered in different courses and lack a unified clear picture.
Instead of a pure theoretical presentation of these concepts. I would like to lead the students to the “real-
world” by including the following focuses in the course: (1) Emphasis on the relevance of experiments and
theoretical concepts; (2) Introduction of latest developments, especially in condensed matter physics and
photonics; (3) Grasp of key concepts by the assistance of visual aids (figures and animations) and numerical
simulation packages. In this way, this course will encourage the students to develop their own thinking and
taste and provide them with self-education capabilities since the new developments will come and go, but the
key concepts and ideas can last for a long run.
Semester Grade:
Homeworks (30%), Oral Presentation (30%), Final Report (40%)

科號  Course Number ：
11120PHYS543000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：量⼦技術的原理與應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Principle and application of quantum technology
任課教師  Instructor ：牟中瑜
上課時間  Time ： R6R7R8 上課教室  Room ：物  019 ／ 129
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Syllabus
1. Introduction to quantum phenomena and quantum mechanics
5 quantum effects ：
- interfere and basic quantum mechanics
-Double-slit and related experiments
(Hamiltonian and Schrodinger Equation, Dirac Notation
Operators in Quantum Mechanics, Heisenberg Uncertainty
Wave Particle Duality, Coherence)
- quantization
- tunneling effect
- two-level system and spin (quantum bit and measurement,, Rabi Oscillation,
Ramsey oscillation)
- Many-particle state and entanglement (density matrix and decoherence)
-Quantum measurement and quantum bit
-Quantum decoherence
2. Typical applications of quantum technology
- Quantum algorithm and universal quantum computer
- Quantum communication
- Quantum simulation and method of quantum annealing
- Quantum sensing
3. Technique of quantum qubit
- Construction and manipulation of superconducting transmon qubit
- Construction and manipulation of qubit based on ion trap.
- Construction and manipulation of silicon-based qubit
- Principle, construction and manipulation of topological qubit
- Principle and technique of photon-based qubit
- Other relevant qubit technique such as vacancy-based qubit in diamond.
4. Quantum communication
-Protocols of quantum key distributions and relevant technique for their realizations
- Single photon source, entangled-photon source, and single photon detector
-optical measurement and relevant technique (homodyne and heterodyne detection)
5. Quantum simulators
- Superconducting-qubit based quantum simulator
- Bosonic quantum simulator and Fermionic quantum simulator
- Quantum inspired annealer and simulator
6. System integration and scaling-up approaches
- Long distance quantum key distribution
- Silicon photonics, wafer scale integration of ion trap and quantum network
- Surface code and scaling-up in universal quantum computer
- Integration of relevant peripheral electronic components and cryogenic electronics
Textbooks
1. Introduction to Quantum Technologies, Alto Osada, Rekishu Yamazaki, and Atsushi Noguchi, Springer
2022.
2. eBook: Understanding Quantum Technologies 2021, 4th edition, Oliviar Ezratty
https://www.oezratty.net/wordpress/2021/understanding-quantum-technologies-2021/
References:
Quantum Computation and Quantum Information, Michael Nielsen and Isaac Chuang, Cambridge University
press, 2000.
Grading scheme:
Homework (60%) and final report (40%)

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
本⾨課為英文授課  This course will be given in English
This is a project-based upper division course aimed to provide practical skills to perform research using
AI/Machine learning techniques, including BDT, SVM, and neural networks.
Grading policy (details will be updated):
The grades will mostly be based on weekly assignments ("lab/homework") and a final project. Students will be
working in groups for both the lab sessions and final projects. An oral presentation on the final project in
English is required.
Exact proportion of each grading items will be posted before the start of the Spring semester.

中文名稱  Course Title ：物理專題 -- 基本粒⼦天文學與宇宙論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Special Topic:Astroparticle Physics and Cosmology
任課教師  Instructor ：張維甫
上課時間  Time ： M6M7M8 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 501 ／ 25
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
這⾨課主要討論近代天文物理與宇宙論中之  觀測與發展與
基本粒⼦物理之間的關連
雖然著重在基本粒⼦物理的應⽤  但是我們會花⼀些時間概略介紹基本的背景知識
適合有適當基本粒⼦物理背景或有強烈動機的同學選修
( 建議修過基本粒⼦物理導論  及量⼦⼒學 I-II )
上課⽅式 : ⿊板及投影片
評分 : 作業  及考試
沒有固定的課本  完全以專題為導向
預備討論的主題如下 :
Big Bang Theory
cosmic microwave background
Light elements and bigbang Nucleorsynthesis
Inflation model
cosmological constant
dark matter
dark energy
Baryogenesis and leptogenesis
matter-anti matter asymmetry
Development of structure in the early universe
Cosmic particles
Stellar as lab of particle physics
⼀些有⽤的參考書 :
Introduction to cosmology, by Barbara Ryden
The first three minutes, by S. Weinberg
Particle Astrophysics, by Donald Perkins
The Early Universe, by Edward Kolb and Michael Turner
Modern Cosmology, by Scott Dodelson
Gravitation and Cosmology, by S. Weinberg
Cosmological Physics, by John Peacock
Principles of Physical Cosmology, by Phillip Peebles
Stars as laboratories for fundamental physics, by G. Raffelt

科號  Course Number ：
11120PHYS597003學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：物理專題 -- 近代物理發展史
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Special Topic: History of Modern Physics
任課教師  Instructor ：周定⼀
上課時間  Time ： T7T8T9 上課教室  Room ：物  501 ／ 45
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
The lectures will be in Chinese.
The development of physics theories is usually based on guessing. This course “tries” to explore
the reasoning behind guessing, with the study of original articles. The contents mainly cover
some of the development in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.
Prerequisite: There is no prerequisite, but the understanding of original papers and the lectures
depends on student's background on the physics core courses (CM, EM, SM, QM, SR, GR).
Einstein (1916) ------
“It is not my purpose in this discussion to present the general theory of relativity as a system that
is as simple and logical as possible, and with the minimum number of axioms; but my main object
is to develop this theory in such a way that the reader will feel that the path we have entered upon
is psychologically the natural one, and that the underlying assumptions will seem to have the
highest possible degree of security.”
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
此課程包括近代物理之發展 . 將透過討論重要原始論文 , 瞭解重要物理概念之發展過程 . 內容主要包括
量⼦⼒學
之發展 .
無先修課限制 . 但學⽣的收獲將會與其在物理基礎課 ( 古典⼒學 , 電磁學 , 熱統計⼒學 , 量⼦⼒學 , 相對論 )
的知識
有關 .
Original papers:
1. Pre-Quantum Mechanics: Planck (1900, 1901), Einstein (1905, 1916), Ehrenfest (1916), Bohr
(1917), Ladenburg (1921), Bohr, Krammer & Slater (1924), Krammer (1924), Born (1924), Krammer
& Heisenburg (1925)
2. Matrix Mechanics: Heisenburg (1925), Born & Jordan (1925), Dirac (1925, 1926, 1927), Born,
Jordan & Heisenburg (1925)
3. Wave Mechanics: Hamilton (1828, 1930, 1937), de Broglie (1923, 1924), Schrodinger (1926)
4. Path Integral: Dirac (1933), Feynman (1942)
5. Interpretation of Quantum Mechanics: (a) Probability – Born (1926); (b) Transformation Theory –
Dirac (1927); (c) Uncertainty Principle – Heisenberg (1927); (d) Measurement – Bohr (1929), von
Neumann (1932), Bohm (1951)
6. Spin-Statistics: Bose (1924), Einstein (1924), Pauli (1925), Fermi (1926), Dirac (1926), Pauli
(1936)
7. Relativistic Quantum Mechanics: Dirac (1928)
8. Quantum Field Theory: Dirac (1927)
9. Gauge Theory: Weyl (1918, 1929), Yang (1954)
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
無教科書 .
三、參考書籍 (References)
原始論文 .
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
上課 .
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
無考試 , 期末報告  ( 研讀⼀篇原始論文 , ⼼得報告 )

科號  Course Number ：
11120PHYS645000學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
25
中文名稱  Course Title ：量⼦場論⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Quantum Field Theory(I)
任課教師  Instructor ：朱創新
上課時間  Time ： F5F6F7 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 501 ／ 25
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Introduction to the basics of Quantum Field Theory (QFT), plus advanced topics
such as Chiral Anomaly, QFT in curved spacetime, and Entanglement Entropy in
QFT.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
lecture notes
三、參考書籍 (References)
L. Ryder, Quantum Field Theory, CUP
N.D. Birrel, P.C.W Davies, Quantum Fields in Curved Space, CUP
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Mainly by course lectures. Occasionally, I will also assign some extra
reading materials.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Basic Introduction:
. Lagrangian field theory and symmetries
. Quantum theory of field, particle interpretation.
. Perturbative S-matrix
. Spontaneous symmetry breaking
- Yang-Mills gauge theory
Advanced Topics (selected):
. Chiral Anomaly and anomaly cancellation
. QFT in curved spacetime
. Entanglement entropy in QFT
. Duality in QFT: S-duality in supersymmetric Yang-Mills theory, T-duality in
string theory, holographic duality in large N gauge theory
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Assessment will be based on class assignments and a take home examination.

科號  Course Number ： 11120PME
101701學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
70
中文名稱  Course Title ：機械設計製圖
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Computer Aided Machine Design & Drawing
任課教師  Instructor ：劉俊賢
上課時間  Time ： F3F4Fn 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  434 ／ 55
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
copied from 09620PME 101700
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程的撰寫重點在於：將⼯程實務、圖學理論、⼯具軟體三者結合成為⼀體，以迎接新世代
的電腦輔助設計與繪圖。傳統圖學介紹著重基礎製圖規範與圖學理論之介紹，以及平⾯視圖與立體
視
圖之理論解說及繪製，內容偏重製圖規範及理論傳授；⽽傳統之電腦輔助設計繪圖軟體課程，多以
強
調軟體的操作為主，輔以圖形範例進⾏繪圖之⽰範。然⽽，隨著電腦輔助設計繪圖軟體的⽇趨成
熟，
如何將基礎圖學與電腦輔助設計繪圖軟體進⾏適切的整合，已成為當務之急。因此，本課程特⾊將
朝
以下的⽬標發展：從設計實務的觀點，進⾏圖學理論的介紹，清晰表達圖學的內涵；從軟體應⽤的
觀
點，進⾏設計繪圖的操作，完整發揮軟體的特⾊；並進⼀步加以整合構成電腦輔助設計圖學，並規
劃
實際之計畫範例，進⾏整合的⼯作，期使本課程能夠成為兼具學術及⼯程價值。
課程所採⽤的軟體為 Autodesk Inventor ，是為 3D 參數式設計專家，涵蓋層⾯計有電腦輔
助
繪圖 (CAD) 、電腦輔助設計製圖 (CADD) 、電腦輔助⼯程 (CAE) ，從繪圖、設計、運動分析模擬、動
態
分析模擬、彩現擬真動畫，甚⾄發展到電腦輔助⼯業設計 (CAID) ，期待參與的同學能夠非常開⼼
的
來學習這⾨課程。

1. Autodesk Inventor 學習指引，⼤塚資訊科技， 2006
2. Autodesk Inventor 專業應⽤，⼤塚資訊科技， 2006
3. Autodesk Inventor 進階範例教學，⼤塚資訊科技， 2006
4. 歐特克股份有限公司， Autodesk Inventor 10 特訓教材基礎篇，全華科技圖書公司，
ISBN：
957215236X. 2006/3/14
5. 劉俊賢， AutoCAD 2002/2000 ⼯程圖學實務導航  – 登堂入室篇，宏友圖書開發股份有限公
司，
2002
6. 劉俊賢， AutoCAD 2002/2000 ⼯程圖學實務導航  – 進階應⽤篇，宏友圖書開發股份有限公
司，
2002

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
靜⼒學為⼒學之入⾨課程。本課程以分離物體圖的概念及向量分析法探討剛體靜⼒平衡問題。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
R. C. Hibbeler, Engineering Mechanics- Statics, 15th Edition in SI Units,
Pearson Education Ltd., Essex, England, 2023.
三、參考書籍 (References)
F. P. Beer, E. R. Johnston, Jr. and D. F. Mazurek, Vector Mechanics for
Engineers- Statics, 11th Edition, McGraw-Hill, New York, USA, 2016.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
1. 課堂講授配合⼩考、期中考及期末考以評量教學效果。
2. 另安排助教於演習課協助同學解答問題。
3. 另安排剛體平衡實驗 ( 演習課三堂 ) 、摩擦⼒實驗 ( 演習課三堂 ) 。
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. General Principles
2. Force Vectors
3. Equilibrium of a Particle
4. Force System Resultants
5. Equilibrium of a Rigid Body
6. Structural Analysis
7. Internal Forces
8. Friction
9. Center of Gravity and Centroid
10. Moments of Inertia
11. Virtual Work
實驗名稱 : 剛體平衡實驗 ( 演習課三堂 ) 、摩擦⼒實驗 ( 演習課三堂 )
上課地點 : ⼯程⼀館 321 教室
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
1. 作業及隨堂⼩考  (20%)
2. 期中考 2 次 (20%+20%)
3. 期末考  (30%)
4. 實驗報告 (10%)

⼀,課程說明
The main focus of this course is on the static equilibrium of particles and
rigid bodies in solid mechanics. 。

中文名稱  Course Title ：⼯程數學⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Engineering Mathematics II
任課教師  Instructor ：張敬
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W2 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  215 ／ 63
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
數學為探討各種⾃然與⼯程問題的重要分析⼯具，⼯程數學在微積分的基礎之上，更深入探討各種微
分⽅程式
的應⽤及求解⽅法與技巧，並了解求出其解之特性。透過課堂講授、習題演練及測驗，希望同學能認
識並熟悉
各類⽅程式所描述物理現象與解的性質，為未來修習動機系各項專業課程  ( 材料⼒學、流體⼒學、控
制理論等 )
打下基礎。本課程分為上、下兩學期，下學期講授  vector calculus 、 Fourier analysis 、 partial differential
equations 、 complex analysis 。
Mathematical tools are essential in analysis and prediction for a wide range of engineering problems.
Engineering
Mathematics is a post-calculus course for undergraduate students. It extends the discussion to various types of
differential equations and advanced mathematical topics. Through class lectures, homework assignments and
exams,
you will acquire the skill to solve some but not all the equations with engineering interest, and be ready for
using it in engineering specializations such as fluid mechanics, solid mechanics, control theory etc.
Furthermore, you should have a good grasp of the physical meaning behind the \math, and also be able to
interpret
the solution. This is a two-semester series. In the second semester we will cover vector calculus, Fourier
analysis, partial differential equations, complex analysis.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Book)
Kreyszig, E., "Advanced Engineering Mathematics", abridged version 10th ed., John Wiley (2018)
三、參考書籍  (References)
Zill, D.S., "Advanced Engineering Mathematics", 7th ed., Jones & Bartlett (2022)
O'Neil, P.V., "Advanced Engineering Mathematics", 8th ed., Cengage Learning (2018)
Arfken, G.B., "Mathematical Methods for Physicists", 7th ed., Academic Press (2012)
Riley, K.F., "Mathematical Methods for Physics and Engineering", 3rd ed., Cambridge University Press (2006)
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
課堂講授，包括⽅程式與解的推導演算，搭配其物理意義與實際應⽤例⼦的展⽰及解說。
Lecture. Demonstrate the derivation and solution steps for equations, explain the physics and their engineering
applications.
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
1. Vector calculus
2. Fourier series and integral
3. Fourier transform
4. Partial differential equations
5. Complex analysis

Quizzes 20%
Midterm 30%
Final 30%

中文名稱  Course Title ：機動學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Kinematics of Machinery
任課教師  Instructor ：覺元彙
上課時間  Time ： T2T3T4 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  434 ／ 55
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
The purpose of this course to convey the art of the design process to the
students in order to prepare them to cope with real engineering problems in
practice.
we will explore the topics of kinematics and dynamics of machinery in respect to
the synthesis of mechanisms in order to accomplish desired motions or tasks, and
also the analysis of mechanisms in order to determine their rigid-body dynamic
behavior.
we will first explore the topic of synthesis of mechanisms. Then we will
investigate techniques of analysis of mechanisms. All this will be directed
toward developing your ability to design viable mechanism solutions to real,
unstructured engineering problems by using a design process.
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
KINEMATICS AND DYNAMICS OF MACHINERY
by Norton (2nd edition in SI unites) Published by Mcgraw-Hill
Education, 東華書局  新⽉圖書
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
課堂講授 ; 軟體 ; ⼩組討論
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
Introduction
ADAMS (Section I)
linkage synthesis.
position, velocity, and acceleration analysis
ADAMS (Section II)
cams design.
gear trains.
ADAMS (Section III)
dynamic systems modeling.
balancing of rotating.

暫定  期中考 Mid term/ project (30%) 期末考 Final Exam/ project(30%) 作業
Homework(40%)

中文名稱  Course Title ：微系統概論⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Microsystem Technology (I)

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程為本校⼤學部微系統科技學程的核⼼課程，⽬前由動機系負責。
本課程先對微機電系統作⼀簡單的介紹，隨後將陸續邀請國內產學研各界，微機電相關領域的專
家進⾏專題演講。此外，本課程還會安排參觀新⽵及鄰近地區的幾個微機電相關的業界，包括設
計、製造、及封測等公司；及研究機構，例如國研院台灣半導體研究中⼼、國研院台灣儀科中
⼼、國家同步輻射研究中⼼、國研院國網中⼼、⼯研院等單位。

301101學分  Credit ： 1⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
40
中文名稱  Course Title ：固體⼒學與奈米材料實驗
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Solid Mechanics and Nanomaterials Laboratory
任課教師  Instructor ：⽅維倫
上課時間  Time ： M5M6M7M8 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  320 ／
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
PME 3011 固體⼒學與奈米材料實驗
學分數： 1 授課教師：⽅維倫
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
以實驗⽅法讓同學瞭解機械系統固⼒與材料相關特性 :
From many solid mechanics and materials interesting experiments, you will
find this course a very exciting experience for you to explore and discover.
Just remember to have fun under safety conditions.
⼆、實驗項⽬
(1) 奈米材料拉伸實驗  (Tensile Test of Nanomaterials)
(2) 材料衝擊與硬度實驗  (Impact and Hardness Test)
(3) I型樑應變量測  (Strain Measurement of an I-Beam)
(4) 樑振動模態分析  (Modal Analysis of a Beam)
(5) 扭轉振動  (Torsional Vibration)
(6) 動平衡測試  (Dynamic Balance)
(7) 挫曲實驗 (Bucking Experiment)
(8) 穿透式光彈實驗  (Transmission-Type Photoelastic Experiment)
(9) 超⾳波非破壞性檢測  (Nondestructive Test Using Ultrasonic Transducers)
三、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
實驗教材  will be provided to cover the guidelines and procedures for the
experiments as well as safety procedures.
四、參考書籍 (References)
Solid mechanics related textbooks and references are listed in
Description of each experiment.
五、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
1. 上課⽅式 :
每⼈在做實驗前先繳預習報告 (A4 紙 ) ⼄份，內容包括 (1) 封⾯、 (2) 實驗⽬的、 (3) 實驗原理、
(4)
實驗設備、 (5) 量測項⽬清單、及 (6) 預期結果。
Pre-Lab Report
(1) Cover, (2) Purpose of Experiment, (3) Principle, (4) Equipment, (5)
Table of Items to be Measured, (6) Expected Results
每⼈在實驗完畢後⼀週，於上課時繳實驗報告 (A4 紙 ) ⼄份，內容包括 (1) 封⾯、 (2) 摘要、 (3)
實
驗⽬的、 (4) 實驗原理、 (5) 實驗設備、 (6) 實驗結果與討論、 (7) 結論、 (8) 參考資料 ( 所有
非⾃⾏繪製圖表需列出資料來源 ) 、及 (9) 附錄 ( 計算過程、不準度分析及其他 ) 。
Lab Report
(1) Cover, (2) Abstract, (3) Purpose of Experiment, (4) Principle, (5)
Equipment, (6) Results and Discussion, (7) Conclusions, (8)References,
(9)Appendix(Results Calculation, Uncertainty Analysis, et al.)

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
PME 3011 固體⼒學與奈米材料實驗

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
以實驗⽅法讓同學瞭解機械系統固⼒與材料相關特性 :
From many solid mechanics and materials interesting experiments, you will
find this course a very exciting experience for you to explore and discover.
Just remember to have fun under safety conditions.
⼆、實驗項⽬
(1) 奈米材料拉伸實驗  (Tensile Test of Nanomaterials)
(2) 材料衝擊與硬度實驗  (Impact and Hardness Test)
(3) I型樑應變量測  (Strain Measurement of an I-Beam)
(4) 樑振動模態分析  (Modal Analysis of a Beam)
(5) 扭轉振動  (Torsional Vibration)
(6) 動平衡測試  (Dynamic Balance)
(7) 挫曲實驗 (Bucking Experiment)
(8) 穿透式光彈實驗  (Transmission-Type Photoelastic Experiment)
(9) 超⾳波非破壞性檢測  (Nondestructive Test Using Ultrasonic Transducers)
三、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
實驗教材  will be provided to cover the guidelines and procedures for the
experiments as well as safety procedures.
四、參考書籍 (References)
Solid mechanics related textbooks and references are listed in
Description of each experiment.
五、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
1. 上課⽅式 :
每⼈在做實驗前先繳預習報告 (A4 紙 ) ⼄份，內容包括 (1) 封⾯、 (2) 實驗⽬的、 (3) 實驗原理、
(4)
實驗設備、 (5) 量測項⽬清單、及 (6) 預期結果。
Pre-Lab Report
(1) Cover, (2) Purpose of Experiment, (3) Principle, (4) Equipment, (5)
Table of Items to be Measured, (6) Expected Results
每⼈在實驗完畢後⼀週，於上課時繳實驗報告 (A4 紙 ) ⼄份，內容包括 (1) 封⾯、 (2) 摘要、 (3)
實
驗⽬的、 (4) 實驗原理、 (5) 實驗設備、 (6) 實驗結果與討論、 (7) 結論、 (8) 參考資料 ( 所有
非⾃⾏繪製圖表需列出資料來源 ) 、及 (9) 附錄 ( 計算過程、不準度分析及其他 ) 。
Lab Report
(1) Cover, (2) Abstract, (3) Purpose of Experiment, (4) Principle, (5)
Equipment, (6) Results and Discussion, (7) Conclusions, (8)References,
(9)Appendix(Results Calculation, Uncertainty Analysis, et al.)

中文名稱  Course Title ：熱傳與質傳學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Heat and Mass Transfer
任課教師  Instructor ：王訓忠
上課時間  Time ： W5W6W7 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  217 ／ 63
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course introduces the physical processes, mathematical analyses, and
relevant applications of the three branches of heat transfer, namely, heat
conduction, heat convection and heat radiation. The convective mass transfer
process is also discussed in parallel to heat convection.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Incropera, F. P., Dewitt,D. P., Bergmann, T.L., and Lavine, A.S.,
Fundamentals
of Heat and Mass Transfer, (7th ed., 2013)
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
課堂講授
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Chapter 1 Introduction
PART I
Chapter 2 Introduction to Conduction
Chapter 3 One-Dimensional, Steady-State Conduction
Chapter 4 Two-Dimensional, Steady-State Conduction
Chapter 5 Transient Conduction
Midterm Exam
PART II
Chapter 6 Introduction to Heat and Mass Convection
Chapter 7 External Flow
Chapter 8 Internal Flow
Chapter 9 Free Convection
PART III
Chapter 12 Radiation: Processes and Properties
Final Exam

中文名稱  Course Title ：控制系統⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Control System II
任課教師  Instructor ：葉廷仁
上課時間  Time ： T7T8W6 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  101 ／ 80
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is a continuation of control systems (I). It particularly
provides
the students with basic knowledge in state-space design, digital control and
nonlinear systems. As for the state-space design, it begins with reviewing
linear-algebra fundamentals and introducing state-space description of
linear systems. Students will then learn how to design the full-state feedback,
the estimator and the dynamic compensator of the control system. In digital
control, z-transform will be introduced first and controller design using
digital equivalents will then be covered. Finally, we will introduce some
basic analysis and design tools for nonlinear control systems.
Pre-requisite: Engineering Mathematics ( ⼯程數
學), Control Systems (I)( 控制系統 ㄧ )
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Gene F. Franklin, J. David Powell, and Abbas Emami-Naeini, Feedback Control
of Dynamic Systems, 7th Edition, Prentice Hall, 2015.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Farid Golnaraghi, and Benjamin C. Kuo, "Automatic Control Systems", 9th
edition, John Wiley & Sons, Inc., 2009.
2. Norman S. Nise, "Control Systems Engineering", 6th edition, John Wiley &
Sons, Inc., 2010.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
課堂投影片 , ⿊板講解與演習
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Mathematical Foundation of Linear Algebra
2. State-space Description of Linear Systems
3. Full-state Feedback and Estimator Design
4. Compensator Design
5. Z-transform
6. Design Using Discrete Equivalents and Discrete Design
7. Linearization
8. Analysis of Nonlinear Systems
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Homework assignments (30%), Midterms(30%), Final exam(30%), Lab
Assignments(10%)
七、可連結之網⾴位址
http://elearn.nthu.edu.tw

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Instructor: Liu, Cheng-Hsien liuch@pme.nthu.edu.tw
Office: Room 517, Engineering Building #1
Phone: (03) 5742496
Lectures: Time: Thursday 9:00am-12:00
Course objectives
The Goal of the course is to provide Undergraduate students with basic concepts,
principles, novel design of Microsystem LabChips for the applications of
biomedicine/microfluidics/precise medicine as well as Lab chip microfabrication
techniques. This course also aims at encouraging students to read state-of-the-
art technology papers and present their thinking professionally to build up
global view and capability.

PME343602 光機電系統設計
(Opto-Mechatronic Systems Design)
光機電系統設計 Opto-Mechatronic Systems Design
PME 343602
每 週三  10:10-12:50 (W3W4Wn)
⼯⼀館  TBD 室

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The process of engineering system design, especially involving optical,
mechanical and electrical/electronics sub-systems, is introduced through case
studies and design projects. The objective of this course is for students:
1. To learn about the process of designing a system with multi-disciplinary
subsystems.
2. To learn about designing creative engineering product/solution.
3. To learn about design as a group activity.
Notes: 請注意 :
1. This course requires students to conceptualize, study, design, and make a
model or prototype product in a team within 16 weeks. Students should prepare
to devote at least 12 hours per week, in addition to regular class hours, on the
average, in order to have best learning results. Students who cannot spend 12
hours per week on this course should consider taking it in a different semester.
2. To support the NTHU globalization effort and to offer students an opportunity
of experiencing technical and commercial discussions in English, course 343602
(W3W4F4) will be offered in English. (Major lectures will be delivered in
English. Students are encouraged to use English, but may also use Chinese, in
presentations, discussions and reports.)
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
1. D. G. Ullman, "The mechanical design process", 4th ed. McGraw Hill 2010
TJ230.U54 2010 [NTHU lib. has an electronic version.]
2. Clarence W. de Silva, "Mechatronics: An Integrated Approach" CRC Press 2004
3. "光機電系統整合概論 " 國家實驗研究院儀器科技研究中⼼出版 , 2005
三、參考書籍 (References)
i. “CAD/CAM” Chapter 16, By Zeid, McGraw Hill
ii. “Mechanical Engineering Design” By Shigley. McGraw Hill
(NTHU Lib. TJ230.sh61 2004)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Doing a design project, discussions, case studies, lectures and
textbooks reading.
參加期末學⽣設計專題發表與競賽
五、教學內容⼤綱  (Course Outline)
Introduction: Design Process
Product Discovery (Finding a problem or opportunity, i.e., the need)
Example case studies
Technical Crash Lessons
Project Planning (The plan of work to be taken in the selected application area)
Product Definition (Clarifying the need)
Conceptual Design (Study and preliminary design of possible solutions)
Product Development (Design of the best solution)
Design Project:
計畫題⽬： Your own title
[featuring 創新光機電系統  ( 最少要有光、機、電中之兩個在系統內 )]
思考主軸 : 如何創新設計出⼀個有商業潛⼒的產品 ?
(Week 1-5) Problem/Opportunity Identification (Report 1)
(Week 1-9) Project plan (complete work plan) (Report 2)
Prior arts study
Conceptual designs
Preliminary feasibility analysis
Project objectives
Project Plan: Tasks, Schedule
(Week 10-14) Interim report (Report 3)
Conceptual design evaluation
Feasibility study: critical issues
Critical parameters
(Week 14-17) Final report (Report 4)
Detailed design (dimensions, materials …)
Parts/components
Manufacturing, assembly considerations
Cost considerations
Analysis, experiments and model supporting evaluation
Layout drawing
Detail drawings of manufactured parts
Parts list
(Reports include oral presentations and paper reports. Oral reports will be
held during classes.)
(Additional oral reports/discussions during each report execution stage may be
held in order to help the design progress and will be part of the design process
training.)
(Detailed report content requirements to be announced later.)

量結果，以等第制評分。
⼜所有學⽣必須參加期末學⽣設計專題發表與競賽。

400700學分  Credit ： 2⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
30
中文名稱  Course Title ：機器⼈製作與競賽實務專題
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Design and Manufacture for Robot Competition Project
任課教師  Instructor ：陳榮順
上課時間  Time ： WaWbWc 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  201 ／ 63
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
參考書籍 :
Probabilistic Robotics, by S. Thrun, W. Burgard, and D. Fox, The MIT Press (2006 ).
Robotics: Modelling, Planning and Control, by B. Siciliano, L. Sciavicco, L.
Villani, and L. Oriolo, Springer, (2008).
教學⽅式 :
第⼀週及第⼆週由助教講解及介紹各系統設計流程，之後各組訂定每周討論時間，並在每個⽉進⾏報
告，由任課老師與助教共同評分。
教學進度 :
本課程進度共分四階段
1. 第⼀階段 : 讓學⽣了解「⾃動化輪型機器⼈」系統架構，涵蓋硬體、軟體、韌體，了解各部分設計流
程、相關基礎知識及⾃動化機器⼈系統架構基礎。
2. 第⼆階段 : 分組後
I. 硬體組 : 底盤機構、⼿臂機構、
II. 韌體組 : 控制底盤、⼿臂
III. 軟體組 : 定位系統、導航系統、視覺辨識
IV: ⾏銷與公關組 : 擬定短、中、⻑期⾏銷、公關、財務管理策略。
各組針對負責之系統進⾏更深入的了解，由助教進⾏引導教學。
3. 第三階段 : 實作第⼆階段所學內容。結合動機系控制系統、機械製圖等課程，進⾏ prototype 設計，
後製作出最終成品。
4. 第四階段 : 由助教協助引導，帶領各組整合系統，並完成⼀⾃動化輪型機器⼈，最後進⾏實機展⽰。
⾏銷與公關組施⾏後檢討報告。
成績考核 :
助教講解課 : 上課出席及參與討論情形  5%
期中報告  1: 期中報告內容將呈現各組研究及分析進度，並由任課教師及助教評分  20%
期中報告  2: 期中報告內容將呈現各組研究及分析進度，並由任課教師及助教評分  20%
期中報告  3: 期中報告內容將呈現各組研究及分析進度，並由任課教師及助教評分  20%
期末報告 : 期末報告將呈現各組設計之結果以及各系統統合後的成果，並由任課老師及助教評分  35%

課程⼤綱： PME 4209 微算機導論  
本課程將介紹微算機架構與作業程序 , 並經由此架構深入瞭解微算機功能 ,
將以⽬前熱⾨的 ARM 核⼼之嵌入式系統為主 , 來探討演練其程式設計與操控⽅式 ,
並瞭解嵌入式系統未來在居家照護之⽣醫電⼦感測系統、⾼階儀器控制、智慧型⼿機上之應⽤潛
⼒。
上課課程內容 :
1. Introduction to Microprocessors and embedded Systems
2. The ARM Architecture
3. ARM Instruction Set Architecture
4. Java Programming
5. Operating Systems
6. Input-Output Interface
7. ARM-based embedded Platforms and Case Study
使⽤作業系統 : Android OS
上課程式語⾔ : Java

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
此⾨課從開學第⼀周的課程開始，即為  " 線上同步遠距教學 " ，

磁性元件概論  (Introduction to magnetic devices)
Outline:
1. Basic Magnetostatics
2. Magnetism: From macroscopic to microscopic scales
3. Domain and domain walls
4. Magnetization process and hysteresis loops
5. Various types of magnetic materials
6. Observation of domains, domain walls, and hysteresis loops
7. Magnetic sensors and magnetic actuators
8. Spintronics
Reference:
1. Magnetism and Magnetic Materials by J. M. D. Coey, Cambridge University
Press (2010).
2. Introduction to Electrodynamics, David J. Griffiths, 4th Edition, Pearson
(2013).
3. Magnetic actuators and sensors, John R. Brauer, 2nd Edition, Wiley-IEEE
Press (2014)
4. Related journals

First oral report 35%
Second oral report 35%
Attendance and participation 30%

This course aims at the Cyber-Physical Systems and applications for intelligent
manufacturing system. In this course, we will introduce the automation for the
manufacturing systems, sensors and Industrial visualization. The course content
includes digital twin concept, Industrial IOT technology and AR technology.

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
NATIONAL TSING HUA UNIVERSITY
DEPARTMENT OF POWER MECHANICAL ENGINEERING
2022 Spring Semester (202302-202306)
Course No.: 11120PME 510400
Course title: Engineering Quantum Mechanics ( ⼯程量⼦⼒學 )
Credits: 3 (T6T7T8 at R217)
Students: For undergraduates and postgraduates who have taken Engineering
Mathematics (I+II) and intend to further learn the fundamental
theory of quantum technology & quantum computers.
Teacher: Prof. Che-Wun Hong ( 洪哲文  教授 )
Contents:
Chapter 1 From Classical Mechanics to Quantum Mechanics
Chapter 2 The Time-independent Schrödinger’s Equation
Chapter 3 The Time-dependent Schrödinger Equation
Chapter 4 Functions and Operators
Chapter 5 Operators and Quantum Mechanics
Chapter 6 Approximation Methods in Quantum Mechanics
Chapter 7 Time-dependent Perturbation Theory
Chapter 8 Quantum Mechanics in Solid States
Chapter 9+10 Angular Momentum+ Hydrogen Atom
Chapter12 Spin*
Chapter14 Many-electron Systems and Density Functional Theory
Chapter18 Quantum Mechanics Applications (Green Energy Technologies, Cryptography,
Teleportation, Quantum Computers……..)
References:
[1] Text Book: “Quantum Mechanics for Scientists and Engineers”, David
A. B. Miller (Stanford University Engineering College Textbook), Cambridge
University Press, New York, 2009
[2] “Quantum Computing for Everyone”, C. Bernhardt, MIT Press, 2019
[3] “Modern Physics”, 3rd Ed., R.A. Serway, C.J. Moses, C.A. Moyer,
Thomson, 2005
Grades:
Exercises (40%),
Reports (20%),
Final Exam (40%)

512200學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：熱對流
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Heat Convection
任課教師  Instructor ：劉通敏
上課時間  Time ： R4R5R6 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  217 ／ 63
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
PME 512200 熱對流  (2023 Spring)
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
詳細推導均勻混和物與物種質量保守⽅程、動量保守及能量保守統治⽅程式；介紹速度、溫
度及濃度邊界層觀念；認識熱對流的基本原理、數學模式及分析求解⽅法：包括相似變數解
法、積分解法及尺度分析解法。本課程分層流熱傳與紊流熱傳兩部份。

中文名稱  Course Title ：兩相流
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Two-Phase Flow
任課教師  Instructor ：李明蒼
上課時間  Time ： M5M6M7 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  214 ／ 63
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course description:
This course focuses on heat and fluid transport phenomena associated with
phase change processes. Topics include thermodynamics of phase change,
evaporation, condensation, nucleation and bubble growth, two phase flow,
convective boiling and condensation, melting and solidification.
References:
1. Van P. Carey, Liquid-Vapor Phase Change Phenomena, CRC Press
2. Frank P. Incropera et al., Incropera's Principles of Heat and Mass
Transfer, Wiley
3. A. F. Mills, Mass Transfer, Prentice Hall
4. M. Necati Özisik, Heat Conduction, Wiley
Syllabus:
1. Course outline and introduction to phase change phenomena
2. Interfacial tension
3. Wetting phenomena
4. Transport on interface
5. Homogeneous nucleation
6. Heterogeneous nucleation
7. Pool boiling
8. Maximum and minimum heat flux conditions
9. Film boiling
10.Condensation
11. Two phase flow modeling
12. Internal convective condensation
13. Convective boiling
14. Coupled heat and mass transfer with liquid-vapor phase change
15. Liquid-vapor heat transfer for engineering applications
16. Melting and solidification
Evaluation:
Grading will be based on: Class participation, HW assignment, Midterm exams,
Final
project

中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣醫微系統
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Biomedical Microsystem
任課教師  Instructor ：洪健中
上課時間  Time ： F2F3F4 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  211 ／ 24
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The course is designed to introduce students to the fundamentals of BioMEMS and
lab-on-a-chip (LOC). Basic concepts of micro/nano fabrication of BioMEMS,
microfluidic devices, on-chip biochemical detection techniques, and integration
of lab-on-a-chip will be introduced and discussed. Various BioMEMS devices, lab-
on-a-chip, uTAS and their applications will be covered. Students will gain a
broad perspective in the area of micro/nano systems for biomedical and chemical
applications.

technologies for genomics, drug discovery, bioanalysis, and clinical diagnostics,
Marcel Dekker, 2002

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course provides an overview of robot mechanisms, dynamics, and
intelligent controls. Topics include planar and spatial kinematics, multi-
rigid-body dynamics, motion planning, control design, actuators, and sensors,
and so on. Laboratory assignments provide experience with servo drives,
sensors, interface circuitry, microprocessor-based real-time control,and Robot
Operating System (ROS) programming. Students will design and fabricate working
robotic systems in a group-based
term project.

542900學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
45
中文名稱  Course Title ：積層製造學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Additive Manufacturing
任課教師  Instructor ：覺元彙
上課時間  Time ： M6M7M8 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  215 ／ 63
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
積層製造學課程的主要⽬的在於使學⽣由淺入深學習積層製造 (3D 列印 ) 技術。本課程⼤綱⼤致可
分成三個部分 : 第⼀部分⾸先涵蓋積層製造的基礎原理，介紹主流 3D 列印機構設計、 CAD/CAM
幾何資料處理，以及國際產業發展之概況。第⼆部分，以可列印之材料種類 ( ⾦屬，陶瓷，⾼分
⼦)進⾏主題分類，進⼀步探討積層製造背後之物理 ( 熱⼒學、流體⼒學 ) 以及材料 ( 晶相、殘留應
⼒)等科學意義，引導學⽣活⽤並整合所學科⽬，認識積層製造技術優勢以及缺陷，以及對應之
品質管控技術。本課程亦著重探討先進積層製造技術，包含多材料積層製造、⾼速列印技術以及列印
多
功能材料 (4D 列印 ) ，課程最後討論積層製造之安全操作以及注意事項，提供未來有意進入業界之同學
參
考。
This course module aims to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of
additive manufacturing (3D printing). There are three sections in this course
module, starting from a general introduction, printing mechanism, CAD/CAM system,
reverse engineering, and the concept of DfAM (Design of Additive manufacturing).
based on that, the AM process's underlying physics and material science are
focused on in section two. Furthermore, state-of-the-art additive manufacturing
technology such as multiple materials additive manufacturing and rapid additive
manufacturing are also introduced. In addition, an AM process's safety and
operative procedure is included to give students a gaudiness of
designing/operating an AM system.

A. Course Description
objectives of this course are for students:
1. To obtain an introductory understanding about the state of arts in selected
topics related to modern manufacturing processes and equipment, especially those
involving extensive use of computer control and software.
2. To learn about some basic physical and engineering principles and issues in
these processes and equipment.
3. To learn to use a basic CAD/CAM software tool (SolidWorks); and use the tool
to make a design of a product part, a design of a mold for making the product
part, and to make the part using a virtual and a physical machine tool (with
permission of resources).
4. To practice searching, reading, and reporting about industrial/product
information and academic research papers about these processes and equipment.
Possible topics to be studied will be selected from within the following areas:
1. 3D printing processes and machines
2. 5-axis CNC machine tools
3. Measurements and sensors for precision manufacturing machines
4. Manufacturing and equipment in fields such as semiconductor, electronics and
optics
B. Textbooks and References
References
1. CAD/CAM Theory and Practice, by Igrahim Zeid, NY: McGrawhill, 1991
2. SolidWorks 零件與組合件培訓教材 , Dassault Systems SolidWorks Corp., 2018
To be updated
C. Teaching Method
1. Instructor lectures
2. Students software learning classes
3. Students design and make projects
4. Students literature search, study and reports
5. Students oral presentations in English
D. Evaluation
To be determined.
E. Course online link
To be announced.

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
This course aims at the fundamental technologies and applications for
manufacturing system automation. In this course, we will introduce the concepts
about manufacturing systems and automation, control systems, sensors, actuators,
workpiece handling systems & Industrial visualization. The course content
includes Manipulator operation, Multiaxis machining operation, Grafana
implementation, SIEMENS Shopturn Interface operation, using Hexagon Metrology for
taking measurements, writing codes by using Node-red. However, some automation
topics (e.g., Python, matlab, CAD/CAM, CNC machining & Mastercam) will be dropped
out from this course since they will be(have been) taught in other ones. In this
course, we will carry out many practical operations and teach more in-depth
mechanical intelligence content.

中文名稱  Course Title ：製程診斷與分析
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Process Diagnosis and Analysis
任課教師  Instructor ：林⼠傑  Shih-Chieh Lin
上課時間  Time ： W2W3W4 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  213 ／ 63
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
在現實的⼯作環境中 , 我們會發現以往在書本上所學得的理論 , 公式所計算出來的結果與實際發
⽣的永遠有⼤⼩不⼀的差距 , 這些差異經常源⾃於難以預測的變異 . 變異經常影響實際的結果並
造成困擾 , ⽽本課程的⽬的便是介紹⼀些⽤於偵測變異發⽣的⽅法 , 及消除變異的⽅法 . 由於這
些⽅法往往需藉由實驗來驗證 , 因此如何設計規劃分析實驗也是本課的重點
本課程適合⼤三以上學⽣修習 , 研究⽣未曾修習品質管制及統計課程者 , 應修習本課 . 您在未來
的⼯作時 , 必會發現這⾨課會是非常實⽤的課程 .
In reality, we will find that the results estimated or calculated based on
the
equation or theory introduced in text books are somehow different from those
measured experimentally. Frequently the difference is because of the
unpredictable variance. The goal of this course is to introduce approaches
to
identify unpredicted process variance and methodologies to eliminate these
variances. Frequently, these approaches or methodologies had to be verified
experimentally. Therefore, how to design and analyze experimental results is
the other major issue in this study.
This course is recommended for junior, senior and graduate student who did not
have much knowledge about statistics and quality control. You will find that
this is a very useful course when you start your career.
上課課程內容 (course content):
A. Fundamental Concepts and Methods
Evolution of quality design and control
Conceptual framework for quality
Statistical methods and probability concept for data characterization
B. Process Control and Improvement
Conceptual framework for statistical process control
Construction and interpretation of Shewhart control chart
Importance of rational sampling
Process capability assessment
C. product Design and Improvement
Conceptual framework for planned experimentation
Design, interpretation and analysis of two-level factorial design
Two level fractional factorial design
Model building for design and improvement
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Statistical quality design and control :/contemporary concepts and methods,
Richard E. DeVor, Tsong-how Chang, John W. Sutherland, New York :Maxwell
Macmillan International,/c1992./
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Statistical Principles of Research Design and Analysis, Robert O. Kuehl,
Duxbury Press
2. Design and Analysis of Experiments, Montgomery,
3. ⽥⼝式品質⼯程導論 , 鐘清章校訂 , 品質管制學會
4. Experimental methods for Engineers, Holman, Mc Graw Hill

授課 ,討論
Lectures and discussion

科號  Course Number ： 11120PME
635000學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
65
中文名稱  Course Title ：有限單元法之應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Applications of Finite Element Method
任課教師  Instructor ：李銘孝
上課時間  Time ： TaTbTc 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  434 ／ 55
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
計算模擬乃解決前瞻⼯程與科學問題非常經濟、有效的⽅法，有限單元法更是最被廣泛使⽤的數
值⽅法，向為國際學術界及⼯程界的研究重點，相關的軟體功能也⽇益完備，已成為⼯程與科學
領域不可或缺的⼯具。同學除了基礎的理論以外，如何正確有效應⽤有限單元法相關軟體，了解
計算模擬重點，都是成為⾼階研發⼈才的必要學習。本課程將延續本系有限單元 (PME534300)
課程未能觸及之領域，包括動態、非線性及接觸等較複雜問題。除了理論介紹外，並將藉由實際
套裝軟體分析操作說明，讓同學了解許多⼯程分析模擬細節，以提昇分析模擬能⼒。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
講員講義
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Cook, R. D., "Concepts and Application of Finite Element Analysis",
3rd edition, John Willey & Sons, Inc.(1989).
2. Bathe, K. J., "Finite Element Procedures", Prentice-Hill Inc.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
就各項主題進⾏理論介紹、套裝軟體操作及實際案例模擬細節解說，並讓同學進⾏各類例題操作練習
外，將就各項重點適時深入討論
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Application of FEM in dynamic analysis
(介紹動態分析之概念，以及如何使⽤套裝軟體 ANSYS 及 LS-DYNA 進⾏動態分析模擬 )
(1) FEM analysis procedures
(2) Introduction to ANSYS for dynamic analysis
(3) Modal analysis
(4) Harmonic analysis: frequency response
(5) Transient dynamic analysis(implicit method)
(6) Case study: motorcycle simulation ( 實際案例 : 機⾞動態分析案 )
(7) Introduction to explicit method
(8) Introduction to LS-DYNA for dynamic analysis
(9) Case study: car crash simulation ( 實際案例 : 汽⾞碰撞分析案 )
2. Application of FEM in nonlinear structural analysis
(介紹非線性分析之概念，以及如何使⽤套裝軟體 ANSYS 進⾏分析模擬 )
(1) Nonlinearities Overview : Introduction to nonlinear solution options
(2) Large deformation analysis
(3) Material-plasticity nonlinear analysis
(4) Contact analysis

科號  Course Number ： 11120PME
635100學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：非線性有限單元法
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Nonlinear Finite Element Method
任課教師  Instructor ：黃琮暉
上課時間  Time ： TnT5T6 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  212 ／ 24
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Description:
To introduce advanced finite element methods (FEMs) for linear and nonlinear
solid, mechanics, multi-field variational principles, total Lagrangian and
updated Lagrangian formulations, nonlinear material models and numerical
procedures for path independent (hyperelasticity) and path dependent (plasticity)
problems. Topics like fluid flow problem and meshfree methods may also be
included depending on the overall progress of the lecture.
Prerequisites:
Finite Elements Methods
Grading:
Homework 40%; Computer Assignment 40%; Final Project 20%
Lecture Material:
In-class notes, and lecture handouts will be given. There is no required textbook
for this course. However, textbooks in the reference are recommended. The FEniCS
with Google colab will be used as the simulation platform.
Reference:
T. J. R. Hughes, The Finite Element Method: Linear Static and Dynamic Finite
Element Analysis, Dover, 2000.
Belytschko, T., Liu, W. K., and Moran, B., and Khalil Elkhodary, "Nonlinear
Finite Elements for Continua and Structures”, 2nd Edition, John Wiley & Sons,
2014.
Finite Element in Computer Science (FEniCS): https://fenicsproject.org/
Course Outline:
0. Fundamental Knowledge
Strong form and Weak Form
Galerkin Equation
Basics of Finite Element Formulation
Introduction to FEniCS, Google colab and Paraview
1. Constrained Problems
Numerical Difficulties in Nearly Incompressible and Incompressible Elasticity
Volumetric Locking and Remedies
Reduced Integration with Hourglass Stabilization, Selective Reduced Integration
Reissner-Mindlin Plates and Shear Locking
Shear Locking and Remedies
2. Multi-Field Variational Principles
Hu-Washizu Variational Principle
Hellinger-Reissner Variational principle
Complementary Energy Principle
Hybrid Stress Formulation
Mixed (up) formulation for Incompressible Problems
3. Large Deformation Problems in Solid Mechanics
Nonlinear solver: Newton Raphson methods
Total and updated Lagrangian formulation
History independent materials: hyperelasticity
History dependent materials: plasticity
Linearized buckling problems (Depending on progress)
Contact problems (Depending on progress)
4. Finite Element Methods for Fluid Problems (Optional Topics)
Advection-diffusion (AD) problem and its numerical difficulties
Petrov-Galerkin formulation for AD problems
Navier-Stokes equations
Streamline upwind Petrov–Galerkin (SUPG) formulation
Variational Multiscale Stabilization (VMS) formulation
Aribitrary Lagrangian Eulerian method (ALE) for Fluid-Structure Interaction
problem
5. Meshfree methods (Optional Topics)
Moving Least-Squares Approximation
Reproducing Kernel Approximation
Galerkin Meshfree Methods for Solving PDEs

財
務報表制定決策與分析。

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
電腦⽇益發達，隨著 AI 時代來臨很多複雜⾦融計算皆有程式可處理，但使⽤者須具備嚴謹邏輯及數學
基礎才能在
混亂的資訊中找到重點，做出合邏輯之判斷與決策。本課程以傳統⾼等微積分內容為主佐以最新之實
例來培養學
⽣嚴謹之數學素養。

四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)

演習課 : 習題演算及討論，平時考。

五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
This is a fundamental course of analysis, a rigorous version of calculus.
The contents for this semester include
1. Logic and set theory
2. The Real Number System
3. Sequences in R
4. Continuity on R
5. Differentiability on R
6 Integrability on R
7. Infinite Series of Real Numbers
8. Infinite Series of Functions

<加簽原則 >
加簽的名額是以教室容量為上限。
如果希望加簽的⼈數超過，就會請同學做線上加簽申請，
請務必在申請單上說明加簽理由，
我們依修課急迫性排順位進⾏加簽。
(請附證明 : 另⼀⾨衍訂課衝堂或應屆畢業必修 ... 等 )
加簽會統⼀於開學後處理。

教學⼤綱

式，在學期間教
學⼤綱不會有所更動，以維護課堂的公平性以及所有⼈的權益。確定選修後，即表⽰接受教學⼤綱的
所有規定，不得
於事後要求例外。

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程將介紹國內外投資環境、可使⽤的投資⼯具，以及重要的投資理論。
本課程為搭配線上磨課師課程的翻轉式學習⽅式。除⾃主線上學習外，另有⾯授教學，次數： 9
次，總時數： 18 ⼩時。⾯授課程採分組討論形式，重視互動共好式學習，避免無故缺席。課程為 2 學
分，不可與系上 3 學分必選課程投資學互抵。課程較為精簡，建議修課對象 : 必選課程修習國際財務
管理⽽沒機會接觸
投資學的同學，或雖無基礎但以計財系做為第⼆專⻑的學⼠班同學。也⿎勵任何對投資相關議題
有興趣的外系所同學選修。

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
【教學⽅式  Teaching Approach 】
包括 (但不限 ) 以下各部分 :
第⼀部分 :< 基礎課題講授 >
1.上課講義 ppt 介紹⾦融科技之技術、應⽤、服務和商業模式等各項基礎議題，
2. 並依上課內容指定書本閱讀章節，
第⼆部分 :< 專題企劃 >
1. 進⾏⾦融科技專題分組，⽅向擬定、商業模式設計，科技導入，效益評估，書⾯以及⼝頭報
告，
2. 期中以及期末組別報告，以⾦融領域專業知識、  資訊科技兩者共同輔助實現專題。
3. 導入專案設計客群分析模型  – SPIN
4. 導入專案設計效益思考模型  – FABE.
第三部分 :< 業師演講 >
1. 視學⽣專案⽅向，邀請相關實務界領袖與菁英演講，與學⽣交流互動，加深學習效果。
第四部分 :< 媒體素養、職場即戰⼒培養 >
1.每堂課內特別著重媒體閱讀培訓、應⽤解讀
2.適當課程說明⾦融科技與就業能⼒培訓與訓練
【評分標準  Grading 】
期末分數為以下各項項⽬總和
1. 課程參與  (15%)
2. 平時作業  (15%)
3. 期中書⾯報告  (15%)
4. 期末書⾯報告  (25%)
5. 期末⼩組發表  (30%)

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明：
計算⾦融可視為現代⾦融理論的主要實踐⽅法，它針對不同的應⽤問題發展出特定的演算法，其中有
些屬於古典，
有些則具研發的性質。本課程兼具⾦融研究與實務，介紹並定義相關的計算⾦融問題，探討適當的數
值⽅法（含
AI/ML, GPU, Quantum 等），再輔以實際財經資料加以驗證數學模型。
課程主軸包括
⾦融⼯程  (FE, Financial Engineering)
⾦融科技  (FT, Financial Technology)

Course Topics include but not limited to:
Modern Portfolio Theory
Mean-variance Model, and Black-Litterman Model
ETFs as Quantitative Investment
passive ETFs such as general and leverage/inversion ETFs, thematic ETFs such as ESG
AI Robo Advisor as Fintech’s Investment Management
feature engineering, AI prediction models, Robo Advisor
Hedging Strategies
portfolio insurance, hedging by futures and options
Miscellaneous: Risk Management, Digital Assets
Tail risk estimation (VaR/CVaR), systemic risk, stock tokenization
Previous Syllabus in this course
Introduction to programming languages such as Matlab, Python
Robo Advisor
Machine learning
How to calculate implied volatility
How to solve for Black-Scholes PDE
How to calculate VaR/CVaR
Extent to systemic risk
GPU Acceleration - Parallel Computing
Pricing exotic options
Advanced financial modeling(Stochastic volatility models, Levy processes)

522100學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：

中文名稱  Course Title ：⾦融商品設計與評價
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Financial product design and pricing
任課教師  Instructor ：張焯然
胡國琳
上課時間  Time ： T2T3T4 上課教室  Room ：台積 204 ／ 70
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程以討論衍⽣性⾦融商品定價的實證問題，以 Matlab, Gauss 及  VBA 軟體作為資產定價
計算之⼯具，將從衍⽣性⾦融商品有精確解 (exact solution) 模型談起，進⽽探討數值解
(numerical solution) 之模型，其中包括樹型圖解 (tree) 、蒙第卡羅法 (Monte Carlo) 以及有
限差分法 (finite difference) 。討論的模型從基本的 Black-Schole 、 CRR 、 Exotic option 以
及利率模型等。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Lyuu,Y.D. Financial Engineering & Computation: Principles, Mathematics,
Algorithms, 2002, Cambridge University Press.
Brandimarte, Paolo, Numerical Methods in Finance, 2002, Wiley Interscience
Publication. ( 滄海書局進⼝ )
Hull, John, Options, Futures, and Other Derivatives, 5th Edition, 2003,
Prentice Hall. ( 雙葉書局進⼝ )
三、參考書籍 (References)
Tavella, Domingo, Quantitative Methods in Derivatives Pricing: An
Introduction
to Computational Finance, 2002, Wiley.
Wilmott, Paul, Paul Wilmott Introduces Quantitative Finance, 2001, John
Wiley
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1.Exact solution: European (Black&Schole 、 Merton 、 Garman&Kohlhage 、 Black)
2.Binomial Tree: CRR(European 、 American 、 Asian)
3.Greek Analysis: Delta, Gamma, Theta, Vega, Rho
4.VaR
5.Monte Carlo: Exotic option 、 Look-back option
6.Yield curve: Nelson&Siegel
7.Finite Difference: Varsicek
8.Interest Model: CIR 、 Ho&Lee 、 Hull&White(Trinomial Tree) 、 BDT 、 HJM
9.Jump model: Merton
10.Approximate: Markov Chain 、 Quadratic
11.Information lecture: Implicit volatility 、 skewness premium 、 risk neutral
density

中文名稱  Course Title ：財務時間序列分析⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Financial Time Series II
任課教師  Instructor ：黃裕烈
上課時間  Time ： R6R7R8 上課教室  Room ：台積 206 ／ 62
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Financial Time Series Analysis II
成績考核
每個星期要交四份報告並且選讀  4 份期刊文章  (30%)
期中考  (30%)
期未考  (30%)
平時報告  (10%)
Course
This course introduces topics from research in financial time series econometrics. For each topic, econometric
methods are discussed and illustrated by empirical applications. After completion of the course the student will
have obtained a fundamental knowledge of continuous-time modeling as applied in research within asset
pricing theory. For each topic treated this will include: The ability to analyze the financial econometric models
such that their properties are well-understood from a methodological point of view. This will include theory
for estimation and testing, dynamic properties and linkage with applied literature.
General objectives
The general objectives for the course are:
1. be able to complete a major report that applies financial time series techniques in analyzing a financial
problem.
Instruction objectives
The instruction objectives are placed on a combination of the mathematical development of continuous-time
models and their application to financial data. At the end of the course, students should:
1. be able to analyze financial data statistically;
2. be able to estimate equations and test assumptions of the stochastic differential equations;
3. be able to manipulate features of the computer package.
Course Outline
1. Stochastic Processes and Stochastic Differential Equations
2. Numerical Methods for SDE
3. Parametric Estimation
6. Other Topics
Office Hours
Thursday morning or by appointment.
Textbook
The required readings in this course are:
1. Kerry Back, (2005), A Course in Derivative Securities: Introduction to Theory and Computation, Springer.

511000學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：

中文名稱  Course Title ：⼩說創作專題
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Seminar on Fiction Writing
任課教師  Instructor ：蔣興立
上課時間  Time ： M7M8M9 上課教室  Room ：南⼤ 2301 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description) 撰寫重點如下：
1. 數位時代，我們終⽇置⾝於龐雜紛擾的訊息之中，過量的資訊變成無⽤的碎屑，轉瞬消逝，對⼈
們毫無影響。為了加強訊息的重量感，故事⼒變得重要，故事能產⽣溫度與熱能，提升⼈事物的價
值，創造出認同感，引發共鳴與感動，擴⼤影響性，本課程將以⼩說為例介紹說故事的⽅法。
2.培養學⽣文本細讀、獨立思辯、蒐集資料、文學創作的能⼒。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Book)
教師⾃編教材

四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
1.本課程以教師講授為主，並根據不同的探討議題，設計相關問題，讓學⽣討論，反思與辯證。
2.期中安排個⼈⼝頭報告，導讀⼀篇分析⼩說的論文。
3.本課程將安排⼀次期末書⾯報告，修課同學均需撰寫⼀篇⼩說，或⼀篇分析⼩說的論文。
4.配合彈性學期週數試⾏計畫，將 18 週課程內容融入 16 週，由中⾼強度學習提升為⾼強度學習，訓
練學⽣⾃主性學習與獨立思考的能⼒。具體課程規劃如下：
(1).文本內容導讀的部分，由學⽣於課前預習，再由教師於課堂上作重點導讀與討論，並作相
關的補充。
(2).原本設計在課後進⾏的「問題與討論」，提前將問題公布於教學平台上，縮減在課堂上耗
費思考的時間，改成在課堂中直接進⾏討論。
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
第1週：課程內容說明與評量⽅式講解
第2週：說故事的⼩說家
分析⼩說與其他文類的差異，討論⼩說家如何說故事，介紹⼩說的開場⽩。
討論文本：愛德華．摩根．佛斯特著，蘇希亞譯：《⼩說⾯⾯觀》
第3-4週：好故事的結構與基本元素
為什麼要說故事？什麼是好故事？好故事與壞故事的差別為何？
閱讀文本：《列⼦ ‧ 湯問第五》「偃師造⼈」、李渝〈倡⼈仿⽣〉
第5-6週：敘事觀點的選擇
誰來說故事？替換敘事者會讓故事產⽣何種變貌？從⼩說作品裡舉例說明如何選擇敘事者，讓故事說
得更精彩。
閱讀文本：平路〈猜猜，他想要換什麼？〉
第7週：與⼈物交⼼
你是誰？你能寫出什麼樣的⼈物？你覺得什麼樣的⼈物有魅⼒？採訪你⾃⼰，採訪你想寫的⼈物。
閱讀文本：神⼩風《百分之九⼗八的平庸少女》
第8週：⼈物的塑造
本節課思考如何透過情節、對⽩、⾏為動作、⼈物與⼈物的碰撞塑造⼈物的性格與特質。
閱讀文本：袁瓊瓊〈蛞蝓與它的鹽〉
第9週：⼈物與地⽅的對話
你來⾃何處？⼈物如何與環境交融？如何對故事背景進⾏⽥野調查？
閱讀文本：史鐵⽣〈命若琴弦〉
第10週：期中論文導讀
第11週：衝突的必要性
⾓⾊在乎這件事才會有衝突，思考個⼈與⾃⼰的衝突、個⼈與他⼈的衝突、個⼈與其他團體的衝突。
閱讀文本：袁哲⽣〈秀才的⼿錶〉
第12週：製造驚奇、結局設定與主題分析
為你的故事發想驚奇、⾼潮，分析結局與主題的關係，從結局設計故事，分析主題的表現技巧。
閱讀文本：葛亮〈謎鴉〉
第13-14週：故事時間與敘事時間
探討故事時間與敘事時間的錯位與變形，討論⼩說裡的時間運⽤。
閱讀文本：余華〈⼗八歲出⾨遠⾏〉
第15-16週：期末報告
成果發表

511400學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：

中文名稱  Course Title ：現代詩創作專題
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Special study on modern poetry writing
任課教師  Instructor ：丁威仁
上課時間  Time ： W2W3W4 上課教室  Room ：南⼤ 2301 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明：
本課程的講授共分三個部分：理論閱讀與作品賞析、個⼈創作，將就各項主題選取重要詩⼈及其代表
作品進⾏專
題選讀，同時也進⾏現代詩創作理論的理解，並教導學⽣新詩的分析與創作⽅法：包括語調、韻律與
節奏，分
⾏、空格與標點的運⽤，意象句的創造、想像與象徵等等，提升對於文本的論述能⼒，與現代詩的書
寫能⼒，更
重要的是將會在此⾨課進⾏各類型的實際創作，希望透過這⾨課的修習，與彼此作品的討論，學⽣能
夠產⽣⾃⾝
現代詩的創作呈現。（簡單來說就是不斷寫詩與討論彼此作品的課啦！）
指定⽤書與參考書籍：無，會印製講義，同時會開列書單。
教學進度（暫定）：
第⼀週  授課說明與正式上課
第⼆週  現代詩寫作的三個頂點 —— 等邊三⾓形理論
第三週  意象與意象思維
第四週  ⼩詩怎麼寫 —— 關於截句定義的可不可⾏
第五週  ⼩詩創作與討論
第六週  短詩的書寫 —— ⼀起來寫情詩
第七週  情詩創作與討論（⼀）
第八週  誰說⼀定要⽤寫的 —— 圖象詩、攝影詩與其他可能
第九週  圖象詩創作與討論
第⼗週  就把詩拉⻑ —— 從旅⾏、地景到地誌詩
第⼗⼀週  地誌詩創作與討論
第⼗⼆週  ⼝語、廢話如何成詩 —— 來跟⼤家道晚安
第⼗三週  ⼝語詩創作與討論
第⼗四週  散文詩是什麼？
第⼗五週  散文詩創作與討論
第⼗六週  童詩怎麼寫？（繳交模擬文學獎詩作⽇）
第⼗七週  童詩創作與討論
第⼗八週  文學獎在幹什麼 —— ？模擬文學獎
教學⽅式（暫定）：
理論講述與討論、作品分析與討論、實作與報告
評量⽅式：
上課參與百分之四⼗
實作與報告百分之六⼗

科號  Course Number ： 11120SOC
575800學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：經濟社會學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Economic Sociology
任課教師  Instructor ：陳明祺  CHEN MING CHI
上課時間  Time ： F3F4Fn 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C306 ／ 30
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
經濟社會學（碩⼠班）
上學期
三學分
授課教師：陳明祺
經濟社會學主要探討經濟現象的社會特性，從社會結構、政治、與制度等⾯向來
了解⼈類社會中微觀層⾯的經濟⾏為與經濟組織，以及宏觀層⾯的經濟變遷。本
課程⼀⽅⾯重訪從 Adam Smith, Karl Marx, Max Weber, Emile Durkheim 到 Karl
Polayi等古典經濟社會學者的核⼼關懷，另⼀⽅⾯則以批判的觀點省思由 Mark
Granovetter, Richard Swedberg, Viviana Zelizer 等當代經濟社會學者強調從社會鑲
嵌、信任、控制、社會資本以及經濟活動的意義脈絡等新經濟社會學的核⼼概念
來分析當代資本主義的嘗試。這堂課還會碰觸到諸如經濟體系的多重制度樣貌、
商品與消費、空間與經濟等議題。本課程不預設任何背景，但是如果具備社會學
古典理論和個體經濟學的知識將有益於瞭解指定教材的內容。
導論與經典
1. Neo-liberal Economic Assumptions about the Individual and Society
R26; Friedman, Milton and Rose Friedman, “The Power of the Market” in Free to
Choose N.Y.: Harcourt, Brace Jovanovich, 1980, pp. 9-37.
R26; E. Roy Weintraub, “Neoclassical Economics”.
R26; Gary Becker, “The Economic Way of Looking at Life” in Torsten Persson
(ed.) Nobel Lectures: Economics, 1991-1997 Singapore, World Scientific
Publishing Co., 1997.
R26; Albert Hirschman. 1985. “Against Parsimony: Three Easy Ways of
Complicating Some Categories of Economic Discourse.” Economics and
Philosophy 1: 7-21.
R26; Daniel Kahneman. 1994. “New Challenges to the Rationality Assumption.”
Journal of Institutional and Theoretical Economics 150: 18-36.
2. Introduction: How Social is Economy?

pp. xiii-xli in Mark Granovetter and Richard Swedberg (eds.), The Sociology
of Economic Life.

`clean models.' " Theory and Society 16(3):317-36.
3. Founding Ideas: Adam Smith, Karl Marx, Emile Durkheim, and Max
Weber

⼀卷第 1、 2 、 7 章。
R26; Karl Marx. 1990(1867). “The fetishism of the commodity and its secret,”
in Capital, Volume 1, translated by Ben Fowkes, London: Penguin, pp.
163-177. ( 中譯文⾒，《資本論》第⼀卷，吳家駟譯，台北：時報文化，
⾴87-101 。 )

Section II (page 154-165 in the 1984 Free Press version).
R26; Max Weber （韋伯）著，康樂，簡惠美譯，基督新教倫理與資本主義精
神，台北市：遠流，⾴ 79-97 ， 104-143 ， 181-227 。
4. Polanyi and Economic Systems
R26; Polanyi, Karl. 1957. The Great Transformation: the Political and
Economic Origins of Our Time. Boston: Beacon Press. Ch. 4-6. ( 中譯
為《鉅變：當代政治、經濟的起源》，黃樹⺠、⽯佳⾳、廖立文譯，台
北：遠流出版。另外  第五、六兩章有新的譯文，⾒反市場的資本主義，
許寶強、渠敬東編，香港： Oxford University Press ，⾴ 1-31 。 )
R26; Polanyi, Karl. 1944. “Societies and Economic Systems.” Pp. 45-58 in The
Great Transformation.
R26; Polanyi, Karl. 1947. “Our Obsolete Market Mentality.” Pp. 59-77 in
Primitive, Archaic, and Modern Economies.
R26; Polanyi, Karl. 1957. “The Economy as Instituted Process.” Pp. 243-270
in Trade and Market in the Early Empires. ( 中譯文⾒〈經濟：制度化的
過程〉，收錄於許寶強、渠敬東選編，《反市場的資本主義》，香港： Oxford
University Press ，⾴ 33-62 。 )
R26; Fred Block and Margaret R. Somers. 2014. The Power of Market
Fundamentalism: Karl Polanyi’s Critique. Harvard University Press, chapter 1,
“Karl Polanyi and the Power of Ideas,” pp.1-43.
Recommended:
R26; Somers, Margaret. and Fred Block. 2005. “From Poverty to Perversity: Ideas,

Sociological Review 70(2):260-87.

中文名稱  Course Title ：應⽤多變量分析
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Applied Multivariate Analysis
任課教師  Instructor ：謝文萍
上課時間  Time ： R2R3R4 上課教室  Room ：綜三  837 ／ 80
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Instructor: Wen-Ping Hsieh
Reference
Johnson, R.A. and Wichern, D.W. Applied Multivariate Statistical Analysis.
Sixth Edition, 2007. Pearson Prentice Hall. ISBN 0-13-187715-1.
Brian Everitt, Torsten Hothorn. An introduction to applied multivariate
analysis with R, 2011. Springer.
Tentative Schedule
‧Introduction
‧Graphical displays, principal components, multidimensional scaling
‧Multivariate normal distribution
‧Extension of linear model to multivariate response: Hotelling T2 and MANOVA
‧Factor analysis
‧Cluster analysis: Kmeans, Hierarchical Clustering
‧Correspondence analysis
‧Canonical correlation analysis
objectives of the course
Students taking this course will learn about the techniques of displaying and
analyzing multivariate data. We will introduce the theories underlying these
methods, and applications will be followed to make it clear. Demonstration
with R or SAS will be provided. Students can choose their preferred software
to solve the problems.
Prerequisite
Students are assumed to have knowledge of linear algebra, calculus, some basic
ideas of probability theory, statistical inference and linear models.
科號  Course Number ：
11120STAT521000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：時間序列分析
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Time Series Analysis
任課教師  Instructor ：銀慶剛
上課時間  Time ： M5M6F7 上課教室  Room ：綜三  837 ／ 80
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course attempts to give a systematic account of several important time
series models and their applications to the modelling and prediction of data
obtained sequentially in time. Topics to be covered include: time series
regression and exploratory data analysis, a brief review of linear
(regression)models, autoregressive moving average models, estimation and
prediction in the time domain, nonstationary time series analysis, ARCH models,
GARCH models, and regression models with time series error.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
1. William WS Wei (2006). Time Series Analysis : Univariate and Multivariate
Methods (2nd Edition), Addison Wesley.
2. P. J. Brockwell and R. A. Davis (1987). Time Series: Theory and Methods,
Springer-Verlag.
3. R. H. Shumway and D. S. Stoffer (2006). Time Series Analysis and Its
Applications, Springer.
三、參考書籍 (References)
4. W. A. Fuller (1996). Introduction to statistical Time Series, Wiley.
5. J. D. Hamilton (1994). Time Series Analysis, Princeton.
6. C.-K. Ing's lecture notes in statistical inference.
http://mx.nthu.edu.tw/~cking/
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)( 必填 )
⼝述
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)( 必填 )
1. Time Series Regression and Exploratory Data Analysis
2. Review of linear (regression) models
3. Stationary Time Series, Regression Analysis, Autocorrelation Function (ACF)
and Partial Autocorrelation Function (PACF)
4. Autoregressive Models: Modelling and Point Estimation
5. Autoregressive Models: Interval Estimation
6. Prediction and Model Selection
7. An Introduction to Nonlinear Least Squares Estimates
8. ARMA Model: Modelling, Estimation and Prediction
9. Nonstationary Time Series
10. ARCH and GARCH models
11. Regression model with time series error
12. Multivariate Time Series
13. An Introduction to High-Dimensional Time Series

課程⼤綱 Detailed Course Syllabus
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
1. Introduce some commonly used data analysis models and methods, especially for
nonnegative integer type data. The course also covers general cluster analysis and
multivariate analysis.
2. The main goal is to enhance student's ability to analyze data correctly
3. Knowledge of programming language and basic statistical theory is required.
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Holmes, S. and Huber H. (2018). Modern Statistics for Modern Biology,
Available at: https://web.stanford.edu/class/bios221/book/introduction.html

Elsevier.
MacKenzie, D. I., Nichols, J. D., Royle, J. A., Pollock, K. H., Bailey, L.

and dynamics of species occurrence. Elsevier.

linear, mixed effects and nonparametric regression.
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures, discussions, computer practice
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
CONTENTS:
1. Probability models for count data
2. Graphics in R
3. Mixture models
4. Clustering

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Syllabus: Topics include both frequentist and Bayesian aspects of inference, statistical decision theory, point
estimation, minimax and admissibility, exponential families, hypothesis testing, confidence intervals, small
and large sample theory, empirical processes, and M-estimation.
Teaching Method: traditional paper and blackboard format.
There will be weekly homework assignments.
Grading (tentative): Attendance-- 5%, Homework Assignments-- 30%,
Midterm Exam-- 30% Final Exam-- 35%

中文名稱  Course Title ：輔導原理與實務
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Principle and Practice of Guidance
任課教師  Instructor ：林旖旎
上課時間  Time ： T7T8 上課教室  Room ：教  315 ／ 42
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course title: Theory and Practice of Counseling
Institute: Center for Teacher Education, Spring/2023
Location: Room 315, Education Building
Instructor: Yii-Nii Lin, Ph.D.
Office: Room 214, Education Building
Phone: (03) 5742451 (office), E-mail: ynlin@mx.nthu.edu.tw
Class hours: 15:30 to 17:20 p.m. Tuesdays
Office hours: 13:00-14:00 p.m. Tuesdays and by appointment
Course Purpose:
Counseling theory and practice is a course designed to provide an overview of
the basic theoretical components of guidance, counseling, and psychotherapy,
as well as to foster increased of understanding of the interactions between
client and counselor/psychotherapist, and between individual internal mental
activities and external environment.
Course objectives: This is an introductory course and so will cover a broad
range of material. With this in mind, the objectives are to provide students
with:
1. Understanding the definition of guidance, counseling and psychotherapy, and
the differentiation between these branches.
2. Understanding individual nature in aspects of physical, mental and
social/cultural status and how the interactions among these aspects generate
problems.
3. Understanding psychological mechanism of mental health and the interactions
among biological, psychological, social and cultural factors.
4. Understanding basic concepts and applications of psychological
diagnosis/assessment/evaluation.
5. Understanding different ways of enhancing individual mental health through
guidance, counseling and psychotherapy.
6. Understanding how to develop individual style of integrating various
approaches of counseling and psychotherapy to create a personal and eclectic
style.
7. Understanding the processes and outcomes of counseling and psychotherapy
8. Understanding the limitations and resource usage of counseling and
psychotherapy
Indicators of Competency in Teacher Education:
Psychological and counseling competency (being aware of student
characteristics and providing timing guidance)
Educational concern, research and multicultural competency (multicultural
knowledge, attitude and skills)
Competency of Self-growth and development (passion in professional life and
growth in personal life)
Accommodations:
I would like to hear from who has a disability, which may require some
modification of seating, testing, or other class requirements so that
appropriate arrangements may be made. Please see me after class or during my
office hours.

Procedures for filling student complaints are explained in University

The collegiate policy on plagiarism and cheating is outlined in the University

Respect for Diversity:
It is the intent of the instructor to present material and activities that are
respectful of diversity: gender, sexuality, disability, age, socio-economic
status, ethnicity, race, and culture.
Textbooks:
Required:
諮商與⼼理治療 : 理論與實務  (2016) 。修慧蘭審訂。雙葉書廊。
Recommended
Corey, G. (2016). Theory and Practice of Counseling and Psychotherapy.
Brooks/Cole Pub Co (USA).
林家興  (2019) 。諮商與⼼理治療實務。⼼理出版社。
⽣命抉擇與個⼈成⻑  (2018) 。陳嘉鳳總校閱。雙葉書廊。
Course Format:
The first half of the class will consist of didactic presentation and group
discussion. The second half of the class will be practice- and activity-
oriented. In brief, the course will combine the use of lectures, discussion,
and experiential activities.
Course Requirements:
1. Actively participate in class discussion, activities, and
demonstrations.
2. Read the selected assignments in their entirety, coming to class
prepared to discuss the readings as outlined on the schedule.
3. Read related news/messages of counseling, guidance and psychotherapy,
and share them with members in classes.
4. Complete several role plays, two reaction papers, a simulation of
counseling session and its sharing, a final exam and an individual project.
Turn in papers and project on time.
5. The format of the reaction paper includes (1) contents, (2) analyses
and discussions of a case or an issue related to counseling, guidance, and
psychotherapy.
The format of the individual project will contain (1) a statement of
individual personality traits and behavioral styles, (2) a statement of one
or
several counseling theories and techniques, and (3) an integration to
formulate a personal guidance/counseling (eclectic) style, and related
analyses/discussions.
The sharing of the simulation of counseling session will reveal (1) a brief
introduction of its contents and (2) analyses and discussions of this
counseling session (process and outcome).
6. Role plays will be implemented in the second phase of the classes.
7. The format of final exam will be discussed in the class.
8. No mobile phones or 3C electronics could be used in classes.
Grading:
Attendance and participation 15
Role plays in classes 15
Reaction Paper (I and II) 20
Project (a case report) 20
Simulation and Sharing 10
Final Exam 20
Total 100

中文名稱  Course Title ： STEAM 教學設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： STEAM Instructional Design
任課教師  Instructor ：劉樹忠
上課時間  Time ： R5R6 上課教室  Room ：教  315 ／ 42
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明 (Course Description)
STEAM is an educational approach to learning that uses Science, Technology,
Engineering, the Arts and Mathematics as access points for guiding student
inquiry, dialogue, and critical thinking. The perpuse or results of STEAM are
students who take
thoughtful risks, engage in experiential learning, persist in problem-solving,
embrace collaboration, and work through the creative process. These are the
innovators, educators, leaders, and learners of the 21st century! As a new kind
of teadher in future, training or experience on STEAM-style coures is a good
essential preparation. 這⾨課程設計可以做為未來國⾼中素養選修課的預備。
指定⽤書 (Text Books)
No.
參考書籍 (References)

● 課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程除介紹⾃主學習理論以及教育重要政策⽅向，另要求師資⽣進⾏⾃主學習實地⾒習、實作
演練。內容包括教學與引導、評量⽅法、計畫規劃、⾃主學習形式、反思與批判、盤點與整合資源、
以及數位學習環境與⾃主學習等。

課程說明 (Course Description)
1. 課堂討論

參考書籍 (References)

林進材  、林香河。教育實習的理論與實務 ─ 成為合格教師
劉世雄。教育實習與教師之路：成為教師的⼗四堂課
教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
本課程為兩學分、每週 2 ⼩時的課程，課程內容包含模擬教學、⾒習與試教活動。
每週以安排⾒習 4 ⼩時為原則，整學期⾄少試教 1 堂課，授課教師可視情況彈性調整。
※中等學校實地學習時數⾄少 54 ⼩時：師資⽣需於修習教育專業課程期間⾄中等學校⾒習、試教、實
習、補救教學、課業輔導或服務學習⾄少 54 ⼩時，並經由師培中⼼認定其內容符合教育專業知能。

科號  Course Number ： 11120TEE
103101學分  Credit ： 2⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
40
中文名稱  Course Title ：英語
英文名稱  Course English Title ： English
任課教師  Instructor ：洪雅慧
上課時間  Time ： R5R6 上課教室  Room ：南⼤ 9207 ／ 48
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
This course provides an integrated-skills program to develop English skills,
critical thinking, and learning strategies required for students’ academic
success. With the carefully-guided language lessons, real-world stories, and
updated videos, this course helps the students expand their overall fluency
while developing the tools and strategies necessary for effective, real-world
communication. English-education related topics are discussed, and students are
encouraged to take Bilingual Teaching Teacher Training Courses. This course
provides students opportunities for practicing English from different
perspectives and students are expected respond to the unit theme and express
their own ideas confidently in English. Besides, exam-style task types and test-
taking strategies are designed to prepare students for a range of language-
proficiency exams.
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Douglas, N.& Morgan, J.R. World Class (1). Cengage Learning
● 參考書籍 (References)
1. English Grammar in Use: A Self-Study Reference and Practice Book for
Intermediate Learners of English: With Answers
2. Reading-strategy related books
3. English Dictionaries (digital or paper-based)
4. TED Talks
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
⼀、 Lecture( 理論講述與討論 ) (30%)
⼆、 Discussion ( 個案分析與作品賞析 ) (20%)
三、 In-class Activities & Assignments
(⾏動實作與報告 ) (50%)

中文名稱  Course Title ：視覺藝術
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Visual Arts
任課教師  Instructor ：葉俊顯

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、  課程說明 (Course Description)
視覺藝術（ Visual Arts ），是以視覺⽬的為創作重點的⼀種藝術形式，包括了繪畫、⼯藝、建
築、陶藝，⼯業設計、平⾯設計、雕塑 … 等。本課程是以探索各種不同的藝術創作⽅式，以培養學
⽣藝術知能，陶冶⽣活情趣，表現個⼈創作想像與情感。包含了解與應⽤基本造型媒材特性、技巧
與程序，體驗⼿創之價值，以增進相關知識與能⼒，培養造形設計與解決問題能⼒。進⽽擴展藝術
知能 ,了解物我關係，提升⽣活品質，達到⽣活藝術化、藝術⽣活化的理想。
⼆、  指定⽤書 (Text Books)
無

中文名稱  Course Title ：國⺠⼩學數學教材教法

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
教學進度 (Syllabus) ：
1. 國⼩數學教學概觀  (introduction to mathematics teaching)
2. 整數的教學知識與教學⽅法  (developing knowledge of teaching whole number and
place values)
3. 分數的教學知識與教學⽅法  (developing knowledge of teaching fractions)
4. ⼩數的教學知識與教學⽅法  (developing knowledge of teaching decimals)
5. 幾何的教學知識與教學⽅法  (developing knowledge of teaching geometry)
6. 量與實測、時間的教學知識與教學⽅法  (developing knowledge of teaching
measurement)
7. 比和比例的教學知識與教學⽅法  (developing knowledge of teaching ratio and
proportion)
8. 因倍數的教學知識與教學⽅法  (developing knowledge of teaching factors and
multiples)
9. 代數的教學知識與教學⽅法  (developing knowledge of teaching algebra)
10.概數的教學知識與教學⽅法  (developing knowledge of teaching mental computation
and estimation)
11.統計的教學知識與教學⽅法  (developing knowledge of teaching statistics)
12.虛擬教學  (teaching simulation)
13.課室觀察  (classroom observation)
14.教案撰寫  (writing lesson plans)
15. watching 360 classroom teaching videos
16. watching 360 classroom teaching videos
17. watching 360 classroom teaching videos
18. Discussion
成績考核 (Evaluation)
1.Teaching simulation (20%)
2.作業 (60%) ： assignments (60%)
3.出席率與課堂表現  (20%) ： class attendance, participation, and performance (20%)

專業素養  專業素養指標
■1.瞭解教育發展的與實務
■1-1 瞭解有關教育⽬的和價值的主要或思想，以建構⾃⾝的教育與信⼼。
■1-2.敏銳覺察社會環境對學⽣學習影響，以及教育機會均等。
■1-3.瞭解我國教育政策和法規與學校實務，以作為教育實踐基礎。
■2.瞭解並尊重學習者的發展與學習需求
■2-1 瞭解並尊重學⽣⾝⼼發展、社經及文化背景的差異，以作為教學與輔導的依據。
■2-2 瞭解並運⽤學習原，以符合學⽣個別學習需求與發展。
■2-3 瞭解特殊需求學⽣的特質與鑑定歷程，以提供適的教育與⽀持。
■3.規劃適當的課程、教學及多元評
■3-1 依據課程綱要 / ⼤綱、課程及教學原，以規劃素養導向課程、教學與評量。
■3-2 依據課程綱要 / ⼤綱、課程及教學原理，以協同發展跨域 / 群科 / 科⽬課程、教學與評量。
■3-3 具備任教領域 / 群科 / 科⽬所需的專⾨知與學科教學知能，以進教學。
■3-4 掌握社會變遷趨勢與議題，以融入課程與教學。
■3-5 應⽤多元教學策、教學媒材與學習科技，以促進學⽣有效學習。
■3-6 根據多元評量結果調整課程與教學，以提升學⽣學習成效。
□4.正向學習環境並適性輔導
□4-1 應⽤正向⽀持原理，共創安全、友善及對話的班級與學習環境，以養成學⽣好品格及有效學
習。
□4-2 應⽤輔導原理與技巧進⾏學⽣輔導，以促進適性發展。
□5.認同並實踐教師專業
□5-1 思辨與認同教師專業，以維護學⽣福祉。
□5-2 透過教育實踐關懷弱勢學⽣，以體認教師專業⾓⾊。
■5-3 透過教育實踐與省思，以發展溝通、團隊合作、題解決及持續專業成⻑的意願與能。
